{g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}Ability scores{/g}: {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Str{/g} 14, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dex{/g} 14, {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Con{/g} 13, {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Int{/g} 2, {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wis{/g} 13, {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Cha{/g} 7
At 7th level, a mastodon's size becomes Large and it gains Str +8, Dex –2, Con +4, +3 to its natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to AC, and the trample (2d6) and overrun abilities.

column2: At 4th level, whenever a rogue deals sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to a foe, she can also debilitate the target of her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, causing it to take a {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (this is in addition to any penalty caused by a rogue talent or other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g}). The rogue can choose to apply any one of the following penalties when the damage is dealt.

column1: Bewildered: The target becomes bewildered, taking a –2 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The target takes an additional –2 penalty to AC against all attacks made by the rogue. At 10th level and 16th level, the penalty to AC against attacks made by the rogue increases by –2 (to a total maximum of –8).

Disoriented: The target takes a –2 penalty on attack rolls. In addition, the target takes an additional –2 penalty on all attack rolls it makes against the rogue. At 10th level and 16th level, the penalty on attack rolls made against the rogue increases by –2 (to a total maximum of –8).
Hampered: All of the target's speeds are reduced by half (to a minimum of 5 feet).

These penalties don't stack with themselves, but additional attacks that deal sneak attack damage extend the duration by 1 round. A creature cannot suffer from more than one penalty from this ability at a time. If a new penalty is applied, the old penalty immediately ends. Any form of {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} applied to a target suffering from one of these penalties also removes the penalty.
column2: Na 4. úrovni: Kdykoli Rogue způsobíš přepadovým {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} nepříteli, můžeš také oslabit cíl svého {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, způsobíce mu {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} na 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (toto je navíc k jakémukoli postihu způsobenému talentem Rogue nebo jinou {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g}). Rogue si může při způsobení poškození vybrat uplatnit jednu z následujících penalizací.
The spirit hunter can add the {g|EnhancementFlaming}flaming{/g} property to a weapon, but this consumes 1 point of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.

column1: A flaming weapon is sheathed in fire that deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} on a successful hit. The fire does not harm the wielder.
column2: Lovec duchů může přidat ke zbrani vlastnost {g|EnhancementFlaming}flaming{/g}, ale to spotřebuje 1 bod enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} udělený této zbrani.
The spirit hunter can add the cold property to a weapon, but this consumes 1 point of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.

column1: A {g|EnhancementFrost}frost{/g} weapon is sheathed in a terrible, icy cold that deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} on a successful hit. The cold does not harm the wielder.
column2: Lovec duchů může přidat ke zbrani vlastnost {g|EnhancementFrost}frost{/g}, ale to spotřebuje 1 bod enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} udělený této zbrani.
The spirit hunter can add the {g|EnhancementGhostTouch}ghost touch{/g} property to a weapon, but this consumes 1 point of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.

column1: A ghost touch weapon deals {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally against {g|ConditionIncorporeal}incorporeal{/g} creatures, regardless of its bonus. An incorporeal creature's 50% reduction in damage from corporeal sources does not apply to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made against it with ghost touch weapons.
column2: Lovec duchů může přidat ke zbrani vlastnost {g|EnhancementGhostTouch}ghost touch{/g}, ale to spotřebuje 1 bod enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} udělený této zbrani.
The spirit hunter can add the {g|EnhancementKeen}keen{/g} property to a weapon, but this consumes 1 point of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.

column1: The keen property doubles the {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}threat range{/g} of a weapon. This benefit doesn't stack with any other effects that expand the threat range of a weapon (such as the {g|SpellsKeenEdge}keen edge{/g} spell or the Improved Critical {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}).
column2: Lovec duchů může přidat ke zbrani vlastnost {g|EnhancementKeen}keen{/g}, ale to spotřebuje 1 bod enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} udělený této zbrani.
The spirit hunter can add the {g|EnhancementShocking}shocking{/g} property to a weapon, but this consumes 1 point of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.

column1: A shock weapon is sheathed in crackling electricity that deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} on a successful hit. The electricity does not harm the wielder.
column2: Lovec duchů může přidat ke zbrani vlastnost {g|EnhancementShocking}shocking{/g}, ale to spotřebuje 1 bod enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} udělený této zbrani.
The spirit hunter can add the {g|EnhancementSpeed}speed{/g} property to a weapon, but this consumes 3 points of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.

column1: When making a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, the wielder of a speed weapon may make one extra attack with it. The attack uses the wielder's full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}, plus any modifiers appropriate to the situation. (This benefit is not cumulative with similar effects, such as a {g|SpellsHaste}haste{/g} spell.)
column2: Lovec duchů může přidat ke zbrani vlastnost {g|EnhancementSpeed}speed{/g}, ale to spotřebuje 3 body enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} udělené této zbrani.

At 1st level a spirit hunter can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, grant a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for 1 minute to any weapon she is holding. For every four levels beyond 1st, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +5 at 17th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon enhancement to a maximum of +5. Effects of multiple uses of this ability don't stack.

column1: At 1st level, the bonus can be used to add {g|EnhancementGhostTouch}ghost touch{/g} special ability to the weapon.

At 5th level, these bonuses can be used to add any of the following weapon special abilities: {g|EnhancementFlaming}flaming{/g}, {g|EnhancementFrost}frost{/g}, {g|EnhancementKeen}keen{/g}, {g|EnhancementShocking}shock{/g}, or {g|EnhancementSpeed}speed{/g}.

Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's base price modifier. These special abilities are added to any the weapon already has, but duplicates don't stack. If the weapon is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other special abilities can be added. These bonuses and special abilities are decided when the ability is used and cannot be changed until the next time the spirit hunter uses this ability. These bonuses do not function if the weapon is wielded by anyone other than the spirit hunter.
A spirit hunter can only enhance one weapon at a time with this ability. If she uses this ability again, the first use immediately ends.
This ability can be used a number of times per day equal to half the spirit hunter level plus her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
column2: Na 1. úrovni můžeš jako {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} udělit libovolné zbrani, kterou držíš, +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} na 1 minutu. Za každé čtyři úrovně nad 1. zbraň získá další +1 enhancement bonus, až do maxima +5 na 17. úrovni. Tyto bonusy lze přidat ke zbrani, sčítají se s existujícími zlepšeními zbraně až do maxima +5. Účinky vícenásobného použití této schopnosti se nesčítají.

At 14th level, a dragonblood shifter's ties to her draconic abilities grow stronger. Her {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against sleep and {g|ConditionParalyzed}paralysis{/g} effects increases to +4. Her wild shape ability now functions as the {g|SpellsDragonkindII}dragonkind II{/g} spell.

column1: She becomes a {g|Encyclopedia:Size}large{/g} dragon-like creature. She gains a +6 polymorph bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +4 polymorph bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +6 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, immunity to difficult terrain, a breath weapon, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 5/magic, and resistance to one element. Her movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 10 feet. She also gains one bite ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g}), two claws (1d6), two secondary wing attacks (1d6) (secondary attacks do not benefit from shifter claws), and one tail slap attack (1d8). Her breath weapon and resistance depend on the type of her dragon prototype. She can only use the breath weapon once per 1d4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. All breath weapons deal 8d8 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and allow a Reflex save for half damage.

This ability lasts for 1 hour (the Master Shapeshifter mythic ability makes this duration permanent). Using dragon shape is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that does not cause {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. The dragonblood shifter can use dragon shape a number of times per day equal to her shifter level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
This replaces greater chimeric aspect.
column2: Na 14. úrovni se tvé vazby na dračí schopnosti posílí. Tvůj {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} na {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} proti účinkům spánku a {g|ConditionParalyzed}paralýze{/g} se zvýší na +4. Tvá schopnost wild shape nyní funguje jako kouzlo {g|SpellsDragonkindII}dragonkind II{/g}.
When a fiendflesh shifter uses her fiendish aspect ability, she can gain an additional ability. The fiendflesh shifter can change which ability she gains each time she uses fiendish aspect.

column1: Demon: Cold {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} equal to the resistance provided by her fiendish resilience ability and a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} with {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g}. The fiendflesh shifter also gains a +4 inherent bonus to her {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} score and increases the damage die of all natural {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} by one category.
column2: Když fiendflesh shifter použije svou schopnost fiendish aspect, může získat dodatečnou schopnost. Fiendflesh shifter si může při každém použití fiendish aspect zvolit, kterou schopnost získá.
When a fiendflesh shifter uses her fiendish aspect ability, she can gain an additional ability. The fiendflesh shifter can change which ability she gains each time she uses fiendish aspect.

column1: Devil: A +4 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 profane bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throws{/g}. The fiendflesh shifter also gains a +4 inherent bonus to her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} score and immunity to {g|ConditionBlind}blindness{/g}.
column2: Když fiendflesh shifter použije svou schopnost fiendish aspect, může získat dodatečnou schopnost. Fiendflesh shifter si může při každém použití fiendish aspect zvolit, kterou schopnost získá.

At 1st level, a fiendflesh shifter can temporarily transform her body into an amalgam of otherworldly {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}evil{/g} creatures as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. While in this form, the fiendflesh shifter gains a gore attack that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (1d4 points of damage if the fiendflesh shifter is Small) and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 1/good. She can maintain this form for a number of minutes per day equal to 3 + her shifter level. The duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be spent in 1-minute increments.

column1: At 5th level, the fiendflesh shifter's DR increases to 2/good, and she also grows a pair of bat-like wings when in her fiendish aspect, granting her immunity to ground-based effects.

At 10th level, the fiendflesh shifter's DR increases to 5/good, and the electricity and fire {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} provided by her fiendish resilience ability doubles while she is in her fiendish aspect.
At 15th level, the fiendflesh shifter's DR increases to 7/good, and she gains a +4 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throws{/g}.

At 20th level, the fiendflesh shifter's DR increases to 10/good. She also gains {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to electricity and fire and {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to 15 + her shifter level.
This replaces wild shape, shifter aspect, and all improvements to shifter aspect.
column2: Na 1. úrovni se fiendflesh shifter může jako {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} dočasně proměnit v amalgám jiných zlovolných bytostí. Během této podoby získáš gore útok, který způsobí {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} bodů {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (1d4 bodu poškození, pokud jsi Small) a {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 1/good. Můžeš tuto podobu udržovat celkově počet minut za den roven 3 + tvá úroveň shifter. Doba trvání nemusí být souvislá, ale musí být čerpána po minutových úsecích.

The griffonheart shifter flies straight at her opponent. This ability functions and counts as charging, except that it does not require a clear path to the target and can only be used in combat. This {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} also gives an additional +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on attack and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made as part of the charge.

column1: Charging is a special {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} that allows you to move up to double your normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} and attack during the same action.
You must move before your attack, not after. You must move at least 10 feet, directly toward the designated opponent.

After moving, you may make a single {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}. You get a +2 bonus on the attack roll and take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} until the beginning of your next turn.
column2: Griffonheart shifter letí přímo proti svému protivníkovi. Tato schopnost funguje a počítá se jako nabíjení, ale nevyžaduje čistou cestu k cíli a smí být použita pouze v boji. Tento {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} také poskytuje dodatečný +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} k útokům a {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} provedeným v rámci nabití.
When a fiendflesh shifter uses her fiendish aspect ability, she can gain an additional ability. The fiendflesh shifter can change which ability she gains each time she uses fiendish aspect.

column1: Daemon: Acid {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} equal to the resistance provided by her fiendish resilience ability and a +4 profane {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against disease.
column2: Když fiendflesh shifter použije svou schopnost fiendish aspect, může získat dodatečnou schopnost. Fiendflesh shifter si může při každém použití fiendish aspect zvolit, kterou schopnost získá.
Doesn't have the following feature: Bloodline

column1: Has a bloodline of the same type granted by another class
column2: Doesn't have the following feature: Bloodline

Each sorcerer has a source of magic somewhere in her heritage that grants her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, an additional class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}, and other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}. This source can represent a blood relation or an extreme event involving a creature somewhere in the family's past. For example, a sorcerer might have a dragon as a distant relative or her grandfather might have signed a terrible contract with a devil. Regardless of the source, this influence manifests in a number of ways as the sorcerer gains levels. A sorcerer must pick one bloodline upon taking her first level of sorcerer. Once made, this choice cannot be changed.

column1: Filled with magical power that screams for release, sorcery is not so much a calling as a blessing — or a curse. For some sorcerers, this arcane birthright manifests in subtle and carefully controlled ways, assisting in their manipulation of others or the pursuit of lofty goals. For others, it is wild and unpredictable, the primal and explosive lashing out of a power greater than themselves.

At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional spell, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels. These spells cannot be exchanged for different spells at higher levels.
At 7th level, and every six levels thereafter, a sorcerer receives one bonus feat, chosen from a list specific to each bloodline. The sorcerer must meet the prerequisites for these bonus feats.
column2: Každý sorcerer má ve svém původu zdroj magie, který mu propůjčuje {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, bonusové {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, další třídu {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} a jiné {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}. Tento zdroj může představovat krevní příbuzenství nebo extrémní událost zahrnující bytost v minulosti rodiny. Například sorcerer může mít draka jako vzdáleného příbuzného nebo jeho dědeček mohl podepsat hroznou smlouvu s ďáblem. Bez ohledu na původ se tento vliv s postupem úrovní projevuje řadou způsobů. Sorcerer si musí zvolit jednu bloodline při získání své první úrovně sorcerera. Jakmile je volba učiněna, nelze ji změnit.

At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.

column1: Cause Fear: The affected creature becomes {g|ConditionFrightened}frightened{/g}. If the subject succeeds at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}, it is instead {g|ConditionShaken}shaken{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Creatures with 6 or more {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} are immune to this effect. Cause fear dispels {g|SpellsRemoveFear}remove fear{/g}.
column2: Na 3. úrovni a každé dvě úrovně poté se sorcerer naučí další {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, odvozené z jeho bloodline. Tato kouzla jsou navíc k počtu kouzel udělených při získání nových úrovní.

At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.

column1: Bull's Strength: The subject becomes stronger. The spell grants a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, adding the usual benefits to {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, and other uses of the Strength modifier. Enhancement bonuses don't stack with other enhancement bonuses, for example with bonuses from belts.
column2: Na 3. úrovni a každé dvě úrovně poté se sorcerer naučí další {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, odvozené z jeho bloodline. Tato kouzla jsou navíc k počtu kouzel udělených při získání nových úrovní.

At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.

column1: Rage: Each affected creature gains a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +1 morale bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saves{/g}, and a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The effect is otherwise identical with a barbarian's rage except that the subjects aren't {g|ConditionFatigued}fatigued{/g} at the end of the rage. While in rage, the subject cannot use spells.
column2: Na 3. úrovni a každé dvě úrovně poté se sorcerer naučí další {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, odvozené z jeho bloodline. Tato kouzla jsou navíc k počtu kouzel udělených při získání nových úrovní.

At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.

column1: Stoneskin: The warded creature gains resistance to blows, cuts, stabs, and slashes. The subject gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 10/adamantine. It ignores the first 10 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each time it takes damage from a weapon, though an adamantine weapon overcomes the reduction. Once the spell has prevented a total of 10 points of damage per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 150 points), it is discharged.
column2: Na 3. úrovni a každé dvě úrovně poté se sorcerer naučí další {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, odvozené z jeho bloodline. Tato kouzla jsou navíc k počtu kouzel udělených při získání nových úrovní.

At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.

column1: Bless: This spell fills your allies with courage. Each ally gains a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear effects.
Bless counters and dispels {g|SpellsBane}bane{/g}.
column2: Na 3. úrovni a každé dvě úrovně poté se sorcerer naučí další {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, odvozené z jeho bloodline. Tato kouzla jsou navíc k počtu kouzel udělených při získání nových úrovní.

At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.

column1: Resist Energy: This abjuration grants a creature limited protection from {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of whichever one of five energy types you select: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. The subject gains {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} energy 10 against the energy type chosen, meaning that each time the creature is subjected to such damage (whether from a natural or magical source), that damage is reduced by 10 points before being applied to the creature's {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}. The value of the energy resistance granted increases to 20 points at 7th level and to a maximum of 30 points at 11th level. The spell protects the recipient's equipment as well.
column2: Na 3. úrovni a každé dvě úrovně poté se sorcerer naučí další {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, odvozené z jeho bloodline. Tato kouzla jsou navíc k počtu kouzel udělených při získání nových úrovní.

At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.

column1: Protection from Energy: This spell grants temporary immunity to the type of energy you specify when you cast it (acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic). When the spell absorbs 12 points per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} (to a maximum of 120 points at 10th level), it is discharged.
column2: Na 3. úrovni a každé dvě úrovně poté se sorcerer naučí další {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, odvozené z jeho bloodline. Tato kouzla jsou navíc k počtu kouzel udělených při získání nových úrovní.

At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.

column1: Remove Curse: This spell can remove all curses on an object or a creature. If the target is a creature, you must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + caster level) against the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of each curse affecting the target. Success means that the curse is removed.
column2: Na 3. úrovni a každé dvě úrovně poté se sorcerer naučí další {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, odvozené z jeho bloodline. Tato kouzla jsou navíc k počtu kouzel udělených při získání nových úrovní.

column1: Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 6 rounds
Effect: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g}
Cure: 2 saves
Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 6 rounds
Effect: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g}
Cure: 2 saves
Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 6 rounds
Effect: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g}
Cure: 2 saves
Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 6 rounds
Effect: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g}
Cure: 2 saves
Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 6 rounds
Effect: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g}
Cure: 2 saves
Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 6 rounds
Effect: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g}
Cure: 2 saves

column2: At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.

column1: Hypnotism: Your gestures and droning incantation fascinate nearby living creatures, causing them to stop and stare blankly at you in a {g|ConditionDaze}dazed{/g} condition. {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}Roll{/g} 2d4 to see how many total {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} of creatures you affect.
column2: Na 3. úrovni a potom každé dvě úrovně získáš další {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, odvozené z tvé krevní linie. Tato kouzla jsou navíc k počtu kouzel získaných při nových úrovních.

At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.

column1: Delay Poison: The subject becomes temporarily immune to poison. Any poison in its system or any poison to which it is exposed during the spell's duration does not affect the subject until the spell's duration has expired. Delay poison does not {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} that poison may have already done.
column2: Na 3. úrovni a potom každé dvě úrovně získáš další {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, odvozené z tvé krevní linie. Tato kouzla jsou navíc k počtu kouzel získaných při nových úrovních.

At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.

column1: Summon Monster III: This spell summons an extraplanar monitor lizard, {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar wolves, or 1d4+1 extraplanar dogs. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
column2: Na 3. úrovni a potom každé dvě úrovně získáš další {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, odvozené z tvé krevní linie. Tato kouzla jsou navíc k počtu kouzel získaných při nových úrovních.

At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.

column1: Frightful Aspect: You become a larger, awful version of yourself and take on features that horrify your enemies. You gain the following abilities: a +6 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +4 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +6 form natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 10/magic, and {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to 10 + half your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. You also emit an aura that emanates 30 feet from you. Enemy creatures within the aura are {g|ConditionShaken}shaken{/g}. Each time a creature shaken by this aura hits you with a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}, that creature becomes {g|ConditionFrightened}frightened{/g} for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}, though at the end of that duration it is no longer affected by this aura. The aura's effect is a fear and mind-affecting effect.
column2: Na 3. úrovni a potom každé dvě úrovně získáš další {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, odvozené z tvé krevní linie. Tato kouzla jsou navíc k počtu kouzel získaných při nových úrovních.

At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.

column1: You plunge an area into the brutal chill of the arctic night.

All creatures in the area take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}5d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} and 1d6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} each round negates the Dexterity damage but not the cold damage.
column2: Na 3. úrovni a potom každé dvě úrovně získáš další {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, odvozené z tvé krevní linie. Tato kouzla jsou navíc k počtu kouzel získaných při nových úrovních.
At 1st level, you can temporarily become a master of lore. For 1 minute, you gain the bard's {g|BardLoreMaster}lore master{/g} ability.

column1: At 10th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, you can make a {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} against a creature. If the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} is successful, you learn all of the target's weaknesses, gaining a +2 insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on attack and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against that creature (the bonus on attack rolls is doubled on {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} made to confirm {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}). This effect lasts for 1 minute.
column2: Na 1. úrovni se můžeš dočasně stát mistrem vědění. Na 1 minutu získáš bardovu schopnost {g|BardLoreMaster}lore master{/g}.

At 1st level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, you can cause a creature to sprout entangling vines that attempt to hold it in place, entangling it for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex{/g} negates).

column1: At 10th level, you can summon a battle companion. This ability functions as {g|SpellsSummonNaturesAllyIV}summon nature's ally IV{/g}, with a duration of 1 minute. This ability can summon only one animal, regardless of the list used, and the creature's type changes to plant instead of animal. For every 2 levels beyond 10th, the level of the summon nature's ally {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} increases by 1, to a maximum of {g|SpellsSummonNaturesAllyIX}summon nature's ally IX{/g} at 20th level.
column2: Na 1. úrovni můžeš jako {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} způsobit, že z cíle vyrostou chytající révy, které ho na 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} pohlcují (záchrana {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex{/g} ruší).

At 1st level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can touch an ally to grant them reptilian scales. For 1 minute, that ally gains a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to natural armor. At 5th level and every 5 levels thereafter, this bonus increases by +1, to a maximum of +5 at 20th level.

column1: At 10th level, as a standard action, you can manifest venomous fangs for 1 minute. These fangs grant you a bite attack that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (for a {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Medium{/g} warpriest, 1d3 if Small). A successful bite also afflicts the opponent with a debilitating venom. The poison's {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} is equal to 10 + 1/2 your warpriest level + your {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier.
Serpent Venom: Bite; Save: Fortitude
Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 4 rounds
Effect: 1d2 Constitution {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g}
Cure: 1 save
column2: Na 1. úrovni můžeš jako {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} dotykem udělit spojenci plazí šupiny. Po 1 minutě získá tento spojenec +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} k natural armor. Na 5. úrovni a každých dalších 5 úrovních se tento bonus zvyšuje o +1, až do maxima +5 na 20. úrovni.
The abjurer uses magic against itself, and masters the art of defensive and warding magics.

column1: Resistance: You gain resistance 5 to an energy type of your choice, chosen when you prepare {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. This resistance can be changed each day. At 11th level, this resistance increases to 10. At 20th level, this resistance changes to immunity to the chosen energy type.

Protective Ward: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can create a 10-foot-radius field of protective magic centered on you that lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. All allies in this area (including you) receive a +1 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to their {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 for every five wizard levels you possess. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Intelligence modifier.

Energy Absorption: At 6th level, you gain an amount of energy absorption equal to 3 times your wizard level per day. Whenever you take {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g}, apply immunity, vulnerability (if any), and resistance first and apply the rest to this absorption, reducing your daily total by that amount. Any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} in excess of your absorption is applied to you normally.
column2: Jako abjurer používáš magii proti sobě samému a mistrně ovládáš umění obranných a strážných kouzel.

At 1st level, the arcane bomber gains an ability nearly identical to the alchemist's bomb ability. Unlike the alchemist, at 1st level, the arcane bomber chooses one type of energy from the following list: acid, cold, fire, and electricity. He can throw bombs of that type, but cannot modify them with discoveries. An arcane bomber can use a number of bombs each day equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} + his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.

column1: Thrown bombs have a range of 30 feet and use the Throw Splash Weapon special {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. Bombs are considered weapons and can be selected using {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} such as Point-Blank Shot and Weapon Focus. On a direct hit, an arcane bomber's bomb inflicts {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of the chosen energy type + additional damage equal to the arcane bomber's Intelligence modifier. The damage of an arcane bomber's bomb increases by 1d6 points at every odd-numbered arcane bomber level. Splash damage from an arcane bomber's bomb is always equal to the bomb's minimum damage (so if the bomb would deal 2d6+4 points of damage of the chosen energy type on a direct hit, its splash damage would be 6 points of damage of chosen energy type). Those caught in the splash damage can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the arcane bomber's level + the arcane bomber's Intelligence modifier.
column2: Na 1. úrovni získává mystický bombardér schopnost téměř totožnou s alchymistovou schopností bomby. Na rozdíl od alchymisty si však mystický bombardér na 1. úrovni zvolí jeden typ energie z následujícího seznamu: acid, cold, fire, a electricity. Může házet bomby toho typu, ale nemůže je upravovat pomocí discoveries. Mystický bombardér může používat počet bomb za den roven jeho {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} + jeho {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifikátoru.

Benefits: A Thassilonian specialist wizard receives two additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} slots of each spell level he can cast. These bonus spell slots must both be used to prepare the same spell from the wizard's school of specialization, allowing the wizard to cast that spell twice. The wizard cannot use these slots to prepare two different spells, even if they are of the school he is specialized in.

column1: Restrictions: A Thassilonian specialist does not get to customize his choice for opposition schools — that choice is selected for him when he chooses his specialization. These restrictions are more significant than those most wizards follow, and are known as prohibited schools. A Thassilonian wizard can never prepare a spell that is in one of his prohibited schools — he treats these spells as if they were not on the wizard spell list. If using a spell trigger or spell completion item to cast a spell from one of his prohibited schools, he must use the {g|Encyclopedia:Use_Magic_Device}Use Magic Device{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} to do so.
column2: Výhody: Thassilonian specialist wizard získává dvě dodatečné {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} sloty každé úrovně kouzla, které může sesílat. Tyto bonusové sloty musí být oba použity k připravení téhož kouzla ze školy specializace kouzelníka, což kouzelníkovi umožní seslat toto kouzlo dvakrát. Kouzelník nemůže tyto sloty použít k připravení dvou rozdílných kouzel, ani kdyby obě patřila do školy, ve které se specializuje.
The conjurer focuses on the study of summoning monsters and magic alike to bend to his will.

column1: Summoner's Charm: Whenever you cast a conjuration (summoning) {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, increase the duration by a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum 1). This increase is not doubled by {g|FeatureExtendSpell}Extend Spell{/g}.

Acid Dart: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can unleash an acid dart targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. The acid dart deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} + 1 for every two wizard levels you possess. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. This {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} ignores {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}.

Dimensional Steps: At 8th level, you can use this ability to teleport up to 30 feet as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. You can use this ability a total number of times per day equal to your wizard level.
column2: Konjurer se soustředí na studium vyvolávání příšer a magií, aby je přiklonil ke své vůli.

Forewarned: You receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum +1). At 20th level, anytime you {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} initiative, assume the roll resulted in a natural 20.

column1: Diviner's Fortune: When you activate this school power, you can touch any creature as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to give it an insight bonus on all of its {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} checks, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability{/g} checks, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum +1) for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
column2: Varování předem: Získáváš {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} na {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}iniciativní{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}hody{/g} rovnající se 1/2 tvé úrovně kouzelníka (minimálně +1). Na 20. úrovni, kdykoli budeš {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}házet{/g} iniciativu, považuj hod za přirozené 20.
Diviners are masters of remote viewing, prophecies, and using magic to explore the world.

column1: Forewarned: You receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum +1). At 20th level, anytime you {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} initiative, assume the roll resulted in a natural 20.

Diviner's Fortune: When you activate this school power, you can touch any creature as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to give it an insight bonus on all of its {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} checks, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability{/g} checks, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum +1) for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.

Foretell: At 8th level, you can utter a prediction of the immediate future. While your foretelling is in effect, you emit a 30-foot aura of fortune that aids your allies or hinders your enemies, as chosen by you at the time of prediction. If you choose to aid, you and your allies gain a +2 luck bonus on ability checks, attack rolls, {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} checks, saving throws, and skill checks. If you choose to hinder, your enemies take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on those rolls instead. You can use this ability for a number of rounds per day equal to your wizard level. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
column2: Divineři jsou mistry dálkového vidění, proroctví a používání magie k průzkumu světa.
The enchanter uses magic to control and manipulate the minds of his victims.

column1: Enchanting Smile: You gain a +2 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against Enchantment {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 for every five wizard levels you possess, up to a maximum of +6 at 20th level.

Dazing Touch: You can cause a living creature to become {g|ConditionDaze}dazed{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. Creatures with more {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} than your wizard level are unaffected. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.

Aura of Despair: At 8th level, you can emit a 30-foot aura of despair for a number of rounds per day equal to your wizard level. Enemies within this aura take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability{/g} checks, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, saving throws, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} checks. These rounds do not need to be consecutive. This is a mind-affecting effect.
column2: Enchanter používá magii k ovládání a manipulaci myslí svých obětí.

column1: Onset: 1 day
Frequency: 1/day

Effect: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g}, 1d6 {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} damage and {g|ConditionFatigued}fatigue{/g}
Cure: 3 consecutive saves
The save DC is Constitution-based.
column2: {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Save{/g}: Fortitude ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 18) Onset: 1 day Frequency: 1/day Effect: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g}, 1d6 {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} damage and {g|ConditionFatigued}fatigue{/g} Cure: 3 consecutive saves. The save DC is Constitution-based.
This standalone DLC concludes the story that began in Through the Ashes. After completing it, the Knight Commander will find a deadly new trial awaits them in chapter 5 of the main campaign.

column1: Through the Ashes ended with our heroes on the cusp of the Abyss, where the fallen demon lord Sithhud — master of ice and bones — was about to rise again. Our ragtag group of Kenabres survivors are the only ones who can stop him. Learn the secrets of the forgotten demon lord, collect his cursed treasure, and pave the way for new triumphs on the part of the Knight Commander.
column2: Tento samostatný DLC uzavírá příběh, který začal v Through the Ashes. Po jeho dokončení se Knight Commander dozví, že v kapitole 5 hlavní kampaně na něj čeká nová smrtící zkouška.

Any armor heavier than leather, as well as any shield, hurts a character's ability to use {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}-based {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}. {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}Penalties{/g} from armor and a shield stack.

column1: For example, a character wears a full plate armor and tries to move a heavy boulder ({g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g} skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g}). It means that this check will get a –6 penalty to the final result, making it way harder.
A character's encumbrance may also incur a penalty. Medium encumbrance adds a –3 penalty to skill checks, and Heavy encumbrance adds a –6 penalty.
column2: Jakékoliv brnění těžší než kožené, stejně jako jakýkoliv štít, snižuje postavě schopnost používat {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} a {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}-založené {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}. {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}Penalties{/g} z brnění a ze štítu se sčítají.
An attack roll is an attempt to strike your opponent.

column1: Your attack roll result is calculated by the following formula:

{g|Encyclopedia:Dice}d20{/g} + {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}Base Attack Bonus{/g} + {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} modifier (usually {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} for {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} for {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g}) + other modifiers.
If your result equals or higher than the target's {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}, you've scored a hit and you will deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.

A natural 1 (the d20 comes up 1) on an attack roll is always a miss. A natural 20 (the d20 comes up 20) is always a hit. A natural 20 is also a critical threat — it means a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} hit is possible.
column2: Hod na útok je pokus zasáhnout protivníka.

Attacks of opportunity (AoO) are special {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g}. A character can perform them during an enemy's turn if that enemy provokes it while being in their threatened area, creating an opening for a hit. The number of such attacks a creature can make per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} is limited — usually a creature can't perform it more than once, even if it's provoked again during the same turn.

column1: Following {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} provoke AoO when an enemy attempts them while standing in a {g|Encyclopedia:Threatened_Area}threatened area{/g}:
* Attempt to leave melee
* {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}Ranged attack{/g}
* Attempt to stand up from being {g|ConditionProne}prone{/g}
* Casting a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}
* Drinking a potion

In most cases, an AoO can be avoided. Characters leaving melee can use a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g} to make a {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} and attempt doing it without provoking an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. In turn-based mode character can use a 5-foot step to leave melee without provoking an attack. Spellcasters, when they cast in melee, automatically make an attempt to cast defensively.
column2: Útoky příležitosti (AoO) jsou speciální {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g}. Postava je může provést během tahu nepřítele, pokud ji tento nepřítel vyprovokuje, zatímco se nachází v jeho ohrožené oblasti, čímž vznikne příležitost k zásahu. Počet takových útoků, které tvor může provést za {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, je omezen — obvykle tvor nemůže provést více než jeden útok, i když je během téhož tahu znovu vyprovokován.

column1: You must move before your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, not after. You must move at least 10 feet and may move up to double your {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} directly toward the designated opponent. If you move a distance equal to your speed or less, you can also draw a weapon during a charge attack if your {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} is at least +1.

You must have a clear path toward the opponent, and nothing can hinder your movement (such as difficult terrain or obstacles). You must move to the closest space from which you can attack the opponent. If this space is occupied or otherwise blocked, you can't charge. If any line from your starting space to the ending space passes through an area that blocks movement, slows movement, or contains a creature (even an ally), you can't charge. {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}Helpless{/g} creatures don't stop a charge.
If you don't have a line of sight to the opponent at the start of your turn, you can't charge that opponent.

If you are able to take only a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} on your turn, you can still charge, but you are only allowed to move up to your speed (instead of up to double your speed) and you cannot draw a weapon unless you possess the Quick Draw {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. You can't use this option unless you are restricted to taking only a standard action on your turn.

After moving, you may make a single {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}. You get a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on the attack roll and take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} until the start of your next turn.
A charging character gets a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} attack rolls made to bull rush an opponent.
Even if you have extra attacks, such as from having a high enough {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}Base Attack Bonus (BAB){/g} or from using multiple weapons, you only get to make one attack during a charge.

column2: Charisma measures a character's power of personality, personal magnetism, ability to lead, and appearance.

column1: Here are examples where you apply your character's Charisma modifier:
• {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Use_Magic_Device}Use Magic Device{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
• Channel energy {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DCs{/g} for clerics and paladins attempting to harm undead foes.

Bards, paladins, bloodragers, oracles, skalds, and sorcerers gain a number of bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} based on their Charisma scores. The minimum Charisma score needed to cast their spell is 10 + the spell's level.
column2: Charisma vyjadřuje sílu osobnosti postavy, osobní magnetismus, schopnost vést a vzhled.

If your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} succeeds, you deal the target some damage. Damage calculation is a dice {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} with {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} depending on weapon you use to attack and different factors. Damage reduces the target's current {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}.

column1: Minimum Damage

If attacker's penalties reduce the damage result to less than 1, a hit still deals 1 point of damage. This damage still can be reduced by enemy abilities like {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}Damage Reduction{/g} or Energy {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}Resistance{/g}.
{g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} Bonus
When you hit with a melee or thrown weapon, add your Strength modifier to the damage result.
When you deal damage with a weapon in your off hand, you add only half your Strength bonus. If you have a Strength penalty, the entire penalty applies.

When you deal damage with a weapon that you are wielding {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}two-handed{/g}, you add 1.5 times your Strength bonus (Strength penalties are not multiplied). You don't get this higher Strength bonus, however, when using a light weapon with two hands.
Type of Damage
There are two main types of damage: {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Physical_Damage}physical damage{/g}.
column2: Pokud váš {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} uspěje, způsobíte cíli určité {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Výpočet damage se provádí hodem kostkami ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}dice roll{/g}) s připočtenými bonusy a tresty v závislosti na zbrani, kterou útočíte, a na různých faktorech. Damage snižuje aktuální {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} cíle.

column1: Damage reduction could be overcome by using weapons made from special materials (like Cold Iron or Adamantine), magic weapons (any weapon with a +1 or higher enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}, excluding masterwork), certain types of weapons (such as {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}slashing or bludgeoning{/g}), and weapons imbued with an {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} (like good-aligned).
Weapons with an enhancement bonus of +3 or greater can ignore some types of damage reduction, regardless of their actual material or alignment.
+3 weapons overcome Cold Iron/Silver type of DR, +4 weapons overcome Adamantine type of DR, +5 weapons overcome Alignment-based DR.
A charm {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} changes how the subject views you, typically making it see you as a good friend.

A compulsion {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} forces the subject to act in some manner or changes the way its mind works. Some compulsion spells determine the subject's actions or the effects on the subject, others allow you to determine the subject's actions when you cast the spell, and still, others give you ongoing control over the subject.

column2: After taking {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, you can recover the lost {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} through healing, either natural or magical.

column1: Natural Healing
With a full night's {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rest{/g} (8 hours of sleep or more), you recover 1 hit point per {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g}.
Magical Healing
Various abilities and {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} can restore hit points, like {g|SpellsCureLightWounds}cure light wounds{/g}, {g|SpellsHeal}heal{/g}, or lay on hands.
Healing Ability Damage
Temporary {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g} returns at the rate of 1 point per night of rest (8 hours) for each affected {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}.
column2: Po utržení {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} můžeš obnovit ztracené {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g léčením — buď přirozeným, nebo magickým.
Each character has a certain number of {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} (HP). Depending on which game difficulty you've chosen the rules will vary.

column1: If you chose the Story Mode, your characters never die. When their HP value drops to 0, they lose consciousness. After the combat is over, the character will get up and can be controlled again. You only lose the game if your whole party is {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}.

If you chose the Easy Mode, when a character's HP value drops to 0, they lose consciousness. After the combat is over, the character will get up and can be controlled again. A character's HP value can drop into negative numbers without killing them. However, if a character is reduced to a negative amount of hit points equal to their {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score, they die. To resurrect them, you will need a special {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.

If you chose the Normal Mode, a character will not die after suffering a deadly injury for the first time. Instead, Death's Door condition will afflict them. If a character with this condition suffers a deadly injury again, they will die. The game will be over if all party members suffer deadly injuries.
If you chose the Challenging Mode or higher, your characters will die after suffering a deadly injury. If your main character dies, the game is over.

To restore the lost hit points, you can use {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} spells, potions, or {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rest{/g}. Healing potions can be bought from merchants or obtained as trophies after combat. Healing spells are accessible to the following classes: bard, druid, cleric, inquisitor, and paladin.
To use expendable items, such as scrolls, potions, and wands, open your inventory and place them into a quick slot.
column2: Každá postava má určité množství {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} (HP). Pravidla se liší podle vybrané obtížnosti hry.

column1: If a character's current number of hit points is 0 or negative, but the number of negative HP is less than its {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score, it is unconscious.
When your negative hit point total becomes equal to your Constitution score, you're dead. Characters never die on Story Mode.
Unconscious

Unconscious is one of the {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}Helpless{/g} conditions when you can take no {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g}. After a battle, unconscious characters {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} some {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}, gain consciousness and stand up.
Death Door

When character dies for the first time, he revives after the battle, but gains "at death door" effect. Next time such character will die for real and will have to be revived. This happens only on Daring or lower difficulty or if special option is turned on.
Dead

Dead characters can be revived with some {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} or scrolls like {g|SpellsRaiseDead}raise dead{/g} or {g|SpellsResurrection}resurrection{/g}. If you don't have a character who can cast the required spell, you can find an NPC in a safe place, i.e. {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}camp{/g} or city, who will cast it for you.

column2: Intelligence determines how well your character learns and reasons. Animal companions require Intelligence score 3 to gain access to many new {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}.

column1: Here are examples where you apply your character's Intelligence modifier:
• The number of {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} points gained each level, though your character always gets at least 1 skill point per level.
• {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.

Alchemists, arcanists, witches, magi and wizards gain bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} based on their Intelligence score. The minimum Intelligence score needed to cast their spells is 10 + the spell's level.
column2: Intelligence určuje, jak dobře se tvá postava učí a uvažuje. Zvířecí společníci potřebují Intelligence 3, aby získali přístup k mnoha novým {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}.
Weapon Class is a measure of how much effort it takes to wield a weapon in combat.

column1: Light Weapons

A light weapon is used in one hand and is easier to use in one's off hand than a one-handed weapon. For primary hand {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} the wielder's {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier is added to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} rolls, or half of the wielder's Strength {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for the off hand {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. When using both hands to wield a light weapon the Strength bonus applies as though the weapon were held in the wielder's primary hand only.
An {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed strike{/g} is always considered a light weapon.
One-Handed Weapons

A one-handed weapon can be used in either the primary hand or the off hand. For primary hand melee attacks the wielder's Strength modifier is added to damage rolls, or half of the wielder's Strength bonus for the off hand attacks. If a one-handed weapon is wielded with two hands during melee combat, 1.5 times the character's Strength bonus is added to damage rolls.
Two-Handed Weapons
Two hands are required to use a two-handed melee weapon effectively. For melee attacks with such a weapon 1.5 times the character's Strength bonus is applied to damage rolls.
column2: Třída zbraně je míra, kolik úsilí stojí ovládat zbraň v boji.

Natural attacks are {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made with natural weapons, such as claws, bites or wings. Creature doesn't receive additional natural attacks for a high {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}, but can gain additional attacks from various effects like the {g|SpellsHaste}haste{/g} spell. Creatures like animal companions can have one or more natural attacks, and are able to gain additional attacks (depending on available limbs) with level progression.

column1: There are two main types of natural attacks: primary, such as claws or bites, and secondary, such as hoofs or wings.

Primary natural attacks add {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier to the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dealt. If it's the only attack of a creature, it adds 1.5×Strength modifier to the damage dealt.
Secondary natural attacks have a –5 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to attack rolls and add half the Strength modifier to the damage dealt.

In case a creature has weapon attacks and natural attacks, weapon attacks always go first and work normally (with additional attacks for base attack bonus), and all natural attacks will always work as secondary natural attacks. A limb that holds a weapon can't be used to perform a natural attack.
column2: Natural attacks jsou útoky prováděné přirozenými zbraněmi, jako drápy, kousnutí nebo křídla. Tvor nezískává další natural attacks kvůli vysokému {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}, ale může získat další útoky z různých efektů, jako je kouzlo {g|SpellsHaste}haste{/g}. Tvoři jako zvířecí kompánioni mohou mít jeden či více natural attacks a s postupem úrovní mohou získat další útoky podle dostupných končetin.

As time passes, your characters become tired and act less effectively. You can see this by the "{g|ConditionFatigued}fatigue{/g}" and "{g|ConditionExhausted}exhaustion{/g}" condition icons on their portraits. This is why they need regular {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rest{/g}.

column1: To replenish your powers, set up a camp and have a rest. To set up a camp, use the "Camp" function by pressing {console_bind|RightBottom} and choosing "Rest". After that, you will have to select a location for the camp. Camps take up a lot of space, so find the right location.
While resting, all characters restore a portion of their lost {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}. {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spellcasters{/g} also replenish their spells.
Rest also helps you get rid of some of the negative conditions. Resting takes at least 8 hours.
column2: Jak čas plyne, tvoje postavy chřadnou a jednají méně účinně. Vidíš to podle ikon stavů "{g|ConditionFatigued}fatigue{/g}" a "{g|ConditionExhausted}exhaustion{/g}" na jejich portrétech. Proto potřebují pravidelný {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rest{/g}.

As time passes, your characters become tired and act less effectively. You can see this by the "{g|ConditionFatigued}fatigue{/g}" and "{g|ConditionExhausted}exhaustion{/g}" condition icons on their portraits. This is why they need regular {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rest{/g}.

column1: To replenish your powers, set up a camp and have a rest. Set up camp by using the {ui|Restcamp} function (hotkey [{bind|OpenRestCamp}]). After activating the function, you will have to select a location for the camp.
Camps take up a lot of space, so find the right location.
While resting, all characters restore a portion of their lost {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}. Spellcasters also replenish their {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
Rest also helps you get rid of some of the negative conditions. Resting takes at least 8 hours.
column2: Jak čas plyne, tvoje postavy chřadnou a jednají méně účinně. Vidíš to podle ikon stavů "{g|ConditionFatigued}fatigue{/g}" a "{g|ConditionExhausted}exhaustion{/g}" na jejich portrétech. Proto potřebují pravidelný {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rest{/g}.
When you are subject to an unusual or magical impact, you often get a chance to make a saving throw (also called a save) to avoid or reduce the effect.

column1: Your saving throw is:
{g|Encyclopedia:Dice}d20{/g} roll + Base save {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} + {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} modifier + other modifiers.
{g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throws_Results}Saving throw results{/g}
The three different kinds of saving throws are Fortitude, Reflex, and Will:
Fortitude

These saves measure your ability to stand up to physical punishment or attacks against your vitality and health. Apply your {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier to your Fortitude saving throws.
Reflex
These saves test your ability to dodge area attacks and unexpected situations. Apply your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier to your Reflex saving throws.
Will
These saves reflect your resistance to mental influence as well as many magical effects. Apply your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier to your Will saving throws.
column2: Když na tebe dopadne nezvyklý nebo magický vliv, často dostaneš šanci vykonat záchranný hod (také nazývaný save), aby ses účinku vyhnul nebo ho zmírnil.

All characters and creatures, depending on how large they are, are separated into different {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} categories — Tiny, Small, Medium, Large, Huge and Gargantuan. For example, humans are of a Medium size, while halflings and gnomes are Small.

column1: Size modifiers of different kinds apply to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}armor class{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} rolls, {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} checks, and various other checks.
Size modifier for a creature's AC and attack rolls is as follows:
Tiny +2, Small +1, Medium +0, Large –1, Huge –2, Gargantuan –4
The special size modifier for a creature's {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}Combat Maneuver Bonus{/g} is as follows:
Tiny –2, Small –1, Medium +0, Large +1, Huge +2, Gargantuan +4

The bigger creature is, the bigger its {g|Encyclopedia:Threatened_Area}threatened area{/g} is. For medium and small creatures it matches with their melee {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Range}weapon range{/g}.
Character can only ride an animal companion that is bigger than the character himself.
column2: Všechny postavy a tvorečkové jsou, podle své velikosti, rozdělěni do různých {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} kategorií — Tiny, Small, Medium, Large, Huge a Gargantuan. Například lidé jsou Medium, zatímco halflingové a gnomové jsou Small.

A {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} represents a creature's ability to perform an ordinary task, such as climb a wall, sneak down a hallway, or spot an intruder. The number of ranks possessed by a creature in a given skill represents its proficiency in that skill.

column1: Determine the number of skill ranks your character gets based on his class and {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier (and any other {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g}, such as the bonus received by humans). Then allocate these ranks to desired skills, but remember that you cannot have more ranks than your level in any one skill (for a starting character, this is usually one).

Each level thereafter, your character gains a number of skill ranks dependent upon your class plus your Intelligence modifier. Investing a rank in a skill represents a measure of training in that skill.
column2: {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}Skill{/g} představuje schopnost tvora vykonat běžný úkol, jako vylézt po zdi, plížit se chodbou nebo zpozorovat vetřelce. Počet ranků, které tvor v dané dovednosti má, určuje jeho zdatnost v té dovednosti.

A skill represents a creature's ability to perform a specific task, such as climb a wall, open a locked chest, or spot a hidden treasure. The number of ranks possessed by a creature in a given skill represents its proficiency in that skill and allows to perform more difficult tasks.

column1: Characters gets number of skill ranks based on their class and {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier (and any other {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g}, such as the bonus received by humans).

Each class has a set of class skills. They get +3 bonus to skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} of such skills if they are trained in them. Trained skill means that character has at least 1 rank in this skill.

In order to determine success, whenever you attempt to use a skill, you must make a skill check. If the result of your skill check is equal to or greater than the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}difficulty class{/g} (or DC) of the task you are attempting to accomplish, you succeed.
Skill check can be calculated with the following formula:
{g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + skill ranks + ability modifier + racial modifier + class skill modifier.
Some skill checks cannot be performed if your character has not put at least one rank into it.
column2: Dovednost představuje schopnost tvora vykonat konkrétní úkol, jako vylézt po zdi, otevřít zamčenou truhlu nebo najít skryté poklady. Počet ranků v dané dovednosti vyjadřuje zdatnost v ní a dovoluje plnit obtížnější úkoly.

column1: Usually, a spell-like ability works just like the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} of the same name. Spell-like ability can't fail due to armor {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g}, even if the ability resembles an arcane spell.

A spell-like ability has a {g|Encyclopedia:Casting_Time}casting time{/g} of 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} unless noted otherwise in the ability or spell description. In all other ways including {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration{/g}, a spell-like ability functions just like a spell.
Spell-like abilities inherit interaction with {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} and {g|SpellsDispelMagic}dispel magic{/g} from the spell they were made from.
Supernatural abilities are magical but not spell-like.

They are not subject to {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} and their effects cannot be dispelled. They also cannot be disrupted in combat and generally don't provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}.
Extraordinary abilities are nonmagical, though they may break the laws of physics.

They are not subject to {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} and their effects cannot be dispelled. They also cannot be disrupted in combat and generally don't provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}.
When your movement is hampered in some way, your movement usually costs double.

Despite whatever {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} to movement you might have, you can take a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g} to move 5 feet in any direction. This rule doesn't allow you to move through impassable terrain or to move when all movement is prohibited. Such movement provokes {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} as normal.

column2: Although the words sprawl unevenly across the page, someone has clearly gone to a lot of effort to write this — so much effort, they tore several holes in the paper with their quill.

column1:
One by one. Step by step. I follow in your foosteps, Master, bound for the wealth and glory you have promised me. When I entered your flock, I left behind poverty and sorrow. I will never forget the stench of the village hut where I was born, for the memory of it is a reminder never to return. When I joined the faith, I learned the true purpose of mortal life — the accumulation of wealth. I hunger for gold, influence, and glory, and I desire to follow your path to greatness. I am guided by your precepts. Just as you endured thirty-one trials before you attained godhood, so I will overcome every obstacle that stands in my way. No difficulty will deter me, no adversity will stop me, for only in the service of our Lord will I find a life of plenty and comfort.
Oh Lord, multiply my wealth and bestow the bounty of your favor upon me. Razmir, may you bless your servant with prosperity and peace.
The last line is written in beautiful, precise cursive:
Copied without errors, but do not put so much pressure on the quill. Satisfactory.
column2: Ačkoli jsou slova nerovnoměrně roztáhlá po stránce, je jasno, že si pisatel dal s psaním velkou námahu — tolik, že několikrát propíchl papír svým brkem.

This book allows you to summon a demon or angel once per day. If the owner is {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}evil alignment{/g}, it will summon 1d2+1 monadic devas. If the owner is good alignment, it will summon 1d2+1 nabasu demons. If the wearer is neutral, there is an equal chance to summon angels or demons. Duration of summoning is equal to the owner's level. There is a 10% chance that the creatures will break free from the control and start attacking the owner. This book has 10 pages, and each time the owner uses it to summon a creature, they receive one of the following scrolls randomly:

column1: Scroll of Angelic Resistance — +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against poison for 1 hour.
Scroll of Demonic Resistance — You gain a +5 electricity {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} for 1 hour.
Scroll of Abyssal Regeneration — You gain a +5 {g|Encyclopedia:Fast_Healing}fast healing{/g} for 1 hour.
Scroll of Angelic Knowledge — You gain a +2 bonus to all Knowledge and Lore {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} for 1 hour.
Scroll of Demonic Intimidation — You gain a + 2 bonus to Intimidation skill checks for 1 hour.
Scroll of Wings of Freedom — You gain a +2 bonus on saving throws against ground effects for 1 hour.
Scroll of Divination — All {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} from Divination school you cast as if you were 1 level higher for 1 hour.
Scroll of Stomp — You gain a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}CMB{/g} checks for 1 hour.
Scroll of Resourceful Smite — You gain an additional smite evil per day permanently. Effect can be applied once per creature.
Scroll of Resourceful Rage — You gain an additional Rage per day permanently. Effect can be applied once per creature.
column2: Tato kniha ti umožňuje jednou za den svolat démona nebo anděla. Pokud je majitel {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}evil alignment{/g}, svolá 1d2+1 monadic devas. Pokud je majitel {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good alignment{/g}, svolá 1d2+1 nabasu demons. Pokud je nositel neutrální, je stejná šance svolat anděly i démony. Doba trvání summoningu odpovídá úrovni majitele. Je 10% šance, že se stvoření vymaní z kontroly a začnou útočit na majitele. Tato kniha má 10 stran a pokaždé, když ji majitel použije k svolání stvoření, obdrží náhodně jeden z následujících svitků:
Once per day you can activate this book. You {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} 1d100

column1: 1 — 75: owner gains a +4 insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} for 1 hour.

76 — 85: owner gains a +4 insight bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} for 1 hour.
86 — 95: owner is affected with the effect of confusion {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} for 1d4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} in the beginning of the next combat.
96 — 100: owner suffers 4 negative levels.
column2: Jednou za den můžeš tuto knihu aktivovat. Hodíš si {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} 1d100

This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes seven shimmering, multicolored beams of light to spray from your hand. Each beam has a different power. Creatures in the area of the spell with 12 {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} or less are automatically blinded for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. Every creature in the area is randomly struck by one or more beams, which have additional effects:

column1: 40 points {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex{/g} half)
60 points acid damage (Reflex half)
100 points electricity damage (Reflex half)

Poison (Frequency: 1/round for 6 rounds; Initial effect: {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g}; Secondary effect: 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g} per round; Cure: 2 consecutive Fortitude saves)
Disintegrate (Fortitude negates)
Become Friendly, as Euphoric Tranquility spell (Will negates)
Sent to another plane forever (Will negates)
Creature struck by two rays receives both rays' effects at once.
column2: Toto {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} způsobí sedm třpytivých, mnohobarevných paprsků světla, jež vystřelují z tvé dlaně. Každý paprsek má jinou moc. Stvoření v oblasti kouzla s 12 {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} nebo méně jsou automaticky oslepena na {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. Každé stvoření v oblasti je náhodně zasaženo jedním nebo více paprsky, které mají následující dodatečné efekty:
You are skilled at deflecting blows with your shield.

column1: Benefit: Increase the {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted by any shield you are using by 1. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Shield Focus.

column2: Your mastery of the shield allows you to fight with it without hindrance.
