column1: Benefit: You do not suffer any {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} made with a shield while you are wielding another weapon. Add your shield's enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to attack and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made with the shield as if it were a weapon enhancement bonus.
column2: Tvé mistrovství se štítem ti dovoluje s ním bojovat bez újmy.
You use the momentum of your movement to focus and awaken your inner beast.

column1: Once per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, when you move at least 10 feet or when you charge, you can use your wild shape ability as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}.
column2: Využíváš hybnost svého pohybu k soustředění a probuzení vnitřního zvířete.
Your studies have helped you develop methods to overcome {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}.

column1: Benefit: When you cast a piercing spell against a target with spell resistance, it treats the spell resistance of the target as 5 lower than its actual SR.
Level Increase: +1 (A piercing spell uses up a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.)
column2: Tvé studium ti pomohlo vyvinout metody, jak překonat {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}.

You can choose to take a –1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls and {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} to gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}.

column1: This bonus to damage is increased by half (+50%) if you are making an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}two-handed{/g} weapon, a one handed weapon using two hands, or a primary {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapon{/g} that adds 1–1/2 times your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier on damage rolls. This bonus to damage is halved (–50%) if you are making an attack with an off-hand weapon or secondary natural weapon.
When your {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} reaches +4, and every 4 points thereafter, the penalty increases by –1 and the bonus to damage increases by +2.

The effects of this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} last until your next turn. The bonus damage does not apply to {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g} or effects that do not deal {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit point{/g} damage.
column2: Můžeš se rozhodnout přijmout –1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} na všechny hody na {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} a hody na {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}, abys získal +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} ke všem hromadám {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} z útoků zblízka.
Choose a {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}. You are particularly adept at that skill.

column1: Benefit: You get a +3 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} involving the chosen skill. If you have 10 or more ranks in that skill, this bonus increases to +6.
Special: You can gain this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} multiple times. Its effects don't stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new skill.
column2: Vyber si jednu {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}. Jsi v té dovednosti obzvlášť zdatný.
Your {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} of a certain element are more difficult to resist.

column1: Benefit: Choose one energy type (acid, cold, electricity, or fire). Add +1 to the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}Difficulty Class{/g} for all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against spells that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of the energy type you select.
column2: Tvé {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} určitě elementu je obtížnější odolat.
Choose a {g|Encyclopedia:Magic_School}school of magic{/g}. Any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} you cast of that school are more difficult to resist.

column1: Benefit: Add +1 to the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}Difficulty Class{/g} for all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against spells from the school of magic you select.
Special: You can gain this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} multiple times. Its effects don't stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new school of magic.
column2: Vyber jednu {g|Encyclopedia:Magic_School}school of magic{/g}. Všechna {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, která sesíláš z této školy, jsou obtížněji odolná.
Select one {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. You cast that spell with greater than normal power.

column1: Benefit: Select one spell. Treat your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} as being two higher for all level-variable effects of the spell.
Every time you gain a level in a spellcasting class, you can choose a new spell to replace the spell selected with this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, and that spell becomes your specialized spell.
column2: Vyber si jedno {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. Toto kouzlo sesíláš s větší než obvyklou silou.
With the aid of an ally, you are skilled at piercing the protections of other creatures with your {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.

column1: Benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, you receive a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} and level checks made to overcome {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}.
column2: S Pomocí spojence jsi zdatný prorážet ochrany jiných tvorů svými {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
Your ally's eyes are your own, and yours are his.

column1: Benefit: While you are {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanked{/g} and adjacent to an ally with this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, you receive a +2 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} from opponents flanking you.
column2: Tvé oči jsou oči tvého spojence a jeho oči jsou tvé.
You are skilled at working with your allies to perform dangerous {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuvers{/g}.

column1: Benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, you receive a +2 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all combat maneuver {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}. This bonus increases to +4 when attempting to break free from a grapple.
column2: Jsi zručnější při spolupráci se spojenci při provádění nebezpečných {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuvers{/g}.
Your skill with your chosen weapon leaves opponents unable to defend themselves if you strike them when their defenses are already compromised.

column1: Benefit: Any {g|ConditionShaken}shaken{/g} or {g|ConditionFrightened}frightened{/g} opponent hit by you this {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} is {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} until the end of your next turn. This includes any additional attacks you make this round.
column2: Tvé mistrovství s vybranou zbraní nechává protivníky bez obrany, pokud je zasáhneš, zatímco jsou jejich obrany již oslabené.
Your allies cover you while you cast complicated {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.

column1: Benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, you receive a +4 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
If your ally is wielding a buckler or a light shield, this bonus increases by +1.
If your ally is wielding a heavy shield or a tower shield, this bonus increases by +2.
column2: Tví spojenci tě kryjí, zatímco sesíláš složitá {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.

Choose one type of weapon (including {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed strike{/g}) for which you possess the Weapon Specialization {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. Your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with the chosen weapon are more devastating than normal.

column1: Benefit: You gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} you make using the selected weapon. This bonus to damage stacks with other damage roll bonuses, including any you gain from Weapon Specialization.
Special: You can gain Greater Weapon Specialization multiple times. Its effects don't stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.
column2: Vyber jeden typ zbraně (včetně {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed strike{/g}), pro který máš feat Weapon Specialization {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. Tvé {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} s vybranou zbraní jsou ničivější než obvykle.
The diary contains only one entry, on the very first page.

column1:
Life is shit! While my brethren (although what kind of brothers are they really?) are having a great time up on the surface, I'm stuck down here with Hosilla the nightmare and the mongrel scum. To top it all off, a pipe's sprung a leak, an elemental is smashing up the kitchen, and that bitch Hosilla is sending off everyone she can find to try to kill the thing.
All I can do is hide around corners, under beds, and in cupboards. I don't want to die!
This isn't how I pictured it, serving Baphomet... This isn't how I pictured it at all...
column2: Denník obsahuje jen jeden zápis, na úplně první stránce.
The priceless treasure stolen from the dragon in Colyphyr caves is nothing but a pile of heavy boulders. They were enchanted with a magnificent illusion.

column1: That cursed dragon was probably laughing his tail off as he was picturing thieves that would throw their backs out by trying to haul this precious loot.
column2: Bezcenný poklad ukradený drakovi v Colyphyrských jeskyních je nic jiného než hromada těžkých balvanů. Byly očarovány nádhernou iluzí.

Owner of this book reads one new chapter every time on {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rest{/g}, granting a benefit until the next rest depending on which companion the chapter described, chapter selected randomly.

column1: The chapter about Shelburn grants an ability to use {g|SpellsFireball}Fireball{/g} 3 times ({g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} 10, {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 18) this day. The chapter about Lord Jessiahdor grants a +5 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Use_Magic_Device}Use Magic Device checks{/g}. The chapter about Skerple allows the owner to deal 1 additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on each sneak attack damage die. The chapter about Wolfgang Hypeton grants +10 competence bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}. The chapter about Ristof Brulston grants an ability to make the target Rage, as a barbarian, for 6 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} 3 times this day. The chapter about Kenneth Cowannan grants an ability to use {g|SpellsLightningBolt}Lightning Bolt{/g} 3 times (caster level 10, DC 18) this day.
column2: Majitel této knihy si při každém {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rest{/g} přečte jednu novou kapitolu, která poskytne výhodu až do dalšího odpočinku podle toho, jakého společníka kapitola popisovala; kapitola je vybrána náhodně.

The law is inviolable. But power is primordial.
Fools see in the law a beacon of safety and certainty. 'Heed these rules, and the powers that be shall protect you,' society tells them. Leave them be. They are as they should be: malleable, complacent, content to obey authority.
For what is the law if not the derivative of power? It is the instrument through which power constrains and directs the masses. Nothing more than that. Power established the laws, and power may change them. Yet such changes must not be made wantonly lest Hell should become like the Abyss with its chaos based on the rule of the strong. Such changes must be disguised in ways palatable to the masses and used openly only in cases of dire need.
While commoners are content to obey the law, elites are subject to power itself. For it is power that can shatter the foundations of any regime and erect them anew. Never forget this.
column3:
Zákon je nedotknutelný. Avšak moc jest prvotní.	too_short:0.05
14471	You can throw a flask of acid as a splash weapon with a range of 30 feet.
A direct hit deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g}. Every creature within 5 feet of the point where the acid hits takes 1 point of acid damage from the splash.	Můžeš hoditi lahvičku kyseliny jako stříkající zbraň (dosah 30 stop).	too_short:0.24
14473	You can throw a flask of alchemist's fire as a splash weapon with a range of 30 feet.
A direct hit deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}. Every creature within 5 feet of the point where the flask hits takes 1 point of fire damage from the splash. 14672	The frozen heart of Barsag the Chief, now fused with his belt. The belt grants its wearer a +4 armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to cold, and a +4 enhancement bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}.
Additionally, once per day, the wearer can use the ice cascade ability as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}.
Ice Cascade: A mass of ice and snow slams into an enemy within medium range, then ricochets off them, striking secondary targets. Those targets must be within 20 feet of the primary target, and no target can be struck more than once. Each target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}6d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} and becomes trapped in solid ice, which leaves the creature {g|ConditionParalyzed}paralyzed{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 18 {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} halves the damage and negates the paralysis.	Zmrzlé srdce Barsag the Chief, nyní srostlé s jeho opaskem. Opasek dává svému nositeli +4 brnění (bonus) k {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} vůči chladu a +4 enhancement bonus k {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}.	too_short:0.26
14679	Aszite	Aszite	identical;jaccard_high:1.00_no_czech;contains_source
14686	With no sun, the passage of day and night is imperceptible. How long have I wandered through these dungeon halls, seeing only pain and misery? I have opened dozens of cells, but the prisoners do not want freedom; they welcome the pain and suffering inflicted upon them. The torturers greet me as an old acquaintance and do not interfere. My mission is no longer secret. Every shadow knows a paladin of Shelyn is here.

column1: I broke into the cell where one of the fetchlings was crying. Shelyn teaches that love heals, and I wanted to console him. He was the only one here who yearned for comfort... A torturer appeared out of nowhere, woven from the shadows. He slammed the door, taking away the sword and shield I had left behind. Now I too am a prisoner."
column2:
Bez slunce je plynutí dne a noci nepostřehnutelné. Jak dlouho bloudím těmito kobkami, vidouce pouze bolest a bídu? Otevřel jsem desítky cel, avšak vězni nechtějí svobodu; vítají bolest a utrpení, jež jim přidělují. Mučitelé mě zdraví jako starého známého a nezasahují. Má mise již není tajná. Každý stín ví, že paladin Shelyn je zde.	too_short:0.44
14690	Time has lost all meaning in this endless night. I am alone, and sometimes it feels as if I have been alone for years. How I miss the torturer whom I cursed during my first days here. Torture would be a pleasure compared to the countless hours of darkness and loneliness.

column1: It will all be over soon. They promised to take me to see the master because I am his special guest. Perhaps he will grant me death — quick, slow, it does not matter. Whoever is reading this, I beg you: run away before you lose all that is dear to you..."
column2:
Čas ztratil veškerý smysl v této nekonečné noci. Jsem sám, a někdy mám pocit, že osamělím roky. Jak toužím po mučiteli, jemuž jsem během prvních dnů zde uřkl. Mučení by bylo potěšením oproti bezpočtu hodin temnoty a samoty.	too_short:0.42

15189	This scale allows you to restore life to a deceased party member. A raised creature has a number of {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} equal to its current HD. This ability also removes the {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death's{/g} door condition.
Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The subject of the ability gains two permanent negative levels when it is raised, just as if it had been hit by an energy-draining creature, though it can not gain a number of negative levels equal to or greater than its total {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} this way.
A creature whose permanent negative levels already equal its Hit Dice cannot be brought back to life through {g|SpellsRaiseDead}raise dead{/g}.	Tato šupina ti umožní navrátit k životu zemřelého člena družiny. Vzkříšená bytost má počet {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} rovných svým aktuálním HD. Tato schopnost také odstraňuje stav u prahu {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death's{/g} door.	too_short:0.34

Benefit: You can use smite evil a number of additional times per day equal to half your mythic rank.	Naučil ses způsob, jak zvýšit počet použití tvé schopnosti smite evil.	too_short:0.39
16508	Your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} are now less affected by luck.
Benefit: You don't automatically miss when you {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} a 1 on an attack roll.	Tvé {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} jsou nyní méně ovlivněny štěstím.	too_short:0.42
16510	You are a master of the {g|SpellsMageArmor}mage armor{/g} spell.
Benefit: Whenever you cast mage armor on yourself, it gives an additional armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to your mythic rank.	Jsi pánem kouzla {g|SpellsMageArmor}mage armor{/g}.	too_short:0.25
16517	You've mastered a certain element to a spectacular level.
Benefit: Choose one energy type (acid, cold, electricity, fire, sonic, or negative). The {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of that energy type you deal can no longer be prevented or reduced by energy {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistances{/g} or energy {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunities{/g}. This bonus works on any damage you deal with the chosen energy type.	Naučil ses do ohromné míry ovládnout určitý element.	too_short:0.12
16520	The creatures you summon gain a piece of your mythic power.
Benefit: Creatures summoned by you gain a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to their {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} equal to half your mythic rank plus 1. Their {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} now ignore {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} except N/—.	Tvoři, které přivoláš, získají kousek tvé mystické moci.	too_short:0.11
16522	You've found out that curses can be a blessing, and now you know how to use them.
Benefit: You gain an additional oracle curse, but it gives you no penalties.	Zjistil jsi, že kletby mohou být požehnáním, a nyní umíš je využít.	too_short:0.42
16524	You are a master of the {g|SpellsHideousLaughter}hideous laughter{/g} spell.
Benefit: When a creature fails a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against your hideous laughter spell, another random enemy within 30 feet of the target is affected by the same spell. This chain continues as long as targets continue to fail their saving throws.	Jsi mistrem kouzla {g|SpellsHideousLaughter}hideous laughter{/g}.	too_short:0.19
16526	You are a paragon of your sorcerous bloodline.
Benefit: You immediately gain an ability from the 20th level of your bloodline.	Jsi vzorem své sorcerous bloodline.	too_short:0.28
16635	Your strikes make cracks in the enemy's existence, leaving weak points for your allies to strike.
Benefit: Every time you hit a target in melee combat, you leave a mark on it. Any ally {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacking{/g} the marked target deals additional divine {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} per your mythic rank to the target, consuming the mark.
Note: Only one ally can leave a mark on a target at a time. Other allies with the Leading Strike ability do not deal additional damage to a marked target.	Tvé údery vytvářejí trhlinky v bytí nepřítele, zanechávají slabá místa, která mohou spojenci zasáhnout.	too_short:0.19
16637	Your mythic powers can negate any magic around you.
Benefit: Activating this ability grants you magic immunity and dispels any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} effects on you.	Tvé mytické síly mohou zneškodnit jakoukoli magii v okolí.	too_short:0.33
16639	You can make your patron give you additional powers.
Benefit: This ability lets you select any witch hex and grants you the ability to use the selected hex. You lose the ability to use the hex after choosing another hex with this ability.	Můžeš donutit svého patrona, aby ti propůjčil dodatečné síly.	too_short:0.26
16648	You send a part of your swarm to devour a corpse to increase the {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} of your swarm.
The increase depends on the CR of the devoured corpse. When the amount of eaten enemies hits a threshold, you gain permanently increased {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} from other Swarm That Walks abilities.	Odešleš část svého roje, aby sežrala mrtvolu a zvýšila tak {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} tvého roje.	too_short:0.31
16658	You become the Swarm.
Your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability scores{/g} are increased by 4 plus your swarm {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g}, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to 25 plus your swarm size, and you gain immunity to most harmful conditions.
You are also immune to the {g|ConditionExhausted}exhaustion{/g} and {g|ConditionFatigued}fatigue{/g} effects. Your swarm form grants you a +10 profane {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} for the Camouflage role and a +10 profane bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception{/g} skill checks for Night Watch during {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rest{/g} and movement on global map.	Stáváš se Rojem.	too_short:0.02
16659	The Swarm	Roj	too_short:0.33
16674	If a character can catch an ally when they are unable to defend themselves effectively from their {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g}, they can heal a vital spot for extra healing.
The character's heal heals extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} anytime their target would be denied a {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} (whether the target actually has a Dexterity bonus or not), or when the character {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanks{/g} their target. This extra healing is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} per die of your sneak attack. This extra healing is precision healing.	Pokud postava dokáže chytit spojence, který se účinně nedokáže bránit jejímu {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g}, může vyléčit životně důležité místo a získat dodatečné hojení.	too_short:0.27
16770	You create an extradimensional comfy hole with a depth of 10 feet per two {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} (maximum 30 feet) and a trampoline at the bottom. Since the pit extends into another dimension, the pit has no weight and does not otherwise displace the original underlying material. You can create the pit in the deck of a ship as easily as in a dungeon floor or the ground of a forest.
Any large or smaller creature standing in the area where you first conjured the pit must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} to not jump to safety in the pit. In addition, the edges of the pit are sloped, and any creature ending its turn in a space adjacent to the pit must make a Reflex saving throw with a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to avoid falling into it. Creatures subjected to an effect intended to push them into the pit (such as bull rush) do not get a saving throw to avoid falling in if they are affected by the pushing effect.
Creatures who fall into the pit take no falling {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (the trampoline is really handy).
Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} any creature in the pit is {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healed{/g} for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g} as extradimensional entities heal their wounds and make massage.
To climb the pit's soft and cozy walls, a creature needs a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of 25. When the duration of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} ends, creatures within the hole rise up with the bottom of the pit until they are standing on the surface over the course of a single round.	Vytvoříš extradimenzionální pohodlnou jámu s hloubkou 10 stop za každé dvě {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} (maximum 30 stop) a pružinou na dně. Poněvadž jáma zasahuje do jiné dimenze, nemá váhu a nijak jinak nevyhání původní podkladní materiál. Můžeš vytvořit jámu v palubě lodi stejně snadno jako v podzemním patře nebo v zemi lesa.	too_short:0.20

16824	Gnomes trace their lineage back to the mysterious realm of the fey, a place where colors are brighter, the wildlands wilder, and emotions more primal. Unknown forces drove the ancient gnomes from that realm long ago, forcing them to seek refuge in this world; despite this, the gnomes have never completely abandoned their fey roots or adapted to mortal culture. As a result, gnomes are widely regarded by the other races as alien and strange.
Gnomes are one of the smallest of the common races, generally standing just over 3 feet in height. Their hair tends toward vibrant colors such as the fiery orange of autumn leaves, the verdant green of forests at springtime, or the deep reds and purples of wild flowers in bloom. Similarly, their flesh tones range from earthy browns to floral pinks, frequently with little regard for heredity. Gnomes possess highly mutable facial characteristics, and many have overly large mouths and eyes, an effect which can be both disturbing and stunning, depending on the individual.	Gnomové hledají svůj původ v tajemném říši fey, místě s jasnějšími barvami, divočejší přírodou a primárnějšími emocemi. Neznámé síly kdysi dávno vyhnaly starobylé gnomy z oné říše a donutily je hledat útočiště v našem světě; přesto gnomové nikdy zcela neopustili své fey kořeny ani se nestali zcela mortálními. V důsledku toho jsou gnomové ostatními rasami považováni za cizí a podivné.	too_short:0.38

16834	Androids are superficially identical to humans in many ways, and to the uninformed it can be difficult to differentiate the two. In the right light, though, androids' alien nature is revealed by the metallic sheen in their eyes and the biological, tattoo-like circuitry that riddles their skin. Their bodies are completely artificial, though made of materials that mimic the flexibility, shape, and density of human flesh and bone. Their organs mirror those of humans so well that only by examining the materials and makeup of these systems — which use sheeny oils and polymer alloys rather than blood and marrow — could one guess that their physiology is alien. Androids are roughly the same size as humans; on average, they are 6 feet tall and weigh 200 pounds.
Kellid shamans speak of great forges where androids are born" from metal wombs and are cut from electrified umbilical cords. Even androids can't refute or verify such stories, since most who emerge from Numerian ruins do so naked and without any memories beyond their initial egress into the wide, unfamiliar world. Their complex design is unlike that of any race known to Golarion's solar system, leading many to suspect that they (and the alien spaceship on which they crashed onto Golarion) originated from a distant star system or even another galaxy.

column1: What separates androids from golems and other mindless constructs is that androids are living beings and as such possess souls. Similarly, androids don't live forever, though barring violence or tragedy their bodies never deteriorate. Rather, an android's cybernetic mind eventually shuts down and self-restarts after about a century, leaving its body vacant for several weeks as the old soul departs for its final reward in the Great Beyond and a fresh, new soul finds its way into the shell.
column2: Androidi jsou zvenčí povrchně podobní lidem v mnoha ohledech, a nezkušenému pozorovateli může být těžké je odlišit. Ve správném světle se však jejich cizí povaha prozradí kovovým leskem v očích a biologickými, tetováním připomínajícími obvody rozesetými po kůži. Jejich těla jsou zcela umělá, avšak z materiálů napodobujících pružnost, tvar a hustotu lidské tkáně a kostí. Jejich orgány tak věrně napodobují lidské, že jediným způsobem, jak odhalit, že jejich fyziologie je cizí, je zkoumání materiálů a složení těchto systémů — používají lesklé oleje a polymerové slitiny místo krve a dřeně. Androidi jsou přibližně stejně velcí jako lidé; průměrně měří 6 stop a váží 200 liber.
Standard — right mouse button click duplicates the left mouse button click.

column1: Force move — right mouse button click issues the "move" command.
RTS cursor — right mouse button click functions according to the classic real-time strategy algorithm: it issues either "move" or "attack" commands depending on the objects it hovers over.
column2: Standard — kliknutí pravým tlačítkem myši duplikuje kliknutí levým tlačítkem myši.
This option determines the power of all critical hits inflicted upon members of your party.

column1: Off — members of your party do not suffer critical hits.
Weak — damage bonuses are not multiplied on critical hits suffered by your party, making critical hits significantly less deadly.
Normal — members of your party receive full damage from critical hits.
column2: Tato volba určuje sílu všech kritických zásahů, které zasáhnou členy tvé družiny.

This option allows you to set the Crusade management difficulty to your preference. It affects the amount of resources gained and the number of recruits available for hire. It also provides additional free searches for mercenaries.

column1: Story difficulty multiplies by 3 the amount of resources gained and the number of recruits available for hire, and provides 3 additional free searches for mercenaries per week. Crusade morale cannot fall below –50.
Casual difficulty multiplies by 2 the amount of resources gained and the number of recruits available for hire, and provides 1 additional free search for mercenaries per week.
Crusade management difficulty does not affect the overall game difficulty. You cannot gain the "Sadistic Game Design" achievement on "Story" or "Casual" difficulty.
column2: Tato volba ti dovoluje nastavit obtížnost správy Crusade podle tvé vůle. Ovlivňuje množství získaných zdrojů a počet rekrutů k najmutí. Také poskytuje další bezplatná vyhledávání žoldnéřů.
This option determines whether the ability values of enemies are diminished or increased.

column1: Weak enemies have their ability scores reduced by 4, and their base attack bonus and AC will be reduced by 2.
Normal enemies have their ability scores unchanged.
Strengthened enemies have their ability scores increased by 4, and their base attack bonus and AC will be increased by 2.
Insane enemies have their ability scores increased by 8, and their base attack bonus and AC will be increased by 4.
column2: Tato volba určuje, zda budou hodnoty schopností nepřátel sníženy nebo zvýšeny.

column1: Encumbrance has no effect on your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.

column2: <align=center>Press [{bind|Stop}] to stop selected units. If combat AI is on, characters will act according to their AI pattern.</align>
column3: <align=center>Stiskni [{bind|Stop}] to stop selected units. If combat AI is on, characters will act according to their AI pattern.</align>

column2: <align=center>Press [{bind|Hold}] to hold selected units. They will continue to attack enemies with long-range weapons and spells.</align>
column3: <align=center>Stiskni [{bind|Hold}] to hold selected units. They will continue to attack enemies with long-range weapons and spells.</align>

column2: {target} is immune to energy drain in current combat due to difficulty settings.
Choose one boon for your next playthrough. The more dungeon floors you've conquered in your last playthrough, the better are the boons.

Set the amount of items to purchase
The event can be canceled during the day it was begun.
This event can only be resolved by visiting Commander's headquarters.
This region will be available to claim in the future.
You have not claimed any resources in this region yet.

A very small percentage of individuals may experience epileptic seizures or blackouts when exposed to certain light patterns or flashing lights. Exposure to certain patterns or backgrounds on a television screen or when playing video games may trigger epileptic seizures or blackouts in these individuals. These conditions may trigger previously undetected epileptic symptoms or seizures in persons who have no history of prior seizures or epilepsy.

column1: If you, or anyone in your family, has an epileptic condition or has had seizures of any kind, consult your physician before playing. IMMEDIATELY DISCONTINUE use and consult your physician before resuming play.

column2: Charging is a special {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} that allows you to move up to double your normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} during the same action.

column1: You must move before your attack, not after. You must move at least 10 feet, directly toward the designated opponent.
You must have a clear path toward the opponent.

After moving, you may make a single {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}. You get a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on the attack roll and take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} until the beginning of your next turn.
column2: Nápor je speciální {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}akce{/g}, která ti umožňuje pohnout se až do dvojnásobku tvé normální {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}rychlosti{/g} a {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}útočit{/g} během téže akce.
As a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g}, you can use a melee weapon to deliver a coup de grace to a {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g} opponent.

column1: You automatically hit and score a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. If the defender survives the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, they must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + attacker's {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} + melee damage ability modifier + weapon's critical multiplier) or die.
Delivering a coup de grace provokes {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} from {g|Encyclopedia:Threatened_Area}threatening{/g} opponents.
You can't deliver a coup de grace against a creature that is immune to critical hits.
column2: Jako {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g} můžeš použít melee zbraň k vykonání smrtícího úderu na {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g} protivníka.
You give the subject a single command, which it obeys to the best of its ability at its earliest opportunity. You may select from the following options.

column1: Approach: On its turn, the subject moves toward you as quickly and directly as possible for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. The creature may do nothing but move during its turn, and it provokes {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} for this movement as normal.

Fall: On its turn, the subject falls to the ground and remains {g|ConditionProne}prone{/g} for 1 round. It may act normally while prone but takes any appropriate {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g}.
Flee: On its turn, the subject moves away from you as quickly as possible for 1 round. It may do nothing but move during its turn, and it provokes attacks of opportunity for this movement as normal.
Halt: The subject stands in place for 1 round. It may not take any {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} but is not considered {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g}.
If the subject can't carry out your command on its next turn, the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} automatically fails.
column2: Dáš subjektu jediné rozkázání, které podle svých nejlepších schopností vykoná při první příležitosti. Můžeš vybrat z následujících možností.

You gain some of the beneficial qualities of an animal. Your base form is largely unchanged and your {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} is unaltered, but some of your body parts are altered. Armor or gear you are wearing adjusts to your new shape for the duration of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. When you cast animal aspect, choose one of the following animals to gain the associated benefits. You can only have one animal aspect or {g|SpellsGreaterAnimalAspect}animal aspect, greater{/g} spell active on you at a time.

column1: Gorilla: Your arms become long, flexible, and strong like those of a great ape. You gain a +4 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}CMB{/g}.

Monkey: Your hands and arms become dexterous like those of a simian. You gain a +4 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}, and you can throw objects as if you had the Throw Anything {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
Raccoon: Your hands become extremely dexterous, and your feet become padded. You gain a +2 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} checks.
Raptor: Your legs become built for running {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}, like those of a deinonychus. You gain a enhancement bonus of +20 feet to your base speed.
column2: Získáš některé blahodárné vlastnosti zvířete. Tvá základní podoba zůstává z většiny nezměněna a tvoje {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} se nemění, ale některé části těla jsou pozměněny. Zbroj nebo výbava, kterou nosíš, se na dobu trvání {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} přizpůsobí tvému novému tvaru. Když sesíláš animal aspect, vyber si jedno z následujících zvířat, abys získal příslušné výhody. Můžeš mít současně aktivní pouze jeden animal aspect nebo {g|SpellsGreaterAnimalAspect}animal aspect, greater{/g}.

You touch an object when you cast this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, causing the object to shed bright light in a 60-foot radius. This illumination increases the light level for an additional 60 feet by one step (darkness becomes dim light, dim light becomes normal light, and normal light becomes bright light). Creatures that take {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} in bright light take them while within the 60-foot radius of this magical light. Despite its name, this spell is not the equivalent of daylight for the purposes of creatures that are {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damaged{/g} or destroyed by such light.
column3: Při seslání tohoto {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} se dotkneš předmětu, který začne vydávat jasné světlo v poloměru 60 stop. Toto osvětlení zvýší úroveň světla o jeden stupeň na dalších 60 stop (tma → slabé světlo, slabé světlo → normální světlo, normální → jasné). Stvoření, která v jasném světle dostávají {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g}, je dostávají i v 60stopovém poloměru tohoto magického světla. Navzdory jménu tento {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} není ekvivalentem daylight pro účely tvorů, kteří jsou {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damaged{/g} nebo zničeni takovým světlem.

column2: You point your finger and fire a black ray of negative energy that suppresses the life force of any living creature it strikes. You must make a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit. If you hit, the subject gains {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} temporary negative levels.

column1: Negative levels stack. Assuming the subject survives, it regains lost levels after a number of hours equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 15 hours). Usually, negative levels have a chance of becoming permanent, but the negative levels from enervation don't last long enough to do so.
An undead creature struck by the ray gains 1d4 × 5 {g|Encyclopedia:Temporary_HP}temporary hit points{/g} for 1 hour.
column2: Ukážeš prstem a vystřelíš černý paprsek negativní energie, jež potlačuje životní sílu každé živé bytosti, kterou zasáhne. Musíš provést vzdálený {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}, abys zasáhl. Pokud zasáhneš, subjekt získá {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} dočasných negativních úrovní.
You draw down holy power to smite your enemies. Only {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}evil and neutral{/g} creatures are harmed by the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}; good creatures are unaffected.

column1: The spell deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per two caster levels (maximum 5d8) to each evil creature in the area (or 1d6 points of damage per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}, maximum 10d6, to an evil outsider) and causes it to become {g|ConditionBlind}blinded{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} reduces damage to half and negates the blinded effect.

The spell deals only half damage to creatures who are neither good nor evil, and they are not blinded. Such a creature can reduce that damage by half (down to one-quarter of the roll) with a successful Will save.
column2: Přivoláš posvěcenou moc, abys srazil své nepřátele. Pouze {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}evil and neutral{/g} stvoření jsou {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}em poškozena; dobrá stvoření jsou nedotčena.

You channel lawful power to smite enemies. The power takes the form of a three-dimensional grid of energy. Only {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}chaotic and neutral{/g} (not lawful) creatures are harmed by the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.

column1: The spell deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per two caster levels (maximum 5d8) to chaotic creatures (or 1d6 points of damage per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}, maximum 10d6, to chaotic outsiders) and causes them to be {g|ConditionDaze}dazed{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces the damage to half and negates the daze effect.

The spell deals only half damage to creatures who are neither chaotic nor lawful, and they are not dazed. They can reduce the damage in half again (down to one-quarter of the roll) with a successful Will save.
column2: Kanaluješ zákonnou moc, abys ztrestal nepřátele. Moc se projeví jako trojrozměrná mříž energie. Pouze {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}chaotic and neutral{/g} (nikoli zákonná) stvoření jsou {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}em poškozena.
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like {g|SpellsRestorationLesser}restoration, lesser{/g}, except that it also dispels temporary negative levels or one permanent negative level.

column1: Restoration {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cures{/g} all temporary {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g}, and it restores all points permanently drained from a single {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}. It also eliminates any {g|ConditionFatigued}fatigue{/g} or {g|ConditionExhausted}exhaustion{/g} suffered by the target.
column2: Toto {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} funguje jako {g|SpellsRestorationLesser}restoration, lesser{/g}, kromě toho, že také odstraňuje dočasné negativní úrovně nebo jednu trvalou negativní úroveň.

You use material from the Plane of Shadow to shape quasi-real illusions of one or more creatures, objects, or forces. Shadow conjuration can mimic any sorcerer or wizard conjuration (summoning) or conjuration (creation) {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} of 3rd level or lower. Shadow conjurations are only one-fifth (20%) as strong as the real things, though creatures who believe the shadow conjurations to be real are affected by them at full strength. Any creature that interacts with the spell can make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to recognize its true nature.

column1: Spells that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} have normal effects unless the affected creature succeeds on a Will save. Each disbelieving creature takes only one-fifth (20%) damage from the attack. If the disbelieved attack has a special effect other than damage, that effect is only 20% likely to occur. Regardless of the result of the save to disbelieve, an affected creature is also allowed any save that the spell being simulated allows, but the save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} is set according to shadow conjuration's level (4th) rather than the spell's normal level. In addition, any effect created by shadow conjuration allows {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}, even if the spell it is simulating does not. Shadow objects or substances have normal effects except against those who disbelieve them. Against disbelievers, they are 20% likely to work.

A shadow creature has one-fifth the {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of a normal creature of its kind (regardless of whether it's recognized as shadowy). It deals normal damage and has all normal abilities and weaknesses. Against a creature that recognizes it as a shadow creature, however, the shadow creature's damage is one-fifth (20%) normal, and all {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g} that do not deal lethal damage are only 20% likely to work. ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}Roll{/g} for each use and each affected character separately.) Furthermore, the shadow creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} are just one-fifth as large. A creature that succeeds on its save sees the shadow conjurations as transparent images superimposed on vague, shadowy forms. Objects automatically succeed on their Will saves against this spell.
column2: Využiješ látku z Plane of Shadow k utváření kvazi-reálných iluzí jednoho či více stvoření, předmětů či sil. Shadow conjuration umí napodobit jakékoli kouzlo sorcerera či wizardu ze školy conjuration (summoning) nebo conjuration (creation) {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} 3. úrovně či nižší. Shadow conjurations jsou však pouze jedné pětiny (20%) síly skutečných věcí, přesto však stvoření, která považují shadow conjurations za skutečné, jsou jimi postižena plnou silou. Každé stvoření, které s kouzlem interaguje, může učinit {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}, aby rozpoznalo jeho pravou podstatu.
This creature is covered in green slime.

column1: Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}
Effect: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Con{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g}
Cure: {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, cold damage, {g|SpellsRemoveDisease}remove disease{/g}
column2: Toto stvoření je pokryto zelenou slizem.
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} cures {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}5d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +25).

column1: Unlike other spells that {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} damage, breath of life can bring recently slain creatures back to life. If cast upon a creature that has died within 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}, apply the healing from this spell to the creature. If the healed creature's {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit point{/g} total is at a negative amount less than its {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score, it comes back to life and stabilizes at its new hit point total. If the creature's hit point total is at a negative amount equal to or greater than its Constitution score, the creature remains dead. Creatures brought back to life through breath of life gain a temporary negative level that lasts for 1 day.
Creatures slain by death effects cannot be saved by breath of life.
Like cure spells, breath of life deals damage to undead creatures rather than curing them, and cannot bring them back to life.
column2: Toto {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} vyléčí {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}5d8{/g} bodů {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}poškození{/g} + 1 bod za {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximálně +25).

You create a magical trap in the area that causes deadly stalactites or stalagmites to "bite" an intruder. The magical trap is triggered whenever an enemy creature moves through the affected area. The effect of cave fangs depends on whether you create stalactites or stalagmites (see below). You can place these traps anywhere within close range as {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} for the duration of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}; the trap's radius is 5 feet. Each time you place a trap, the spell's duration is reduced by 10 minutes.

column1: Stalactites: Shards of rock drop from above, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning and piercing damage{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex{/g} half). A creature that fails its Reflex save is pinned to the ground under stalactites and rubble, gaining the {g|ConditionEntangled}entangled{/g} condition until it can free itself with a successful {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 15 {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} or DC 20 {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g} check.

Stalagmites: Piercing spires of rock erupt up from the ground, dealing 3d8 points of piercing damage and knocking the creature {g|ConditionProne}prone{/g} (a successful Reflex saving throw halves this damage and avoids being knocked prone). Once the stalagmites appear, they function thereafter as {g|SpellsSpikeStones}spike stones{/g} for 1 minute per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} and then crumble to dust.
column2: Vytvoříš magickou past v oblasti, která způsobí, že smrtící stalaktity či stalagmity „kousnou“ vetřelce. Magická past se spustí vždy, kdy nepřátelská bytost projde postiženou oblastí. Účinek jeskynních tesáků závisí na tom, zda vytvoříš stalaktity nebo stalagmity (viz níže). Tyto pasti můžeš umisťovat kamkoli do {g|Encyclopedia:Close_Range}close range{/g} jako {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} po dobu trvání {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}; poloměr pasti je 5 stop. Pokaždé, když past umístíš, se doba trvání kouzla zkrátí o 10 minut.

You create an extradimensional hole with a depth of 10 feet per two {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} (maximum 100 feet). The pit has the ability to squeeze and crush any creature trapped within it.

column1: Any large or smaller creature standing in the area where you first conjured the pit must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} to jump to safety in the nearest open space. In addition, the edges of the pit are sloped, and any creature ending its turn in a space adjacent to the pit must make a Reflex saving throw with a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to avoid falling into it. Creatures subjected to an effect intended to push them into the pit (such as bull rush) do not get a saving throw to avoid falling in if they are affected by the pushing effect.

Creatures who fall into the pit take falling {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as normal ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} per 10 feet). In addition, anyone within the pit takes 4d6 points of bludgeoning damage each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as the pit contracts and then returns to its normal {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} (a successful Reflex save halves this damage). The ever-shifting walls of the pit are quite difficult to scale: to climb them, a creature needs a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of 35. When the duration of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} ends, creatures within the hole rise up with the bottom of the pit until they are standing on the surface over the course of a single round.
column2: Vytvoříš mimozemský otvor s hloubkou 10 stop na každé dvě {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} (maximálně 100 stop). Jáma má schopnost škrtit a drtit každou v ní uvízlou bytost.

You restore life to a deceased party member. A raised creature has a number of {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} equal to its current HD. Raise dead also removes the {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death's{/g} door condition.

column1: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The subject of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} gains two permanent negative levels when it is raised, just as if it had been hit by an energy-draining creature, though it can not gain a number of negative levels equal to or greater than its total {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} this way.
A creature whose permanent negative levels already equal its Hit Dice cannot be brought back to life through raise dead.
column2: Obnovíš život zemřelému členovi družiny. Vzkříšená bytost má počet {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} roven svým současným {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g}. Raise dead také odstraňuje {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death's{/g} door stav.
You must have a melee weapon in hand to cast this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.

column1: On a successful {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}, your weapon resounds. The target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}sonic damage{/g}. Your weapon is not harmed by this {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}.

If you are using your judgment ability or smite ability against the target, it is {g|ConditionStaggered}staggered{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} on a successful attack. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} negates the staggering effect.

On a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}, the target is {g|ConditionStunned}stunned{/g} for 1 round and {g|ConditionBlind}blinded{/g} for 1d6 rounds. A successful Fortitude save negates the stunning and blindness effects. If you are also using judgment or smite, your foe makes only a single save against all effects.
This spell immediately ends if your weapon leaves your hand.
Resounding blow stacks with the thundering weapon property.
column2: Musíš mít v ruce zbraň na blízko, abys mohl seslat toto {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
A ray of sickly greenish-gray negative energy issues forth from the palm of your hand.

column1: Make a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} against the target. A creature hit by this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} is wracked by painful spasms as its muscles and sinews wither and twist.

The subject takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g} per 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} you possess (maximum 5d4 each). This spell cannot reduce an {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} below 1. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} halves the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
column2: Z dlaně ti vystřelí paprsek nemocně zeleno-šedé negativní energie.

Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, you can target a single living creature, striking it with waves of power. The target must make a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g}, or suffer the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell's{/g} harmful effects. Depending on the target's {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g}, this {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} has as many as three effects:

column1: If the target's HD is 10 or more, it is {g|ConditionSickened}sickened{/g} for 10 minutes per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
If the target's HD is 5–9, it is {g|ConditionFrightened}frightened{/g} and sickened for 10 minutes per caster level.
If the target's HD is 4 or less, it is {g|ConditionParalyzed}paralyzed{/g}, frightened, and sickened
The effects are cumulative and concurrent for 10 minutes per caster level.
You must spend a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} each round after the first to target a foe.
column2: Každé {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} můžeš zacílit jedinou živou bytost a zasáhnout ji vlnami moci. Cíl musí uspět v {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g}, jinak utrpí škodlivé účinky {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. Podle {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} cíle má tento {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} až tři účinky:
Any non-good creature within the area of a holy word {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} suffers the following ill effects:

column1: If the creature's HD is up to your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} — 1, it is {g|ConditionBlind}blinded{/g}.
If the creature's HD is up to your caster level — 5, it is {g|ConditionParalyzed}paralyzed{/g} and blinded.
If the creature's HD is up to your caster level — 10, it is killed, paralyzed, and blinded.

The effects are cumulative and concurrent. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces or eliminates these effects. Creatures affected by multiple effects make only one save and apply the result to all of the effects. Creatures whose {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} are equal to or exceed your caster level are unaffected by holy word.
column2: Každá bytost, která není dobrá, v oblasti kouzla svaté slovo {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} trpí těmito škodlivými účinky:

You can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} a creature, harm an undead creature, or call upon a very recently dead creature to fight beyond death's reach. The target creature regains {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} (maximum 10d8).

column1: This healing can even bring back to life party members that have died within 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. If you cast this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} at a creature whose hit point total is at a negative amount less than its {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score, it comes back to life and stabilizes at its new hit point total. If you awaken a dead creature in this way, all allies within 60 feet who can see it regain consciousness gain a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} for 1 minute thereafter, as the healing powers of your deity have imbued them with renewed vigor.
Creatures killed by death effects cannot be revived this way. This spell deals damage to undead creatures rather than curing them, and it cannot bring them back to life.
column2: Můžeš {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}uzdravit{/g} bytost, ublížit nemrtvé bytosti nebo povolat velmi čerstvě zemřelou bytost, aby bojovala i za hrobem. Cílová bytost obnoví {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}bodů životů{/g} na každé 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} (maximum 10d8).

You implant within the minds of your targets the illusion that their skin is rotting away, large rents are appearing all over their bodies, and their internal organs are spilling out into a putrid half-liquid mass at their feet. Those who fail to disbelieve phantasmal putrefaction immediately take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g}. This {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} occurs only once.

column1: Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} after that, an affected target receives another {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to disbelieve the effect, and targets that fail must succeed at a Fortitude save or faint, falling asleep as per {g|SpellsSleep}sleep{/g} (except that it isn't a magical sleep effect). Waking up doesn't end the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} for a target; it must continue to attempt Will saves to disbelieve and Fortitude saves to avoid fainting each round until the spell ends or the target successfully disbelieves.
column2: Vkládáš do myslí svých cílů iluzi, že jim kůže hnije, po těle se jim tvoří velké trhliny a vnitřní orgány se jim vyvalily do zkažené polotekuté hmoty u jejich nohou. Ti, kdo neuspějí v rozpoznání phantasmal putrefaction, okamžitě utrpí {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} bodů {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}moudrosti{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}poškození{/g}. Toto {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}poškození{/g} nastává jen jednou.
This creature is a ravening monster — savage, bloodthirsty, and brutish. Until the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} ends, it has all of the following benefits and drawbacks:

column1: Its {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} scores drop to 1, and it is unable to cast spells.
It takes a –4 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saves{/g}.

It gains a +6 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +2 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d8{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Temporary_HP}temporary hit points{/g}. These temporary hit points disappear at the end of the spell's duration.

When the spell ends, on the next {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} this creature must succeed at a Will saving throw or take 1d4 points of Intelligence drain and 1d4 points of Charisma {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g}.
column2: Tato bytost je zuřivá příšera — krvelačná, divoká a brutální. Dokud {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} trvá, má všechny následující výhody i nevýhody:

This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} sequesters the targets' ability for higher reasoning, allowing their darker impulses to come to the fore. An affected target becomes a ravening monster — savage, bloodthirsty, and brutish. Until the spell ends, the targets have all of the following benefits and drawbacks:

column1: The targets' {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} scores drop to 1, and they are unable to cast spells.
The targets take a –4 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saves{/g}.

The targets gain a +6 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +2 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d8{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Temporary_HP}temporary hit points{/g}. These temporary hit points disappear at the end of the spell's duration.

When the spell ends, on the next {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} each affected creature must succeed at a Will saving throw or take 1d4 points of Intelligence drain and 1d4 points of Charisma {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g}.
column2: Toto {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} potlačuje schopnost cílů k vyššímu uvažování a dovoluje jejich temnějším pudům převzít nadvládu. Ovlivněný cíl se stane zuřivou příšerou — krvelačnou, divokou a brutální. Dokud kouzlo trvá, cíle mají všechny následující výhody i nevýhody:

A blast of furnace-hot wind blasts downward, inflicting {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} to all creatures in the area and knocking them {g|ConditionProne}prone{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} halves the fire damage and negates being knocked prone.

column1: Any creature that takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from a {g|SpellsSirocco}sirocco{/g} becomes {g|ConditionFatigued}fatigued{/g} (or {g|ConditionExhausted}exhausted{/g}, if already fatigued, such as from a previous {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} of exposure to a sirocco {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}). Creatures with the water subtype take a –4 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all saving throws against this spell and take double normal damage.
column2: Výbuch pecem horkého větru se snese dolů, způsobí {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}ohnivého poškození{/g} + 1 bod za {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} všem bytostem v oblasti a srazí je {g|ConditionProne}na zem{/g}. You speak a terrible word of power, setting up potentially lethal vibrations in the chosen target. column1: On the first round, the target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}5d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}sonic damage{/g} and is {g|ConditionStaggered}staggered{/g} for 1 round. A successful save halves the damage and negates the staggered effect.
On the second round, the target takes 5d6 points of damage and is {g|ConditionStunned}stunned{/g} for 1 round. A successful save halves the damage and negates the stunning effect.
On the third round, the target takes 10d6 points of damage and is stunned for 1d4+1 rounds. A successful save halves the damage and negates the stunning effect.
The resonating word has no power after the third round, even if the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell's{/g} duration is increased.
