column2: A treatise by the highborn and powerful ruler, His Excellency the esteemed Count Bartolo Mezinas

column1: Westcrown Royal Publishing. Approved by the censors.

From time to time, we see some politician unacquainted with warfare but driven by false humanity propose an absurd thought — that wars are somehow supposed to be fought in the open field, away from cities, and only between professional armies so as to avoid casualties among so-called 'non-combatants,' even if they are on the side of the enemy. The supporters of this ludicrous belief must be mistaking war for a tourney where fighters clash in mock battles, their swords clanging against shields as they avoid striking at the stomach or the head for fear of inadvertently delivering a mortal blow — in other words, achieving what would be their goal in real combat. Unlike mock fights, real war is a continuation of politics that utilizes force with the purpose of establishing the dominion of one group of people over another. And since power is the origin point of all morality, it goes without saying that no moral standards that may be customary in everyday life can impose limitations on power struggles — for the victor will be the one who determines those same standards.
When one wants to catch fish, one goes to the river, and when one wants to hunt game, ones goes to the forest — the natural habitat of one's prey, where it feeds, breeds, and rests. So if the prey is a human being, where else is one to go if not to the city? The city is where laws are passed, deals are made, treatises are written, and songs are composed. While pursuing the goal of subjugating a hostile society, one must begin by attacking its cities instead of wasting time maneuvering one army around another.
column2: Rukopis od urozeného a mocného vládce, Jeho Excelence ctihodného hraběte Bartola Mezinyse
A chaotic conglomeration of "confessions" from the Baphomet cultists.

column1: I murdered a crusader officer, assumed his appearance, and served in a crusade army for ten years. "I infiltrated the inquisitor squad of Kenabres and selected the 'cultists' that were to be burnt at the stake for half a year."
Nobody knows how much of this is true.

column2: A chaotic conglomeration of "confessions" from the Baphomet cultists.

column1: I used to be a paladin of the Eagle Watch, but then I succumbed to the temptation, murdered two of my friends, and came here. "I cooked for a crusade army for five years, poisoning at least a hundred soldiers."
Nobody knows how much of this is true.

column2: A fortified storage site for trophies. Here, artifactologists examine items of value retrieved from demons. Some of these items will be evaluated and sent to the treasury of the campaign, while the most powerful items will be passed on to the best warriors of the crusade.
A Reliquary provides a +3 bonus to attack, AC, saving throws and initiative for all mythic units. Only one Reliquary can be built in each fort.
column3: Zvyšuje AC všech jednotek v generálově armádě.

column2: This is the Saboteurs' Headquarters — the meeting place of the daredevils who make suicidal raids behind the enemy lines, disrupting logistics and communications and hunting down their messengers.
column3: Přiřaď generála, aby posílil tvou armádu a zvětšil její velikost.

column2: Saboteurs' Headquarters give all enemy units within the fort's area of control a –1 penalty to speed (to a minimum of 2), a –10 penalty to combat morale, and a –4 penalty to initiative. The effects of multiple Saboteurs' Headquarters don't stack.
column3: Nepřátelé se stahují. Chceš je pronásledovat a bojovat?

column2: Salvager's Post increases Materials and Energy Points income by 1. Only one Salvager's Post can be built in each fort.
An ancient sacred place of Sarkoris that was cleansed of demonic corruption and once again serves as a beacon of faith for mortals.
A Sanctuary increases Energy Points income by 5.

Scouts' Headquarters provide all allied units within the fort's area of control a +1 bonus to speed, a +10 bonus to combat morale, and a +4 bonus to initiative. The effects of multiple Scouts' Headquarters don't stack.
A temple where priests pray to gods, receiving their blessings and guiding their congregation. Many crusaders join the Crusade in response to inspired sermons.
The armor that will see the crusaders to victory is crafted here to the sound of ringing hammers and roaring fires.
A Smithy provides a +1 bonus to attack for all trainable units in {g|AdjoiningBuildings}[adjoining]{/g} buildings. Only one Smithy can be built in each fort except Drezen.
A Garrison Spellcasters' Lodge increases recruitment growth for the Main Spellcasters' Lodge by 25%. Only one Garrison Spellcasters' Lodge can be built in each fort.
A bastion of arcane and divine arts whose denizens are focused on constantly perfecting their skills away from uninitiated laymen.
Provides {g|Diplomacy6_4_Artefact}[masterpiece from an artisan from a distant land]{/g}.
column3: Poskytuje {g|Diplomacy6_4_Artefact}[masterpiece from an artisan from a distant land]{/g}.

column2: Help from the People of the Forest
Provides a {g|Artefact_Event_52}[trophy from the evil spirit]{/g}.

It's about time, honestly. Why should we have to beg rich folks for alms when we're fighting to save the world? You have the right to collect from them, so do it. Let them call us bandits and complain that we're saving them from the Abyss wrong as much as they like.
column3: Přál bych si, aby to nemuselo dojít až sem. Pomáhali nám a my je zrazujeme. Ale zaslouží si to...

column2: In truth, it doesn't make much of a difference whom we collect these 'donations' from. We'll be known as muggers all the same. {n}Dorgelinda lets out a heavy sigh.{/n} "Either way, we'll get through this crisis. It won't be easy, I can promise you that — but when has it ever been easy for us? I will report the results of the, uh, fund-raising efforts in due time."
column3: Nebude to poprvé, zvládnou to. Později jim klerici vysvětlí, že nebyla jiná cesta. Můžeme postavit katedrálu a prosit o odpuštění za naše hříchy... až zvítězíme.

column2: It's good to know you're not about to start throwing away the lives of your soldiers. Not all generals, {n}Seelah pauses to glare at Captain Odan with undisguised anger,{/n} "treat their soldiers in the same way."
column3: It's good to know you're not about to start throwing away the lives of your soldiers. Not all generals, {n}Seelah pauses to glare at Captain Odan with undisguised anger,{/n} "treat their soldiers in the same way."
column4: Je dobré vědět, že nechystáš zahazovat životy svých vojáků. Ne všichni generálové," {n}Seelah na chvíli zaváhá a vrhne na Kapitána Odana pohled plný nezatajeného hněvu,{/n} "své vojáky takto nezpracovávají."

column2: I have a few influential acquaintances who help mercenaries find lucrative contracts. I'll send your call to arms through them. Get your gold ready, you'll soon need it.
column3: I have a few influential acquaintances who help mercenaries find lucrative contracts. I'll send your call to arms through them. Get your gold ready, you'll soon need it.
column4: Mám pár vlivných známých, kteří pomáhají žoldnéřům najít lukrativní zakázky. Pošlu skrze ně tvou výzvu k zbraním. Připrav si zlato, brzy ho budeš potřebovat.

column2: If you believe the rumors, these forest and mountain bandits are similar to neathers — they live in constant danger and get their food through blood and violence. If that's true, they'll make good soldiers.
column3: If you believe the rumors, these forest and mountain bandits are similar to neathers — they live in constant danger and get their food through blood and violence. If that's true, they'll make good soldiers.
column4: Chceš‑li věřit zvěstem, tihle lesní a horscí bandité jsou podobní neatherům — žijí v trvalém nebezpečí a živí se krví a násilím. Pokud je to pravda, budou z nich dobří vojáci.

column2: Recruiters will leave for villages and hamlets immediately. Throwing stones using a looped strap is a popular pastime in our lands, so we'll have a sufficient number of strong recruits soon enough.
column3: Recruiters will leave for villages and hamlets immediately. Throwing stones using a looped strap is a popular pastime in our lands, so we'll have a sufficient number of strong recruits soon enough.
column4: Náběrači ihned vyrazí do vesnic a osad. Házení kamenů pomocí praku je v našich krajích oblíbenou zábavou, takže brzy budeme mít dostatek silných rekrutů.

column2: In worrying about the lives of individual soldiers, we must not put their safety above expediency. The price of defeat will be the loss of the entire army, not just a few soldiers.
column3: In worrying about the lives of individual soldiers, we must not put their safety above expediency. The price of defeat will be the loss of the entire army, not just a few soldiers.
column4: Když se obáváme o životy jednotlivých vojáků, nesmíme jejich bezpečí stavět nad užitek věci. Cena porážky bude ztráta celého vojska, ne jen pár mužů.

column2: {n}Greybor arches an eyebrow and smirks skeptically.{/n} "You're acquiring a powerful, but extremely vulnerable weapon. If we're not up against idiots, our enemy will see our weak spot and hit us there. That's exactly what I would do."
column3: {n}Greybor arches an eyebrow and smirks skeptically.{/n} "You're acquiring a powerful, but extremely vulnerable weapon. If we're not up against idiots, our enemy will see our weak spot and hit us there. That's exactly what I would do."
column4: {n}Greybor pozvedne obočí a skepticky se ušklíbne.{/n} "Získáváte mocné, ale nanejvýš zranitelné nástroje. Pokud nestojíme proti bláznům, nepřítel spatří naše slabé místo a udeří tam. Přesně tak bych postupoval i já."

column2: {n}Wenduag scoffs cynically.{/n} "Headhunters are no different from bandits, except their services will cost you a lot more, {mf|master|mistress}."
column3: {n}Wenduag scoffs cynically.{/n} "Headhunters are no different from bandits, except their services will cost you a lot more, {mf|master|mistress}."
column4: {n}Wenduag pohrdavě odfrkne.{/n} "Lovci hlav se neliší od banditů, leč jejich služby tě budou stát mnohem víc, {mf|pán|paní}."

column2: {n}Captain Odan mutters through his teeth,{/n} "Bandits standing side by side with valiant knights — what has become of our glorious traditions..."
column3: {n}Captain Odan mutters through his teeth,{/n} "Bandits standing side by side with valiant knights — what has become of our glorious traditions..."
column4: {n}Kapitán Odan zamručí mezi zuby,{/n} "Bandité bok po boku s udatnými rytíři — co se stalo s našimi slavnými tradicemi..."

column2: {n}Seelah's expression darkens.{/n} "Untrained, practically unarmed peasants in the rear... A perfect target."
column3: {n}Seelah's expression darkens.{/n} "Untrained, practically unarmed peasants in the rear... A perfect target."
column4: {n}Seelahin výraz ztemní.{/n} "Nevycvicení, prakticky neozbrojení sedláci vzadu... Dokonalý cíl."

column2: If we take a hundred archers and work them to the bone, in time, we will discover a dozen with real talent. They must be able to remain completely focused on their combat objective, taking out one opponent after another. And the infantry's duty is to shield such valuable assets from any attacks. With their bodies, if necessary.
column3: If we take a hundred archers and work them to the bone, in time, we will discover a dozen with real talent. They must be able to remain completely focused on their combat objective, taking out one opponent after another. And the infantry's duty is to shield such valuable assets from any attacks. With their bodies, if necessary.
column4: Když vezmeme sto lučištníků a vydrtili je k smrti, časem objevíme tucet s opravdovým talentem. Musí umět zůstat naprosto soustředění na svůj bojový úkol, klesat jednoho protivníka za druhým. A úkolem pěchoty je chránit takové cenné prvky před útoky. Svými těly, budeme‑li toho nuceni.

column2: They can use their heads, rather than just shooting wildly. Soldiers think the main thing is just to hit the target quickly and accurately — doesn't matter what kind of target it is, if it's an enemy, it's good enough for them. But when you hunt dangerous prey alone, you can't help but smarten up. You learn to spot the leader in a crowd, count the guards, figure out who will have the time to take an arrow for their leader and who won't. And you do your work from as far away as you can, so you don't put yourself at risk for no reason.
column3: They can use their heads, rather than just shooting wildly. Soldiers think the main thing is just to hit the target quickly and accurately — doesn't matter what kind of target it is, if it's an enemy, it's good enough for them. But when you hunt dangerous prey alone, you can't help but smarten up. You learn to spot the leader in a crowd, count the guards, figure out who will have the time to take an arrow for their leader and who won't. And you do your work from as far away as you can, so you don't put yourself at risk for no reason.
column4: Mohou používat rozum místo pouhého divokého střílení. Vojáci si myslí, že hlavní je jen zasáhnout cíl rychle a přesně — nezáleží, jaký to je cíl, pokud je to nepřítel, stačí. Ale když lovíš nebezpečnou kořist sám, nemůžeš než zešikovět. Naučíš se najít vůdce v davu, spočítat stráže, zjistit, kdo bude mít čas vzít šíp za svého pána a kdo ne. A pracuješ z co největší dálky, aby ses zbytečně nevystavoval riziku.

column2: {n}Wenduag's voice sounds a little abashed.{/n} "Well, how are they any worse than other uplanders? They're good hunters, because the bad ones, as I understand, are hanged or thrown in prison. They're vicious, decisive, well-accustomed to obeying their leader, and not afraid of crossing someone who's stronger. And the circumstances of their fights have taught them to strike first and without warning, dominating the enemy with a storm of arrows. These are great fighters, are they not?"
column3: {n}Wenduag's voice sounds a little abashed.{/n} "Well, how are they any worse than other uplanders? They're good hunters, because the bad ones, as I understand, are hanged or thrown in prison. They're vicious, decisive, well-accustomed to obeying their leader, and not afraid of crossing someone who's stronger. And the circumstances of their fights have taught them to strike first and without warning, dominating the enemy with a storm of arrows. These are great fighters, are they not?"
column4: {n}Wenduagin hlas zní trochu zahanbeně.{/n} "Jak jsou tedy horší než ostatní lidé z vysočiny? Jsou to dobří lovci — ti špatní, jak chápu, jsou pověšeni nebo vhazováni do žalářů. Jsou krutí, rozhodní, zvyklí poslouchat svého vůdce a nebojí se střetnout s silnějším. A okolnosti jejich bojů je naučily udeřit jako první a bez varování, přemoci nepřítele bouří šípů. To jsou skvělí bojovníci, ne?"

column2: Of course not. A sling is not an accurate weapon, but it is cheap and easy to learn. Slingers' training is inexpensive and brief. Any commoner can pick up the basics, and we'll be able to bring a large number of ranged troops onto the battlefield — their numbers will compensate for their lack of skill.
column3: Of course not. A sling is not an accurate weapon, but it is cheap and easy to learn. Slingers' training is inexpensive and brief. Any commoner can pick up the basics, and we'll be able to bring a large number of ranged troops onto the battlefield — their numbers will compensate for their lack of skill.
column4: Samozřejmě že ne. Prak není přesná zbraň, ale je levný a snadný k naučení. Výcvik prakářů je nenákladný a krátký. Každý poddaný se snadno naučí základy a budeme moci na bojiště nasadit velké množství střelců — jejich počet vyrovná nedostatek umění.

column2: However, my experience tells me that he will act differently. This is going to be a full-on assault — a decisive display of his power. When the enemy moves in on our position, we must meet them with a hail of arrows from the walls, gaining the full advantage of our superior defensive position. To prepare our army for this battle, I propose to pass a reform and increase the presence of ranged troops in our ranks. I believe light-armed slingers, a great number of whom can be trained quickly, will be adequate for our purposes.
column3: However, my experience tells me that he will act differently. This is going to be a full-on assault — a decisive display of his power. When the enemy moves in on our position, we must meet them with a hail of arrows from the walls, gaining the full advantage of our superior defensive position. To prepare our army for this battle, I propose to pass a reform and increase the presence of ranged troops in our ranks. I believe light-armed slingers, a great number of whom can be trained quickly, will be adequate for our purposes.
column4: Avšak zkušenost mi říká, že bude jednat jinak. Bude to plnohodnotný útok — rozhodující ukázka jeho moci. Když se nepřítel přiblíží k naší pozici, musíme mu čelit deštěm šípů z hradeb a plně využít výhod naší lepší obranné pozice. Abychom armádu připravili na tento boj, navrhuji provést reformu a zvýšit podíl střelců v našich řadách. Domnívám se, že lehce ozbrojení prakáři, jichž lze rychle vycvičit velké množství, budou pro naše účely postačující.

column2: By capturing this city, we have gone on the offensive for the first time in decades. We have broken the established mold — that which is taken by demons rarely escapes their grasp. The liberation of Drezen could become a symbol of new hope for mortalkind, and Khorramzadeh seeks to smother that hope in its cradle. Moreover, Drezen is a well-positioned foothold that threatens both the Worldwound and northern Mendev. Khorramzadeh cannot fail to appreciate its significance.
column3: By capturing this city, we have gone on the offensive for the first time in decades. We have broken the established mold — that which is taken by demons rarely escapes their grasp. The liberation of Drezen could become a symbol of new hope for mortalkind, and Khorramzadeh seeks to smother that hope in its cradle. Moreover, Drezen is a well-positioned foothold that threatens both the Worldwound and northern Mendev. Khorramzadeh cannot fail to appreciate its significance.
column4: Získáním tohoto města jsme poprvé za desetiletí přešli do ofenzívy. Překročili jsme zaběhlé schéma — co démoni jednou uchopí, zřídka unikne jejich sevření. Osvobození Drezenu by se mohlo stát symbolem nové naděje pro smrtelníky a Khorramzadeh usiluje tuto naději udušit v zárodku. Navíc Drezen představuje výhodný opěrný bod, který ohrožuje jak Worldwound, tak severní Mendev. Khorramzadeh nemůže přehlédnout jeho význam.

column2: I hope these measures will be enough to repel Khorramzadeh's onslaught. And if not... those who come to take our place will learn from our mistakes and fare better.
column3: I hope these measures will be enough to repel Khorramzadeh's onslaught. And if not... those who come to take our place will learn from our mistakes and fare better.
column4: Doufám, že tato opatření postačí odrazit Khorramzadehův nápor. A pokud ne... ti, kdo přijdou nahradit nás, se poučí z našich chyb a povede se jim lépe.

column2: But there is also a more pragmatic reason. Back in the day, Khorramzadeh planned to capture Drezen himself, but Minagho beat him to it. If he takes it back now, he will finally have his glory, as well as further humiliating Minagho.
column3: But there is also a more pragmatic reason. Back in the day, Khorramzadeh planned to capture Drezen himself, but Minagho beat him to it. If he takes it back now, he will finally have his glory, as well as further humiliating Minagho.
column4: A je tu i pragmatičtější důvod. Kdysi Khorramzadeh plánoval obsadit Drezen sám, ale Minagho ho předběhl. Pokud ho teď získá zpět, dostane konečně svou slávu a ještě více poníží Minagha.

column2: The thief named Laffar was a true worshiper of Norgorber. For him his craft was the most sacred of the arts, therefore he never cut a pouch from a carefree passer-by or purloined a shiny trinket that might lie in temptation's way. Laffar chose only impossible goals and Norgorber helped him. When he finally came to believe that no treasures were worthy of him, Laffar decided to steal from his god. He did this not out of greed, but to prove his skill, and thus luck was on his side.

column1: Having snatched a relic called the Stone of Ghostly Pathways from the abode of Norgorber, Laffar absconded, with cloaks rustling and daggers flashing behind his back. No matter how far north the crafty thief went, his pursuers kept on his tail, and soon Laffar realized that he was doomed. He threw the stolen stone into a pile of rubble and accepted his fate with a happy smile. Norgorber's servants never found the stolen relic, which meant that Laffar's trick ultimately met with success.

According to legend, after many centuries, the Stone of Ghostly Pathways fell into the hands of a shaman who lived near there. His guiding spiritual instinct led him to acquire this unremarkable stone. Was it a spiritual instinct, however, or was it the spirit of Laffar, the thief who had stolen from his god and who had finally decided to reveal where the forgotten relic had been hiding?
column2: Zloděj jménem Laffar byl skutečným ctitelem Norgorbera. Pro něj bylo jeho řemeslo nejsvátější z umění, a proto nikdy neodřízl pytlíček bezstarostnému kolemjdoucímu ani neodcizil blyštivou cetku, která by mohla svádět. Laffar si vybíral pouze nemožné cíle a Norgorber mu pomáhal. Když konečně uvěřil, že žádné poklady mu nejsou hodny, rozhodl se Laffar ukrást od svého boha. Nečinil to ze chamtivosti, ale aby předvedl své umění, a štěstí mu bylo nakloněno.

Captain Kerz became famous among the pirates of the Abyss after he slew the legendary monster called the Colorless One. This monstrosity spawned from the calcified remains of demon lord Colyphyr. His body became an island, his blood became crystals, and the disgusting ichor that seeped through the isle's crags gave life to a monster — a crystalline ooze of mythic proportions. Silent and unseen, the creature slid through the waves of Ishiar, waiting for airships. When spotting prey, its tendrils shot out of the water like monumental pillars and shattered decks into splinters. The translucent slime engulfed the sailors' bodies and slowly dissolved them. The Colorless One also attacked border settlements, devouring everything in its path and leaving nothing except bloody ooze and acid-scarred buildings behind. No weapon or spell could overcome this beast.

column1: For Captain Kerz, hunting the Colorless One was a challenge. Stalking the beast in Ishiar for three years, he figured out that the Colorless One regularly returned to Colyphyr to recover its strength and drink from springs tainted with the ichor of its progenitor. Kerz set up an ambush next to one of such riverlets, catching the Colorless One unaware. He gave a signal, and the fire spells ignited, encircling the mound of predatory slime with an incendiary wall. The creature boiled, foamed, and raged in the trap but could not break out. The thing was dying... but too slowly. The fire magic ran its course, and the incendiary wall began to fade. The Colorless One attacked, grabbing the pirates, and devouring them one after the other.

The outcome of the fight hung by a thread when a flaming arrow streaked through the sky — it was "Rabid Bitch," Captain Kerz's airship, and he was piloting her straight into the Colorless One. Her sails and her hull were ablaze, lit by the pirate's steady hand. The captain himself stood at the helm. The burning vessel struck the pile of slime like a battering ram, and an explosion shook the island. The monster's chunks were tossed hundreds of feet away, where they writhed helplessly and dried into crystalline powder.

Wafts of poisonous smoke rose to the sky and a toxic cloud swelled over the site of the explosion. And it was from that cloud that Captain Kerz triumphantly emerged — much to the joy of his remaining crew — covered in burns and sores left by the caustic slime, but alive and victorious. The tale of his hunt became a legend among the denizens of the Abyss, and the Colorless One became a small pile of crystallic refuse. However, it still retained a modicum of its terrifying power.
column2: Kapitán Kerz získal slávu mezi piráty propasti poté, co zabil legendární monstrum zvané Colorless One. Toto monstro vzniklo z zkamenělých pozůstatků démona Colyphyra. Jeho tělo se stalo ostrovem, jeho krev krystaly a odporný žlout, který prosakoval skalami ostrova, dal život nestvůře — krystalické slizu mýtických rozměrů. Tiché a neviditelné se stvoření klouzalo vichřemi Ishiaru, čekající na vzducholodě. Když spatřilo kořist, jeho chapadla vystřelila z vody jako monumentální pilíře a rozbila paluby na špalíky. Průsvitná šlacha obalila těla námořníků a pomalu je rozložila. Colorless One také napadal hraniční osady, požírajíc vše na své cestě a nezanechávajíc nic než krvavý sliz a budovy zohavené kyselinou. Žádná zbraň ani kouzlo nedokázaly porazit toto zvíře.

Djail Kann was an eccentric and capricious demon, indifferent to power and violence but a great lover of riddles and puzzles. It was he who captured the mysterious Collector that had been preying upon Alushinyrra's nobility and it was he who returned Ar-Mikheth's stolen golden carbuncle, but his most famous investigation is by far the case of the burning gladiators.

column1: One day, a bunch of slaves stepped onto the sand of the Battlebliss arena unbidden. They were cloaked in flames but did not scream, silently carrying the bodies of their slain jailers on the tips of their spears. Having formed a column before the demons, awestruck at the sight, they spoke in a single voice: "I have been taken from, so now I take." A moment later, they vanished in a conflagration that incinerated most of the spectators, leaving only charred words on the ashen floor of the arena: "For pain and fire."

This incident was just the beginning. The killings in the arena continued, with gladiators seemingly losing their minds and attacking the guards, catching fire, and burning to ash alongside their tormentors. All that remained were the cryptic words: "For pain and fire." Shamira the Ardent Dream commanded Djail to solve the mystery of these unusual deaths.

Djail took a cup of blood and on every wall of the arena, wrote the following: "I have taken from you. And I will take again." Having issued this challenge to the unknown killer, Djail waited — but not for long, because the bloody letters caught fire. Djail proclaimed he had solved the riddle and would reveal the answer to everyone on the next day. The next moment, a dozen thralls turned into pillars of flame and surrounded Djail. In a single voice, they asked: "Do you think you have exposed me, demon? What do you even know, you arrogant fiend?"

I know your name. You are Nemarius, a demigod born of the goddess Sekhmet. You and your wife-to-be were captured and forced to fight to the death in the arena. She fell, and you set yourself on fire out of grief, but were never truly gone. Your spirit is bound to this object! Smiling, Djail presented the brand used to mark the slaves as the arena's property. "I used my sorcerous sight to watch you light up my words, and I felt where the threads of your spells converge. This brand left its mark on your skin and the skin of your beloved bride. It was also used to mark the slaves whose minds you dominate and use as the instruments of your revenge. Or am I wrong?"
The burning gladiators howled in Nemarius's voice, but it was too late. Djail cast a spell on the brand that trapped the vengeful demigod, defeating and disempowering his foe.
The tradition of using hot iron to mark the gladiators ceased, and the fate of Nemarius's brand remains unknown up to this very day.
column2: Djail Kann byl výstřední a rozmarný démon, lhostejný k moci a násilí, avšak velký milovník hádanek a rébusů. On zajal tajemného Collector, který terorizoval šlechtu Alushinyrra, a on vrátil Ar-Mikhethův ukradený zlatý karbunkl, ale jeho nejslavnějším vyšetřováním zůstává případ hořících gladiátorů.

The followers of the demon lord Baphomet commit countless crimes to earn his favor. Kearius was a servant of Desna who was in charge of the temple shelter, but secretly worshiped the Lord of Beasts. He took advantage of his position to build a cunning maze in the temple's secret basement and filled it with fierce and bloodthirsty monsters. Each night, Kearius cast an overly trusting vagabond or a homeless person into the maze, where they met their grisly end.

column1: The cultist spread heresy and depravity, corrupting the other priests. Baphomet took note of his servant's guile and bestowed an incredible gift upon him — a spark of the flame gracing the brow of the Lord of Monsters himself. The lantern containing this spark could summon fiery denizens of the Abyss, and its swaying could hypnotize or conjure terrifying illusions. Kearius enshrined the flame of his lord and master at the very heart of his maze.

But soon enough, an incredible thing happened. A lonely beggar boy — a frail and timid creature — fell into Kearius' clutches and was cast down into the maze. Somehow, he managed to survive and reach the very center of the trap. He reached out for the flame with his scraggly hands and was gone. Frightened and furious, Kearius found the empty shrine and set out to pursue the pilferer. He feared that Baphomet might learn about this failure and punish his negligent servant.

After a while, he learned of entire villages reduced to ash by fiery creatures, with the survivors driven insane by the eerie glow of a sinister flame. They raved and rambled about a frail beggar boy with hellish fire in the palm of his hands.

Kearius tracked the young man down. Fear tugged at his heart and nudged him toward madness. When he finally reached the boy, the beggar laughed and turned into a cocky young man, decked in the garb of a Baphomet cultist. The grinning rogue said it was the Lord of Monsters himself who had inspired him to steal the unholy flame, and even devised the guise of the feeble child. Kearius's failure would be his downfall, and the sneaky thief would take his place as Baphomet's most loyal servant. A fight broke out where both demon worshipers sought to destroy one another, but neither could gain the upper hand. When they became tired, the Lord of Beasts' flame slipped from the thief's sweaty hands and fell onto a pile of dead branches. Fiery creatures emerged from the fire and surrounded the weakened priests, the monsters' eyes glowing like embers. The cultists pleaded with their master for protection, but their appeals fell on deaf ears. The spawn of Baphomet's flame feasted on the sinners' flesh all night, and when the fire burned out, only a tiny spark of the unholy flame was left smoldering among the remains.
column2: Následovníci démona-pána Baphometa páchají nespočet zločinů, aby si získali jeho přízeň. Kearius byl služebníkem Desny, který měl na starosti chrámové útočiště, ale potají uctíval Lord of Beasts. Využil svého postavení k vybudování lstivého bludiště v tajném suterénu chrámu a naplnil jej zuřivými, krvelačnými nestvůrami. Každou noc Kearius vrhl do bludiště přehnaně důvěřivého tuláka nebo bezdomovce, kde je čekal hrozný konec.

Priests of Shelyn only speak the name of Francest, the Cursed Bard, in terrified whispers. There was a day when he was one of them, and his fame resounded from Varisia to Andoran. He traveled the world with a song and a smile, and a lovely wife at his side. He dreamt of creating the Song of All and spent years gathering sounds and notes for the melody that would encompass the entire Creation in supreme harmony. The laughter of a child and the confession of love, the triumphant cry and the gentle lullaby — all became sources for his inspiration. The journey brought the husband and wife to Drezen, where the great bard sang for the soldiers to inspire them before battle, but one night darkness descended upon Francest.

column1: You are gathering only the notes of joy, bard, it whispered mockingly. "But there are so many other sounds you have never heard before," it murmured. "Pay me with the blood of your love, and I will reveal them to you." Francest attempted to resist Nocticula's seductive voice, but to no avail — by dawn, his hand reached for the knife on its own accord.

He walked through the city streets covered in his wife's blood, singing a song with a happy smile on his face, and nobody dared to stop him — so terrifying and powerful was his voice. The call brought Francest to Alushinyrra where he kept gathering the notes to compose the Song of All: the cries of a mother whose children were butchered in front of her, the moans of a warrior whose hands were being chopped off, the wailing of lovers who would never see each other again. His cruelty astonished even demons. He murdered and tortured women and men, but the smile never left his face.

Years went by, and the Song of All was almost complete. The Cursed Bard was lacking one final chord. He came to the Fleshmarkets and walked among slaves, treating them to sweet wine and even sweeter songs. The thralls watched him with hope and timid smiles. They gratefully accepted the cup he offered, but wine's tangy aftertaste quickly gave way to searing pain. The bard's wine casket was full of poison that liquefied innards, and the moans of the dying joined Francest's song as its final note.

The Cursed Bard drank the bitter dregs himself. He sang as he lay dying... and was happy. The demons listened to his performance with bated breath. It was the Song of All Wicked, a hymn to the darkest night where the cursed fire burns bright.

When Francest fell silent, his body was reduced to rancid ooze. The poison spared only the bard's vocal cords, which the demons preserved as a grisly relic. They became a memento of the most frightful, the most remorseless song Alushinyrra ever heard.
column2: Kněží Shelyn vyslovují jméno Francest, the Cursed Bard, jen v vyděšených šepotech. Byl dnem, kdy byl jedním z nich, a jeho sláva se nesla od Varisie až po Andoran. Putoval světem s písní na rtech a úsměvem, po boku měl milou manželku. Sníval o stvoření Song of All a roky sbíral zvuky a tóny pro melodii, která by obsáhla celé Stvoření v nejvyšší harmonii. Smích dítěte i vyznání lásky, vítězný jekot i něžná ukolébavka — to vše bylo zdrojem jeho inspirace. Cesta zavedla manžele do Drezen, kde velký bard zpíval vojákům, aby je před bitvou povzbuzoval, ale jedné noci se nad Francestem snesla temnota.
After capturing Drezen the crusaders raised the three Morale Banners on the city walls:

column1: * The Banner of Victories stays green while you defeat demon armies. Each victory over a demon Army in Lands of Yath, Gray Road, Lake Lost to the Sun, and Wintersun Lands regions adds 6 days to the time the Banner of Victories stays green.

* The Banner of Conquest stays green while you capture demon forts. Each capture of a demon fort in Lands of Yath, Gray Road, Lake Lost to the Sun, and Wintersun Lands regions adds 30 days to the time the Banner of Conquest stays green. Reclaiming forts that were previously lost does not affect the Banner of Conquest.

* The Banner of Defense remains green as long as none of your forts are under siege. If any of your forts is besieged, the Banner of Defense turns yellow for 3 days, then turns red. As long as any fort remains captured by the demons, this Banner remains red.
Banners still affect the daily change of crusade morale. A red Banner decreases morale by 3 per day, a yellow or green Banner increases it by 1 per day.
column2: Po dobytí Drezen křižáci vztyčili na hradbách města tři prapory morálky:

To construct a building, select it on the panel on the right, then place it on one of the free squares. Buildings that take up more than one square will become available later on. Constructing new buildings takes resources and time.

column1: Canceling a construction in progress will refund its resource cost completely. Razing a constructed building will refund only a part of its resource cost.
Rank up crusade stats to gain access to new buildings.
column2: Chceš‑li postavit budovu, vyber ji v panelu vpravo a umísti na jedno z volných polí. Budovy zabírající více polí se zpřístupní později. Stavba nových budov vyžaduje zdroje a čas.
You can switch between party management and army command modes by pressing {console_bind|FuncAdditional}.

column1: In army command mode, you can select armies by pressing {console_bind|LeftBottom}.
Much like your party, armies use roads to move around the map. To move, an army must spend movement points, which can be restored by resting for one day.
column2: Mezi režimy správy družiny a velení armád můžeš přepínat stiskem {console_bind|FuncAdditional}.
You can switch between party management and army command modes by clicking the banners at the top of the screen.

column1: In army command mode, you can select armies by either using the panel on the left or clicking the figures on the map.
Much like your party, armies use roads to move around the map. To move, an army must spend movement points, which can be restored by resting for one day.
column2: Mezi správou družiny a velením armád můžeš přepínat kliknutím na prapory v horní části obrazovky.
Your army has engaged in battle!

column1: The enemy army is displayed on the right, and the crusader army is on the left.

Battles are played out in turn-based mode. The turn order is displayed on the left side of the screen. Units with high initiative act first. Once all units have taken their turn, a new round begins and the turn order is repeated.
column2: Tvoje armáda vstoupila do bitvy! Nepřátelská armáda je zobrazena vpravo, křižácká armáda vlevo.
Your army has engaged in battle!

column1: The enemy army is displayed on the right, and the crusader army is on the left.

Battles are played out in turn-based mode. The turn order is displayed at the top of the screen. Units with high initiative act first. Once all units have taken their turn, a new round begins and the turn order is repeated.
column2: Tvoje armáda vstoupila do bitvy! Nepřátelská armáda je zobrazena vpravo, křižácká armáda vlevo.
During its turn, a unit can perform one of the following actions:

column1: * Move and/or use its melee attack. The range of the unit's movement depends on its speed.
* Use a ranged attack, if one is available to the unit and there are no enemies near it.
* Use an ability, if one is available to the unit (abilities are displayed at the bottom of the screen).
* Take up the Total Defense, boosting its AC for one round.
* Wait, postponing its action until the end of the round.
column2: Během svého tahu může jednotka provést jednu z následujících akcí:
Whenever a unit performs an attack, the damage dealt is calculated as follows:

column1: * All soldiers in the attacking unit make a damage roll to determine the base damage.
* The damage multiplier is determined according to the formula [(Attacking Unit's Attack + 21 — Target's AC)×0.05]. The damage multiplier cannot be less than 0.05.
* The base damage is multiplied by the damage multiplier, resulting in the total damage dealt.
column2: Když jednotka provede útok, vypočítá se způsobené poškození takto:

You have defeated your first enemy army and received a number of Finance Points. You can use these Finance Points to hire a general for your army. This can be done in the army window. To open the army window, select an army, press {console_bind|Func02}, and then press {console_bind|Func01}.

column1: Generals can use various spells and abilities in combat. Their capabilities grow as their level increases. Generals gain experience by winning battles at the head of their army.
Each general belongs to one of three classes, which is indicated by an icon next to their portrait:
* Fighter (sword and shield) focuses on boosting the strength of their troops.
* Ranger (bow) weakens enemy units.
* Wizard (fireball) utilizes a wide variety of spells in combat.
Generals cannot be killed. If a general's army is defeated, the general can be assigned to a new army after three days.
column2: Porazil jsi svou první nepřátelskou armádu a obdržel několik Finance Points. Tyto Finance Points můžeš použít k najmutí generála pro svou armádu. Učiníš tak v okně armády. Pro otevření okna armády vyber armádu, stiskni {console_bind|Func02} a pak {console_bind|Func01}.

You have defeated your first enemy army and received a number of Finance Points. You can use these Finance Points to hire a general for your army. This can be done in the army window in the left corner of the screen.

column1: Generals can use various spells and abilities in combat. Their capabilities grow as their level increases. Generals gain experience by winning battles at the head of their army.
Each general belongs to one of three classes, which is indicated by an icon next to their portrait:
* Fighter (sword and shield) focuses on boosting the strength of their troops.
* Ranger (bow) weakens enemy units.
* Wizard (fireball) utilizes a wide variety of spells in combat.
Generals cannot be killed. If a general's army is defeated, the general can be assigned to a new army after three days.
column2: Porazil jsi svou první nepřátelskou armádu a obdržel jsi určité množství Finančních bodů. Tyto Finanční body můžeš použít k najmutí generála pro svou armádu. To lze provést v okně armády v levém rohu obrazovky.
The general's Attack and Defense are added as a bonus to the attack and AC of all units in their army.

column1: The general's Power affects the effectiveness of their abilities and spells.
Initially, an army can be composed of up to three units, but experienced generals who have the Master of Maneuver feat can lead armies made up of a larger number of units.
When the battle results in a victory, the general's infirmary brings back some of the lost units. The infirmary size is limited, and thus it prioritizes restoring units of the highest value.
column2: Hodnoty Útoku a Obrany generála se přičítají jako bonus k útoku a AC všech jednotek v jeho armádě.
Once per round, before the action of any allied unit, a general can use an ability or a spell.

column1: The abilities of generals in the Fighter and Ranger classes have a limited number of uses per battle.
The spells of a Wizard do not have this restriction, but their use requires spending the general's Energy. Each day, generals restore 10% of their maximum Energy.
column2: Jednou za kolo, před akcí kterékoliv spojenecké jednotky, může generál použít schopnost nebo kouzlo.
This new victory has brought you more Finance Points, which can be used to strengthen your army.

column1: To recruit new units, press {console_bind|LeftBottom} and select "Recruit". Recruited units appear in Kenabres. New units will be available for recruitment at the beginning of each week.
column2: Toto nové vítězství ti přineslo více Finančních bodů, které můžeš použít ke zpevnění své armády.
This new victory has brought you more Finance Points, which can be used to strengthen your army.

column1: To recruit new units, click the Recruit button on the panel on the left at the bottom of the screen. Recruited units appear in Kenabres. New units will be available for recruitment at the beginning of each week.
column2: Toto nové vítězství ti přineslo více Finančních bodů, které můžeš použít ke zpevnění své armády.
Wishing you'd been able to have your fun there? Cry me a river!
The note is half burned, only the beginning is still readable:

column1: The secret to opening the stable and loosing the beasts lies in four colors. The first is yellow, like the sun, never to be seen down here in the caves...
The note cuts off here.
column2: Poznámka je napůl spálená, zůstal čitelný jen začátek:
The note is burned at the edges, but the text is still readable.

column1: ...green, like the grass that mongrels have never seen. The fourth is blue, like the sky they will never set eyes on.
column2: Poznámka má spálené okraje, ale text je stále čitelný.
The words on the paper are written in blood.

column1: Red. Like the crusader blood we feed our children. Red. Like the demon blood that has bound us stronger than any chains. Red. Like our blood, which we shall shed in honor of Lord Baphomet. Red.
column2: Slova na papíře jsou napsána krví.

Follow these simple rules, or you will die.
1. Don't bother me unless strictly necessary.
2. Keep the door to the shrine locked with the key I made. I don't care which one of you two holds onto it. You can tear each other to shreds over it for all I care.
3. Don't even think of setting foot in the ritual chamber. Ever.
4. Keep the door to the unfinished section of the Maze locked at all times. As a reminder for you feebleminded vermin: the entrance is sealed using the hidden lever — the torch on the wall next to the door. The door itself is in the room with the blood pool where I sometimes relax.
5. Do something about that damn water elemental already! Do whatever you want with it, just make sure it's gone by tomorrow!
6. Find a better hiding place for the paladin sword from the surface. I'll deal with that later.
7. Remember that your life means less than nothing to me. I have plenty of people vying to become the Hand of Hosilla.
Hosilla
column3: Řiďte se těmito prostými pravidly, nebo zemřete.

column2:
List of exhibits:
General Tertius Wharl's Drinkware — a set of crystal glasses and a decanter. This very set was served at General Wharl's last dinner. Shortly after the beginning of the feast, the general received a message saying that Queen Galfrey had uncovered his treason and his pact with the demons. Her knights were already on their way to his residence with an order for his arrest. The general succumbed to his cowardice and chose to die of poison, refusing to go through the courts and receive his punishment with honor. It is unclear which glass the general himself used to drink the poisoned wine from, and which one was used by Vivilla, his wife and associate, and also a witch. This exhibit was donated to the museum by General Wharl's family.
Captain Lykos's Funeral Urn — Captain Lykos was in charge of 30 scouts during the Third Crusade. His unit consisted mostly of fresh recruits who had only recently arrived in Mendev. When they stumbled upon one of the last bands of Sarkorian refugees fleeing the territory occupied by demons, they decided to rob the poor people instead of escorting them to safety. Captain Lykos tried to bring his soldiers to heel, but they pulled him off his horse and tore his body to pieces in the ensuing chaos. The Sarkorians delivered Lykos's remains to Kenabres as a token of gratitude for his brave attempt to protect them.
The Dark Horn — the glaive of a mighty minotaur who led one of the countless assaults on Mendevian territory. Sir Ravignon's last trophy. Sir Ravignon was a paladin once, but his debauchery, vices, and heavy drinking caused him to lose the favor of Iomedae. After that, he sought the goddess's mercy by any means possible. According to witnesses, during the battle with the Dark Horn's owner, Sir Ravignon regained his ability to cast spells, and his weapon shone and gave off a blistering heat. He apparently had succeeded in atoning for his sins and the Inheritor found him worthy of one last blessing for his final battle. This weapon was donated to the museum by Knight Couvarro, Sir Ravignon's illegitimate son.
The Grace of Peace — the blade that once belonged to a crusader named Whist who served his duty at a vanguard fort near Kenabres. When the fort was put under siege, the majority of the soldiers committed treason, killed the commander, and tried to join the demonic forces. Whist wasn't among them, however. He executed the traitors and managed to leave the doomed fort without being seen. For the next ten days, he stealthily dogged the demons, killing them whenever he could. After several failed attempts to track Whist down, the demons reanimated his former comrades and put them on his trail. The brave crusader granted all of them the eternal grace of peace and, gravely wounded, went on to Kenabres to warn the guards about the approaching enemy army. This item was donated to the museum by the Town Hall of Kenabres.
Lady Callandra's Chainmail — the armor of the famed inquisitor and warrior, Lady Callandra. She personally exposed and executed more than a hundred demon spies hiding among the сrusaders. The demons hated her for her perception and insight and made no less than seven failed attempts on her life. It is believed that she never removed her faithful mail, not even when she slept. Lady Callandra died when a traitor planted a venomous snake in her bed.
column3: Seznam exponátů: General Tertius Wharl's Drinkware — sada křišťálových sklenic a karafy. Tato právě sada byla podána při poslední večeři General Tertius Wharl. Krátce po začátku hostiny generál obdržel zprávu, že Queen Galfrey odhalila jeho zradu a pakt s démony. Její rytíři byli již na cestě k jeho sídlu s rozkazem k jeho zatčení. Generál podlehl své zbabělosti a zvolil smrt jedem, odmítl projít soudem a přijmout trest v čestném duchu. Není jasné, ze které sklenice generál sám pil otrávené víno a která patřila Viville, jeho manželce a spojenky, která byla také čarodějkou. Tento exponát darovala muzeu rodina General Tertius Wharl.

column2: {n}The eyes of a young lad peer out at you from under the massive helmet. At this proximity, it is obvious that his armor is ill-fitting and mismatched, and the helmet specifically is either very poorly made or a theater prop.{/n}
column3: {n}The eyes of a young lad peer out at you from under the massive helmet. At this proximity, it is obvious that his armor is ill-fitting and mismatched, and the helmet specifically is either very poorly made or a theater prop.{/n}
column4: {n}Zpod masivní přilby na tebe vykukují oči mladíka. Z takové blízkosti je zřejmé, že jeho brnění je špatně padnoucí a nesladěné, a přilba je buď velmi nekvalitně vyrobená, nebo divadelní rekvizita.{/n}

column2: Pardon me... I saw you with that shawl... Does this mean that you're a friend of Aranka's? What am I saying, of course it does! So...
column3: Pardon me... I saw you with that shawl... Does this mean that you're a friend of Aranka's? What am I saying, of course it does! So...
column4: „Promiňte… viděl jsem vás s tím šálem… Znamená to, že jste Arankin přítel? Co to povídám, samozřejmě že ano! Takže…“

column2: {n}The young man's speech is interrupted by the arrival of a new cast of characters: people in the robes of Iomedae's inquisitors appear from all sides, surrounding him.{/n} "Adept Thall of the temple of {g|Desna}Desna{/g}, you are under arrest on suspicion of treason and aiding the demons. You have one minute to come quietly. Drag your feet, and we'll count that as an attempt to resist justice!"
column3: {n}The young man's speech is interrupted by the arrival of a new cast of characters: people in the robes of Iomedae's inquisitors appear from all sides, surrounding him.{/n} "Adept Thall of the temple of {g|Desna}Desna{/g}, you are under arrest on suspicion of treason and aiding the demons. You have one minute to come quietly. Drag your feet, and we'll count that as an attempt to resist justice!"
column4: {n}Mladíkův projev přeruší příchod nové skupiny postav: ze všech stran se objevují lidé v rouchu Iomedaeiných inkvizitorů a obklopují ho.{/n} „Adept Thall z chrámu {g|Desna}Desna{/g}, jste zatčen pro podezření ze zrady a pomáhání démonům. Máte jednu minutu na klidné vydání se. Budete-li se zdržovat, započítáme to jako pokus o odpor proti spravedlnosti!“

column2: {n}Prelate {g|Hulrun}Hulrun{/g} appears behind his people.{/n} "And here's the traitor who almost corrupted the {g|wardstone}Wardstone{/g} with his magic. You didn't think that the disorder and demonic presence in the city would distract us from pursuing traitors, did you?"
column3: {n}Prelate {g|Hulrun}Hulrun{/g} appears behind his people.{/n} "And here's the traitor who almost corrupted the {g|wardstone}Wardstone{/g} with his magic. You didn't think that the disorder and demonic presence in the city would distract us from pursuing traitors, did you?"
column4: {n}Prelát {g|Hulrun}Hulrun{/g} se objeví za svými lidmi.{/n} „A tady je zrádce, který málem korumpoval {g|wardstone}Wardstone{/g} svou magií. Nemysleli jste si snad, že by nás nepořádek a démonická přítomnost ve městě odradily od stíhání zrádců, že ne?“

column2: {n}The youth's eyes go wide and he says nothing, clearly not knowing what to do.{/n}
column3: {n}The youth's eyes go wide and he says nothing, clearly not knowing what to do.{/n}
column4: {n}Oči mladíka se rozšíří a nic neřekne; zjevně neví, co má dělat.{/n}

column2: I do not take instructions on how to dispense justice from a wandering stranger. Guard, seize the troublemaker and bring him directly to me for questioning!
column3: I do not take instructions on how to dispense justice from a wandering stranger. Guard, seize the troublemaker and bring him directly to me for questioning!
column4: „Neberu žádné instrukce o tom, jak vykonávat spravedlnost, od potulného cizince. Stráž, chyttejte výtržníka a přiveďte ho přímo ke mně k výslechu!“

column2: I do hope you realize that by defending this traitor, you make yourself his accomplice. But even if you don't realize — it's no matter. Seize the rabble-rousers!
column3: I do hope you realize that by defending this traitor, you make yourself his accomplice. But even if you don't realize — it's no matter. Seize the rabble-rousers!
column4: „Doufám, že si uvědomujete, že obhajobou tohoto zrádce se stáváte jeho komplici. Ale i kdybyste to nepochopili — to nevadí. Chyťte výtržníky!“

column2: We are following orders and acting for the good of the city. The troublemaker must be arrested!
column3: We are following orders and acting for the good of the city. The troublemaker must be arrested!
column4: „Plníme rozkazy a jednáme pro dobro města. Ten výtržník musí být zatčen!“

column2: {n}Hulrun frowns in distaste at your words.{/n} "Seize the troublemaker, ignore any bystanders."
column3: {n}Hulrun frowns in distaste at your words.{/n} "Seize the troublemaker, ignore any bystanders."
column4: {n}Hulrun se nad tvými slovy zamračí v nechuti.{/n} „Zajměte výtržníka, ignorujte případné kolemjdoucí.“

column2: {n}Desperation sparks in the young man's eyes.{/n} "Desna, stay with me until the last!"
column3: {n}Desperation sparks in the young man's eyes.{/n} "Desna, stay with me until the last!"
column4: {n}V očích mladíka plane zoufalství.{/n} „Desno, buď se mnou až do konce!“

column2: {n}The young man glances at the bodies of the inquisitors, then turns around.{/n} "Oh Desna, why, in doing what is right, must we so often be forced to spill blood where it is not necessary? Can this really be the price of the true path, and of freedom?"
column3: {n}The young man glances at the bodies of the inquisitors, then turns around.{/n} "Oh Desna, why, in doing what is right, must we so often be forced to spill blood where it is not necessary? Can this really be the price of the true path, and of freedom?"
column4: {n}Mladík pohlédne na těla inkvizitorů a pak se otočí.{/n} „Ó Desno, proč musíme při činění dobra tak často prolévat krev tam, kde to není nutné? Může to být opravdu cena pravé cesty a svobody?“

column2: Anyway, thank you. I'd have been done for without you.
column3: Anyway, thank you. I'd have been done for without you.
column4: „Každopádně, děkuji. Bez tebe bych byl ztracen.“

column2: I got a little confused about what was right and what wasn't. Our stunt with the Wardstone... I mean, it's — it's my burden to bear.
column3: I got a little confused about what was right and what wasn't. Our stunt with the Wardstone... I mean, it's — it's my burden to bear.
column4: „Trochu jsem si popletl, co bylo správné a co ne. Náš kousek s Wardstone… myslím, že je to — je to mé břímě nést.“

column2:
Anevia,
If you're reading this, know that I'm alive and I'm rallying a troop of survivors to rise to the city's defense. We're going to fight our way to the Defender's Heart tavern, set up our command there, and hold the line until help arrives, or if the goddess wills it — we'll launch an attack on the Gray Garrison.
I love you, and I trust that we will see each other again in this world.
Irabeth

„Hm.“	jaccard_high:1.00_no_czech
47200	There's a letter on one side of the paper, and on the other, a hastily drawn map of the dungeons, with a mark in one spot.
To anyone who can help us —

column1: My name is Harkel, and I'm chief of the Nasty Waifs gang. Recently we raided the Tower of Estrod in Kenabres, and with Norgorber's blessing we took quite a haul. We hid in a reliable place with bad reputation, somewhere the law would never think of going. We were celebrating our success when Quickrick appeared and choked two of our friends to death. We knew things were bad, because Quickrick had already been dead for about four hours. The old man was a drunk, and his heart had failed on the steep mountain roads. Terrified, we chopped Quickrick into pieces. But a few hours later he came for us again, and he brought with him the two he killed earlier. That's when the real nightmare began, something so bad the mind can't take it. Corpses came back to life, howling, screaming in pain and rage, and killing. The way they killed...

Even now we're sitting in a cave, keeping a wall of fire burning with oil sanctified by the priests of Iomedae. It's the only thing separating us from the mob of walking corpses we once called friends. Praise Norgorber, we took an oil vessel with us from the Tower of Estrod. It won't last another day, if the heat doesn't kill us quicker.

Looks like the Nasty Waifs are done. So, here's our offer. If you can get to Dry River Canyon and get us out of here, we'll honestly return all the loot, show you all our hiding spots, empty our pockets, confess to everything, and accept any punishment except for the gallows. If you want, we'll even sign up to be crusaders. We'd rather die in the mouth of a demon than suffer here forever with our friends.

I know my comrades well, and the man who planted this letter for you will have long ago escaped to the south. I beg you — here's the exact location of the place where the Nasty Waifs are making their final stand.
If you have a drop of mercy in you, save our souls.
Harkel, honest thief and chosen chief of the Nasty Waifs"
column2: Na jedné straně papíru je dopis, na druhé zběžně nakreslená mapa kobek s jedním vyznačeným bodem.
Thinking upon what he's just learned about vescavors, Lann orders his squad to remove their armor. It won't protect them from the beasts, but it will affect their speed and stealth.

column1: The soldiers hesitate, outrage plain on their faces. This new commander is an underground savage, a subhuman, little better than a half-demon, and a snot-nosed kid besides who's barely seen two dozen summers. Who is he to dish out orders to veteran crusaders, and as they march toward certain doom to boot? But discipline reins in their thoughts, and reluctantly they fall in behind him.
column2: Zamyslíce se nad tím, co se právě dozvěděl o vescavors, Lann rozkáže své četě sundat brnění. To je sice neochrání před bestiemi, ale zlepší jejich rychlost a skrytost.

Arrogance plays a cruel joke on the Paralictor of the Hellknights, as he prepares to fulfill his promise to stand firm, "even as the swarm tears the flesh from our bones." These are precisely the orders he's given his troops.

column1: The swarm falls upon them like a raging storm. Hellknights are better armored than regular soldiers, and some are even wearing adamantine. Some have vials of acid, which can wound and deter vescavors for a time.

But the beasts are beyond number, so many that they cannot but find openings in the armor and wriggle their way inside. While one insect is burned with acid, five others circle and strike. A moment later, Regill's troops are a living graveyard, his knights buried under a layer of wriggling and buzzing beasts.
column2: Arogance si dělá krutou legraci s Paralictorem Hellknights, když se chystá splnit svůj slib stát pevně, "i když hejno trhá maso z našich kostí." To jsou právě ty rozkazy, jež dal svým mužům.
But why would I ever do that? You'd better come up to me. Not all of you, of course. Just your head will suffice... Nulkineth, my dear. Bring me {mf|his|her} head!
column3: But why would I ever do that? You'd better come up to me. Not all of you, of course. Just your head will suffice... Nulkineth, my dear. Bring me {mf|jeho|její} head! -> "Ale proč bych to kdy udělala? Raději přijď ke mně. Ne všichni, samozřejmě. Stačí mi tvoje hlava... Nulkinethe, můj drahý. Přines mi {mf|jeho|její} hlavu!"

column2: Where are they keeping the prisoners?

On the nature of rifts
That which we call a 'rift' is in fact close to the complete opposite — a 'suture' or a 'tie.' It is the place where two planes are stitched together, enmeshed to the point of merging.
Two types of rifts are encountered on the borders of the Worldwound — short-term natural rifts and stable, engineered rifts. The latter allow entire armies to pass freely between the Abyss and Golarion. They were created at points where the fabric of reality formed a specific type of 'fold,' where the Material Plane was closest to the Abyss. More information about these 'folds of reality' in former Sarkoris can be found in the Temple of Stone Manuscripts in the ruined city of Iz. Some of my own notes are also held there. I shall only make passing reference to them here.
At the moment of writing, five of these 'folds' have been identified. The most significant one was located near the Threshold fortress, and it was that which made the Worldwound possible. The second most significant rift, the Maiming of Iz, marks the ruins of the famous city. The third rift — the Gates of Midnight — is hidden in the Midnight Fane. The fourth — the Harrowing — leads to my personal laboratory. And, finally, the fifth — the Blood of Pulura — is located near the Sarkorian shrine.
All of the rifts within the perimeter of the Wound function as a single system. In a way, they are like a single entity, or offshoots from a single root. This means that closing them separately is impossible. They will disappear only when the source is uprooted, the main rift — that which some people call the Last Threshold, although it is in fact the true and original Worldwound.
The Wound cannot be closed using ordinary methods. The very manner in which it was opened protects it from interference. The only means of closing it requires...
