Option 1: the Commander, so that's you, launches {mf|himself|herself} out of a catapult and smashes down the fortress wall, allowing the armies to rush inside!
Option 2: the Commander, so that's you again, masquerades as a {mf|succubus|balor} and creeps into Drezen in disguise, and then opens the gates to the crusaders!
Option 3: the Commander, so that's you again, rides to the attack on an enormous mountain goat — or should we call it a 'battering ram'? — and it breaks down the city gates! Well, what say you?
column3: Možnost 1: Commander, tedy ty, vystřelí {mf|sám|sama} z katapultu a rozbije hradní zeď, čímž umožní armádám vtrhnout dovnitř!

column2: A hefty notebook in a thick leather cover, every inch of which has been nibbled on by insects. There are dark streaks of dried blood on the binding. Documented inside, in small, precise handwriting, are the experiments of Xanthir Vang. The records mostly describe complex magical processes, the deciphering of which would take several days at least, but there are scattered passages written in less esoteric language:

column1: ...telepathy — a dead end. I need a way to control the insects directly, with my will alone, bypassing conscious thought entirely.
Parasitism/symbiosis? Test subjects' skin is gradually ingested, replaced by the swarm. Result: failure. How do I stop them from eating through tissue?

What is flesh? What is a body part? Planting larvae in the fatty tissues under the effect of (indecipherable). The test subjects report pain when the hatching insects pierce through. The next step is to test it on myself.
Gradual amputation of the left hand, phalanx by phalanx. Focus on phantom pains! Success: the locusts take the form of fingers (only half of the fourth and all of the fifth finger, for now).

The locusts are still not completely responsive to my will — but enough to be able to write this with my new hands. The next problem: the brain. Dispersed cognition? Removing consciousness to the astral plane?
The test subject retains awareness when locusts replace up to 2/3 of the brain.
Trepanation... Success... Vision... Unusual effect...
Extremely itchy scalp.
column2: Silný zápisník v tlusté kožené vazbě, každý centimetr poškozen hmyzem. Na hřbetu jsou temné pruhy zaschlé krve. Uvnitř, drobným přesným písmem, jsou zaznamenány experimenty Xanthir Vanga. Záznamy většinou popisují složité magické procesy, jejichž rozluštění by zabralo nejméně několik dní, avšak tu a tam se najdou úseky psané méně ezoterickým jazykem:

{n}A tall young man gives you a friendly nod. He has golden hair, and a healthy color in his cheeks.{/n} "Whew, did I do some work with my axe today! We won't have to worry about wood for a long time. Now, is there something you need? Vammy, put some food on the table, we have company!"
column3: {n}A tall young man gives you a friendly nod. He has golden hair, and a healthy color in his cheeks.{/n} "Whew, did I do some work with my axe today! We won't have to worry about wood for a long time. Now, is there something you need? Vammy, put some food on the table, we have company!"
column5: (Vysoký mladík ti přátelsky přikývne. Má zlaté vlasy a zdravou barvu v tvářích.) \Uf, dnes jsem s sekerou něco odpracoval! Na dřevo nebudeme dlouho myslet. Teď, co potřebuješ? Vammy, dej něco k jídlu, máme hosta!\""

column2: Maybe I just haven't been here long enough to lose the flab, ha ha. But I'll never be scrawny. Big-boned, you see! {n}The man bursts into laughter, though it carries a note of sadness.{/n} "This village has been through so much. It's suffered a great deal. Anyone who isn't crying all day cries out in their sleep from the nightmares. I'm even a little ashamed to be the only one who's healthy here. But I take the responsibility seriously. If anyone attacks us, I'll be the first to protect my own."
column3: Maybe I just haven't been here long enough to lose the flab, ha ha. But I'll never be scrawny. Big-boned, you see! {n}The man bursts into laughter, though it carries a note of sadness.{/n} "This village has been through so much. It's suffered a great deal. Anyone who isn't crying all day cries out in their sleep from the nightmares. I'm even a little ashamed to be the only one who's healthy here. But I take the responsibility seriously. If anyone attacks us, I'll be the first to protect my own."
column5: \Možná tu nejsem dost dlouho na to, abych shodil tuk, ha ha. Ale nikdy nebudu vychrtlý. Jsem prostě silné postavy, víš!\" (Muž se rozesměje, v smíchu však zní nádech smutku.) \"Tato vesnice toho zažila tolik. Hodně trpěla. Kdo tu celý den nepláče, ten ve spánku křičí kvůli nočním můrám. Je mi i trochu hanba být tady jediný zdravý. Ale beru tu zodpovědnost vážně. Když nás někdo napadne, budu první, kdo ochrání své.\""

column2: {n}The young man seems flustered, and quickly looks away.{/n} "Well... I'm actually a local, by birth, but my family fled a long, long time ago. They still live in the River Kingdoms, but I came back. I always dreamed about these places, although I'd never seen them. I just knew I had to be here."
column3: {n}The young man seems flustered, and quickly looks away.{/n} "Well... I'm actually a local, by birth, but my family fled a long, long time ago. They still live in the River Kingdoms, but I came back. I always dreamed about these places, although I'd never seen them. I just knew I had to be here."
column5: (Mladík vypadá zmateně a rychle odvrací zrak.) \No... vlastně jsem rodilý místní, ale má rodina uprchla dávno, dávno. Stále žijí v River Kingdoms, ale já jsem se vrátil. Vždy jsem o těchto místech snil, ač jsem je nikdy neviděl. Prostě jsem věděl, že tu musím být.\""

column2: {n}The young woman, mute with horror, finally comes to life.{/n} "Ravon is my brother! My cousin! He only came back recently and hasn't seen the horrors that we have. But he's good! I mean, a good warrior!"
column3: {n}The young woman, mute with horror, finally comes to life.{/n} "Ravon is my brother! My cousin! He only came back recently and hasn't seen the horrors that we have. But he's good! I mean, a good warrior!"
column5: (Mladá žena, strnule hrůzou, konečně ožívá.) \Ravon je můj bratr! Můj bratranec! Vrátil se teprve nedávno a neviděl ty hrůzy, které my ano. Ale je dobrý! Myslím dobrý válečník!\""

column2: {n}The young man pauses to think.{/n} "Many people have been lost here, but with such distinctive armor... no, I haven't seen anyone. And truth be told, I don't pay much attention to armor. I'm used to going light — just my axe, nothing else."
column3: {n}The young man pauses to think.{/n} "Many people have been lost here, but with such distinctive armor... no, I haven't seen anyone. And truth be told, I don't pay much attention to armor. I'm used to going light — just my axe, nothing else."
column5: (Mladík se na chvíli zarazí.) \Mnoho lidí tu zmizelo, ale s tak výrazným brněním... ne, nikoho jsem neviděl. A upřímně řečeno, moc se brnění nezabývám. Jsem zvyklý na lehkou výbavu — jen sekera, nic víc.\""

column2: {n}The trembling young woman clasps her hands to her chest. Her fingers are clenched so tightly her knuckles are white.{/n} "We saw no crusaders, and no armor! Go away, and leave us alone!"
column3: {n}The trembling young woman clasps her hands to her chest. Her fingers are clenched so tightly her knuckles are white.{/n} "We saw no crusaders, and no armor! Go away, and leave us alone!"
column5: (Třesoucí se mladá žena přitiskne ruce k hrudi. Prsty má sevřené tak pevně, že jsou klouby bílé.) \Neviděli jsme žádné křižáky ani brnění! Odejdi a nech nás být!\""

column2: {n}The young man sighs heavily.{/n} "Well, there's no point in denying it. Yes, I found a dead soldier and took his armor. It looked expensive, so I thought I'd sell it, or give it to a blacksmith to reforge into something useful..."
column3: {n}The young man sighs heavily.{/n} "Well, there's no point in denying it. Yes, I found a dead soldier and took his armor. It looked expensive, so I thought I'd sell it, or give it to a blacksmith to reforge into something useful..."
column5: (Mladík těžce vydechne.) \No, nemá smysl to popírat. Ano, našel jsem mrtvého vojáka a vzal jeho brnění. Vypadalo draze, tak jsem si řekl, že ho prodám, nebo dám kováři, ať ho přetaví do něčeho užitečného...\""

column2: {n}The young woman is almost in tears.{/n} "No, Ravon, don't say anything! The authorities in Drezen will think you're a murderer and take you! No!"
column3: {n}The young woman is almost in tears.{/n} "No, Ravon, don't say anything! The authorities in Drezen will think you're a murderer and take you! No!"
column5: (Mladá žena je téměř u slz.) \Ne, Ravone, nic neříkej! Úřady v Drezen si budou myslet, že jsi vrah, a vezmou tě! Ne!\""

column2: I'm not guilty of anything. I only came here recently, so I haven't even had time to make trouble!
column3: I'm not guilty of anything. I only came here recently, so I haven't even had time to make trouble!
column5: Nejsem v ničem vinen. Jen jsem se sem nedávno přistěhoval, takže jsem neměl čas dělat problémy!

column2: {n}The young man looks at you sullenly.{/n} "There, I confessed about the armor. What else do you want? You can't take me away and put me on trial, you know. I'm a local, a Sarkorian. I have to be tried here."
column3: {n}The young man looks at you sullenly.{/n} "There, I confessed about the armor. What else do you want? You can't take me away and put me on trial, you know. I'm a local, a Sarkorian. I have to be tried here."
column5: (Mladík se na tebe mrzutě podívá.) \Tak, přiznal jsem se k tomu s brněním. Co ještě chceš? Nemůžeš mě odvézt a postavit před soud, víš. Jsem místní, Sarkorian. Musím být souzen tady.\""

column2: He is innocent! And if he did do something, it's our business here in Wintersun. It doesn't concern you!
column3: He is innocent! And if he did do something, it's our business here in Wintersun. It doesn't concern you!
column5: Je nevinen! A kdyby něco udělal, je to naše věc tady ve Wintersun. Tě to nezajímá!

column2: I won't give him to you! He won't go back to Drezen!
column3: I won't give him to you! He won't go back to Drezen!
column5: Nevydám ti ho! Nevrátí se do Drezen!

column2: Come back any time! We're always glad to have company, right? Vammy? Why are you being so shy?
column3: Come back any time! We're always glad to have company, right? Vammy? Why are you being so shy?
column5: Vrať se kdykoli! Vždy rádi přijmeme hosty, že? Vammy? Proč jsi tak stydlivá?

column2: No, no! I misspoke! That's not what I meant! He won't go back to the River Kingdoms.
column3: No, no! I misspoke! That's not what I meant! He won't go back to the River Kingdoms.
column5: Ne, ne! Špatně jsem se vyjádřil! To jsem nemyslel! Nevrátí se do River Kingdoms.

column2: All right, Vamona, enough. It's no use pretending anymore. I'll end up in Drezen, one way or another. This is my armor, Commander. I am Count Orvenn Dalmora of Ormiravon. Until recently, I had the honor of being an officer in the army of Her Majesty, Queen Galfrey, and then I served under your command, but not for long. When I saw Vamona and the others, I realized I was needed here. Someone has to protect her, and rebuild the village, and I'm healthier and stronger than the locals.
column3: All right, Vamona, enough. It's no use pretending anymore. I'll end up in Drezen, one way or another. This is my armor, Commander. I am Count Orvenn Dalmora of Ormiravon. Until recently, I had the honor of being an officer in the army of Her Majesty, Queen Galfrey, and then I served under your command, but not for long. When I saw Vamona and the others, I realized I was needed here. Someone has to protect her, and rebuild the village, and I'm healthier and stronger than the locals.
column5: Tak dobře, Vamono, dost. Už nemá smysl se dál přetvařovat. Dopadnu v Drezen, jedním či druhým způsobem. To je mé brnění, Veliteli. Jsem hrabě Orvenn Dalmora z Ormiravonu. Až donedávna jsem měl čest být důstojníkem v armádě Jejího Veličenstva, Queen Galfrey, a pak jsem sloužil pod tvým velením, ale ne dlouho. Když jsem viděl Vamonu a ostatní, uvědomil jsem si, že jsem tu potřeba. Někdo ji musí chránit a obnovit vesnici, a já jsem zdravější a silnější než místní.

column2: If you want to try me as a deserter, then do so, but if you have any compassion in your heart, please send my armor to my parents and tell them I'm not coming back. They are more concerned about the fate of my older brother, and I don't want to be a burden to them. I'll live happily here with my wife, if you'll just let me.
column3: If you want to try me as a deserter, then do so, but if you have any compassion in your heart, please send my armor to my parents and tell them I'm not coming back. They are more concerned about the fate of my older brother, and I don't want to be a burden to them. I'll live happily here with my wife, if you'll just let me.
column5: Jestli mě chceš soudit jako dezertera, udělej to, ale pokud máš aspoň trochu soucitu, pošli mé brnění mým rodičům a řekni jim, že se nevrátím. Mají větší starost o osud mého staršího bratra a nechci jim být břemenem. Budu tu šťastně žít se svou ženou, když mi to dovolíš.

column2: {n}The young woman cries silently, her head bowed in grief.{/n}
column3: {n}The young woman cries silently, her head bowed in grief.{/n}
column5: (Mladá žena tiše pláče, skloněná hlavou v žalu.)

column2: {n}The short, black-haired young woman looks scared to death and doesn't seem to hear a word he says.{/n}
column3: {n}The short, black-haired young woman looks scared to death and doesn't seem to hear a word he says.{/n}
column5: (Nízká černovlasá žena vypadá, že se bojí k smrti a jako by neslyšela ani slovo.)

column2: I have made my decision. Count Orvenn Dalmora of Ormiravon, you shall be stripped of all rank and sent to join the Condemned as a deserter.
column3: I have made my decision. Count Orvenn Dalmora of Ormiravon, you shall be stripped of all rank and sent to join the Condemned as a deserter.
column5: Rozhodl jsem se. Hrabě Orvenn Dalmora z Ormiravonu, budeš zbaven všech hodností a poslán mezi {g|condemned}Condemned{/g} jako dezerter.

column2: I have made my decision. Orvenn Dalmora, Count of Ormiravon, perished in the Wound. The armor will be returned to the family, sent back to his parents in Nerosyan. As for Ravon the Sarkorian, he is free.
column3: I have made my decision. Orvenn Dalmora, Count of Ormiravon, perished in the Wound. The armor will be returned to the family, sent back to his parents in Nerosyan. As for Ravon the Sarkorian, he is free.
column5: Rozhodl jsem se. Orvenn Dalmora, hrabě z Ormiravonu, zahynul ve Woundu. Brnění bude vráceno rodině, odesláno zpět jeho rodičům v Nerosyan. Co se týče Ravona Sarkoriana, je volný.

column2: I have made my decision. Count Orvenn Dalmora of Ormiravon, you are free to renounce your title and your oaths, but in return, Wintersun must pay reparation to Drezen covering the cost of an officer's full gear. If Wintersun cannot, or will not do this, you shall go to prison.
column3: I have made my decision. Count Orvenn Dalmora of Ormiravon, you are free to renounce your title and your oaths, but in return, Wintersun must pay reparation to Drezen covering the cost of an officer's full gear. If Wintersun cannot, or will not do this, you shall go to prison.
column5: Rozhodl jsem se. Hrabě Orvenn Dalmora z Ormiravonu, máš možnost zříci se svého titulu a přísah, ale výměnou musí Wintersun uhradit Drezenu náhradu odpovídající ceně plného výstroje důstojníka. Pokud Wintersun nemůže nebo nechce toto učinit, půjdeš do vězení.

column2: Orven Dalmora, Count of Ormiravon, is accused of desertion. The count staged his own death and fled to Wintersun, where he's been masquerading as a Sarkorian by the name of Ravon. What do you have to say for yourself, defendant?
column3: Orven Dalmora, Count of Ormiravon, is accused of desertion. The count staged his own death and fled to Wintersun, where he's been masquerading as a Sarkorian by the name of Ravon. What do you have to say for yourself, defendant?
column5: Orven Dalmora, hrabě z Ormiravonu, je obviněn z dezerce. Hrabě předstíral vlastní smrt a uprchl do Wintersun, kde se vydává za Sarkoriana jménem Ravon. Co na to máš, obžalovaný?

column2: If you have a heart, you'll let me go! No one knows I ran away! Everyone thinks I'm dead. They've already mourned me, so let it stay that way. Don't take me away from Vammy, my Vamona. She's all I need in life!
column3: If you have a heart, you'll let me go! No one knows I ran away! Everyone thinks I'm dead. They've already mourned me, so let it stay that way. Don't take me away from Vammy, my Vamona. She's all I need in life!
column5: Má-liš srdce, nech mě jít! Nikdo neví, že jsem utekl! Všichni si myslí, že jsem mrtvý. Už za mě truchlili, tak ať to tak zůstane. Neodváděj mě od Vammy, mé Vamony. Ona je vše, co v životě potřebuji!

column2: {n}Irabeth is hesitant.{/n} "We can't let a deserter get away with this, but... he didn't just abandon the army. He also gave up his title and wealth for this god-forsaken village. I think he is a noble, sincere man who made a mistake."
column3: {n}Irabeth is hesitant.{/n} "We can't let a deserter get away with this, but... he didn't just abandon the army. He also gave up his title and wealth for this god-forsaken village. I think he is a noble, sincere man who made a mistake."
column5: (Irabeth váhá.) \Nemůžeme nechat dezertera tak projít, ale... on neodstoupil jen od armády. Také se vzdal svého titulu a majetku pro tuto bohem zapomenutou vesnici. Myslím, že je to urozený, upřímný muž, který udělal chybu.\""

column2: {n}Melies looks bored.{/n} "By the gods, I've never seen such drama! If you want this little noble to keep playing at the barbarian peasant life — the delights of which will wear thin after a few short months — just ask Wintersun to send you a soldier to replace him, and everyone will be happy."
column3: {n}Melies looks bored.{/n} "By the gods, I've never seen such drama! If you want this little noble to keep playing at the barbarian peasant life — the delights of which will wear thin after a few short months — just ask Wintersun to send you a soldier to replace him, and everyone will be happy."
column5: (Melies vypadá znuděně.) \Při bozích, nikdy jsem neviděl takové drama! Pokud chceš, aby tenhle malý šlechtic dál hrál barbarského sedláka — po pár měsících ho to přejde — prostě požádej Wintersun, aby ti poslal vojáka na jeho místo, a všichni budou spokojeni.\""

column2: {n}Vamona is choked with sobs. For a moment, Ravon is unable to move, too dazed to even to take her into his arms. Then, he erupts in anger.{/n} "I'll be back. Even if they send me to the Abyss, I'll be back, and we'll live a peaceful life. Just wait for me, do you hear?"
column3: {n}Vamona is choked with sobs. For a moment, Ravon is unable to move, too dazed to even to take her into his arms. Then, he erupts in anger.{/n} "I'll be back. Even if they send me to the Abyss, I'll be back, and we'll live a peaceful life. Just wait for me, do you hear?"
column5: (Vamona je uškrcena vzlyky. Chvíli je Ravon neschopen se pohnout, příliš omráčený, aby ji alespoň objal. Pak vybuchne vztekem.) \Vrátím se. I kdyby mě poslali do Abyss, vrátím se a budeme žít v klidu. Počkej na mě, slyšíš?\""

column2: {n}Ravon bows to you.{/n} "I will never forget your kindness, Commander. We'll name our firstborn child after you, I swear!"
column3: {n}Ravon bows to you.{/n} "I will never forget your kindness, Commander. We'll name our firstborn child after you, I swear!"
column5: (Ravon se ti ukloní.) \Nikdy nezapomenu tvou dobrotu, Veliteli. Pojmenujeme naše prvorozené dítě po tobě, přísahám!\""

column2: {n}Vamona wipes away tears of joy.{/n} "They will! They can! I'll convince them, we'll think of something! Oh, thank you, Commander, thank you!"
column3: {n}Vamona wipes away tears of joy.{/n} "They will! They can! I'll convince them, we'll think of something! Oh, thank you, Commander, thank you!"
column5: (Vamona si utírá slzy radosti.) \Budou! Mohou! Přesvědčím je, něco vymyslíme! Ó, děkuji, Veliteli, děkuji!\""

column2: {n}Ravon bows to you.{/n} "I will never forget your kindness, Commander. We'll name our firstborn child after you, I swear!"
column3: {n}Ravon bows to you.{/n} "I will never forget your kindness, Commander. We'll name our firstborn child after you, I swear!"
column5: (Ravon se ti ukloní.) \Nikdy nezapomenu tvou dobrotu, Veliteli. Pojmenujeme naše prvorozené dítě po tobě, přísahám!\""

column2: {n}Irabeth looks at you gratefully.{/n} "I think you have made an honorable decision, Commander."
column3: {n}Irabeth looks at you gratefully.{/n} "I think you have made an honorable decision, Commander."
column5: (Irabeth se na tebe dívá vděčně.) \Myslím, že jsi učinil čestné rozhodnutí, Veliteli.\""

column2: {n}Vamona wipes away tears of joy.{/n} "Oh, thank you, Commander, thank you!"
column3: {n}Vamona wipes away tears of joy.{/n} "Oh, thank you, Commander, thank you!"
column5: (Vamona si utírá slzy radosti.) \Ó, děkuji, Veliteli, děkuji!\""

column2: Do you want to return? Well, I know a way to join the {g|condemned}Condemned{/g}, and still come back alive. I can tell you about the terms of the contract...
column3: Do you want to return? Well, I know a way to join the {g|condemned}Condemned{/g}, and still come back alive. I can tell you about the terms of the contract...
column5: Chceš se vrátit? No, znám způsob, jak se připojit k {g|condemned}Condemned{/g} a přitom se vrátit živý. Mohu ti povědět o podmínkách smlouvy...

column2: All right, I'll look into it now.
column3: All right, I'll look into it now.
column5: Dobrá, hned se na to podívám.

column2: A search for armor? I don't have time for this right now. Maybe later.
column3: A search for armor? I don't have time for this right now. Maybe later.
column5: Hledání brnění? Teď na to nemám čas. Možná později.

column2:
Material Plane, planet of Golarion, Kingdom of Mendev, fortress of Drezen
Contract for the provision of special powers No. ___ dated ____
This contract is an agreement between
____________________
hereinafter the 'SOUL SELLER'
and
____________________
hereinafter the 'SOUL BUYER'
Upon signing this contract, the SOUL SELLER and the SOUL BUYER shall undertake to fulfill the following provisions:
1) Hell and Lord Asmodeus, represented by the SOUL BUYER, shall issue a loan to the SOUL SELLER in the form of abilities of a magical nature. These abilities shall exceed those of an average mortal mage, and shall be granted for the full duration of the remaining period of the SOUL SELLER's life, up until the moment of the SOUL SELLER's death.
2) The SOUL SELLER undertakes before Hell and Lord Asmodeus, represented by the SOUL BUYER, to surrender the SOUL SELLER's own soul to the SOUL BUYER, fully and indivisibly in perpetuity, at the moment of the SOUL SELLER's death.
3) The SOUL BUYER shall collect the soul of the SOUL SELLER at the moment of the SOUL SELLER's death, and deliver it to Hell, where the soul shall be engaged in the service of Lord Asmodeus for all eternity.
4) The SOUL SELLER shall not use the abilities obtained as a result of signing this contract against the SOUL BUYER and/or the SOUL BUYER's representatives. Any breach of the fourth clause of this contract shall incur a penalty in the form of the immediate collection of the SOUL SELLER's soul, by means of the mortification of the SOUL SELLER.
5) Upon execution of the third clause of this contract, Hell, represented by devils and archdevils, is free to do with the SOUL SELLER's soul as it deems appropriate. All complaints regarding postmortem handling of the soul in Hell shall be deemed null and void.
SOUL SELLER
________/(Full Name)
SOUL BUYER
________/(Full Name)
Date of Signing:
I hereby consent to the above agreement regarding the procurement and processing of the SOUL SELLER's soul, and do hereby affirm that the signature on this contract is the SOUL SELLER's true personal name: (Signature of the SOUL SELLER) ____
Glory to Lord Asmodeus!

54360	Hahaha! Hahahahaha!"
I convened the Council of Truth to...
column3: I convened the Council of Truth to... -> "Svolal jsem Radu Pravdy, abych..."

column2: Wait, isn't it the Council of Deliverance?
column3: Wait, isn't it the Council of Deliverance? -> "Počkej, není to Rada Vysvobození?"

column2: We voted, and decided on the Council of Truth.
column3: We voted, and decided on the Council of Truth. -> "Hlasovali jsme a rozhodli se pro Radu Pravdy."

column2: For the love of everything unholy, would you stop this already! You are confusing our dear guest. {name}, my sweet, this Council, whatever its name is, has a single purpose: finding a way to rid Golarion of the Worldwound. The Council was first convened shortly after the Wound was opened, and...
column3: For the love of everything unholy, would you stop this already! You are confusing our dear guest. {name}, my sweet, this Council, whatever its name is, has a single purpose: finding a way to rid Golarion of the Worldwound. The Council was first convened shortly after the Wound was opened, and... -> "Pro lásku všeho neblahého, mohl bys s tím už přestat! Mate našeho drahého hosta. {name}, drahoušku, tato Rada, ať už se jmenuje jakkoli, má jediný účel: nalézt způsob, jak zbavit Golarion Worldwound. Rada byla poprvé svolána krátce poté, co se Wound otevřela, a..."

column2: ...judging by the fact that you have to lead another crusade, it has not been very successful so far. But we are working on it! Sooner or later, we'll triumph... Or not. It depends on which version of the future you perceive.
column3: ...judging by the fact that you have to lead another crusade, it has not been very successful so far. But we are working on it! Sooner or later, we'll triumph... Or not. It depends on which version of the future you perceive. -> "...soudě podle toho, že musíš vést další křížovou výpravu, zatím moc úspěšná nebyla. Ale pracujeme na tom! Dříve nebo později zvítězíme... nebo ne. Záleží na tom, kterou verzi budoucnosti vnímáš."
Hm... Well, we, we... -> "Hm... Nuže, my, my..."

column2: No, we didn't! It was a tie!
column3: No, we didn't! It was a tie! -> "Ne, neudělali jsme! Byla remíza!"
We've discussed the situation thoroughly... -> "Situaci jsme důkladně prodiskutovali..."

column2: We have a common goal. Just like us, you wish to overcome the Worldwound, and have already achieved some success. Socothbenoth is right, it is most appropriate for your voice to be heard on this Council.
column3: We have a common goal. Just like us, you wish to overcome the Worldwound, and have already achieved some success. Socothbenoth is right, it is most appropriate for your voice to be heard on this Council. -> "Máme společný cíl. Stejně jako my chceš překonat Worldwound a už jsi dosáhl jistých úspěchů. Socothbenoth má pravdu, je nejvhodnější, aby tvůj hlas byl v této Radě slyšet."

column2: We don't expect you to serve up a solution to us on a silver platter. For now, I simply brought you here to introduce you to the Council, and to bring you, so to speak, into our circle.
column3: We don't expect you to serve up a solution to us on a silver platter. For now, I simply brought you here to introduce you to the Council, and to bring you, so to speak, into our circle. -> "Nečekáme, že nám naservíruješ řešení na stříbrném podnose. Prozatím jsem tě sem přivedl jen proto, abych tě představil Radě a takříkajíc uvedl do našeho kruhu."

column2: Wonderful vibrations emanate from you. I feel our fate turning for the better. With a lucky charm like you, we simply cannot help but win!
column3: Wonderful vibrations emanate from you. I feel our fate turning for the better. With a lucky charm like you, we simply cannot help but win! -> "Z tebe vyzařují nádherné vibrace. Cítím, jak se náš osud obrací k lepšímu. S takovým talismanem jako ty prostě nemůžeme nevyhrát!"

column2: In that case, this meeting is adjourned. {Name}, welcome to our inner circle. I recommend that you talk to each member of the Council informally, in a more relaxed setting. When it's time for a new meeting, we'll notify you.
column3: In that case, this meeting is adjourned. {Name}, welcome to our inner circle. I recommend that you talk to each member of the Council informally, in a more relaxed setting. When it's time for a new meeting, we'll notify you. -> "V tom případě je toto zasedání ukončeno. {Name}, vítej v našem vnitřním kruhu. Doporučuji, abys mluvil s každým členem Rady neformálně, v uvolněnějším prostředí. Až nastane čas dalšího zasedání, dáme ti vědět."

column2: You can be sure that I have plans for you... but now is not the time. When the moment comes, I will share them with you, and I'm certain you will like what I have in mind! For now though, go mingle — I did introduce you into high society, of a sort!
column3: You can be sure that I have plans for you... but now is not the time. When the moment comes, I will share them with you, and I'm certain you will like what I have in mind! For now though, go mingle — I did introduce you into high society, of a sort! -> "Můžeš si být jist, že mám pro tebe plány... ale teď není ten správný čas. Až přijde chvíle, podělím se s tebou o ně a jsem si jist, že se ti bude líbit, co mám v úmyslu! Prozatím ale jdi mezi lidi — uvedl jsem tě do vyšší společnosti, tak nějak!"

column2: Tempting the tempter? Mmm... {n}Socothbenoth reaches for your face, but his fingers stop a hair's breadth from your skin. With a sigh, he reluctantly withdraws his hand.{/n} "Believe me, I've been dreaming about it from the moment I saw you... But if we rush into this, it might interfere with my plans. Let's refrain — for now. Dream of me! It will make everything sweeter once the dreams come true!"
column3: Tempting the tempter? Mmm... {n}Socothbenoth reaches for your face, but his fingers stop a hair's breadth from your skin. With a sigh, he reluctantly withdraws his hand.{/n} "Believe me, I've been dreaming about it from the moment I saw you... But if we rush into this, it might interfere with my plans. Let's refrain — for now. Dream of me! It will make everything sweeter once the dreams come true!" -> "Svádět svůdce? Mmm..." {n}Socothbenoth sáhne k tvému obličeji, ale jeho prsty se zastaví na vlas od tvé kůže. S povzdechem neochotně stáhne ruku.{/n} "Věř mi, snil jsem o tom od chvíle, co jsem tě spatřil... Ale kdybychom do toho spěchali, mohlo by to překazit mé plány. Zdržíme se — prozatím. Sni o mně! Udělá to vše sladším, až se sny naplní!"

column2: {n}At the sound of her name, Socothbenoth's face contorts painfully.{/n} "She is no one to me. Less than no one. Please, don't mention that name without need. Let's talk about someone more pleasant... About me, for example. Or you. Or even Cobblehoof — those muscles, the broad, powerful wings, that strong back! I wish I could ride him, ha ha!"
column3: {n}At the sound of her name, Socothbenoth's face contorts painfully.{/n} "She is no one to me. Less than no one. Please, don't mention that name without need. Let's talk about someone more pleasant... About me, for example. Or you. Or even Cobblehoof — those muscles, the broad, powerful wings, that strong back! I wish I could ride him, ha ha!" -> {n}Na zvuk jejího jména se Socothbenothovi bolestně zkřiví obličej.{/n} "Pro mě ona není nikdo. Méně než nikdo. Prosím, nezmiňuj to jméno bez potřeby. Pojďme mluvit o něčem příjemnějším... Třeba o mně. Nebo o tobě. Nebo dokonce o Cobblehoofovi — ty svaly, široká silná křídla, pevný hřbet! Kéž bych ho mohl jezdit, ha ha!"

column2: Right! My pops, who was also heir to the throne, I guess, used to say there was a cemetery near that waterfall where they put all the Sarkorian nobility in the ground. So there are these gravestones at the cemetery, and the whole royal family is listed on these stone tablets. From the very first kings, to my grandpa, may Pharasma kiss the old geezer's soul! You see, when the demons came, he fled to Mendev. Us Sarkorian kings have lived in exile ever since.
column3: Right! My pops, who was also heir to the throne, I guess, used to say there was a cemetery near that waterfall where they put all the Sarkorian nobility in the ground. So there are these gravestones at the cemetery, and the whole royal family is listed on these stone tablets. From the very first kings, to my grandpa, may Pharasma kiss the old geezer's soul! You see, when the demons came, he fled to Mendev. Us Sarkorian kings have lived in exile ever since. -> "Přesně! Můj táta, který byl prý také dědicem trůnu, říkával, že u toho vodopádu je hřbitov, kam dali všechny sarkoriánské šlechtice do země. Takže u hřbitova jsou náhrobky a celá královská rodina je vytesaná na těchto kamenných tabulích. Od úplně prvních králů až po mého dědu — kéž mu Pharasma políbe duši toho starého mazla! Víš, když přišli démoni, utekl do Mendevu. My sarkoriánští králové žijeme v exilu od té doby."

column2: Now there are demons crawling all over that waterfall, and you can't get to it because of the demon army. But the truth is out there, on the stones! You can't hide the truth, can't overwrite it! When you get my lands back, you can read it all yourself!
column3: Now there are demons crawling all over that waterfall, and you can't get to it because of the demon army. But the truth is out there, on the stones! You can't hide the truth, can't overwrite it! When you get my lands back, you can read it all yourself! -> "Teď tam u toho vodopádu lezou démoni všude kolem a nedostaneš se tam kvůli démoní armádě. Ale pravda je tam venku, na kamenech! Pravdu nelze skrýt, nelze ji přepsat! Až mi vrátíš mé země, můžeš si to celé přečíst sám!"

column2: Um... Maybe they had a stone made for him when he was still alive? Why not? They could've done! I heard in {g|Osirion}Osirion{/g}, when their kings take the throne, they immediately order a tomb to be built. A huge thing, you know, so when they get old enough, it's ready, and the old fool can just lie right down as he pleases, and there you go!
column3: Um... Maybe they had a stone made for him when he was still alive? Why not? They could've done! I heard in {g|Osirion}Osirion{/g}, when their kings take the throne, they immediately order a tomb to be built. A huge thing, you know, so when they get old enough, it's ready, and the old fool can just lie right down as he pleases, and there you go! -> "Ehm... Možná pro něj nechali udělat kámen, když byl ještě naživu? Proč ne? Mohli to udělat! Slyšel jsem v {g|Osirion}Osirion{/g}, že když jejich králové nastoupí na trůn, okamžitě nařídí postavit hrobku. Obrovskou věc, víš, takže když zestárnou, je připravená a ten starý blázen se tam může prostě pohodlně uložit, a hotovo!"

column2: No, no, wait, it wasn't like that. I've remembered! The stones are magical there! Spirits write the names of the kings on them! Pretty handy, eh? I guess my name might be there too!
column3: No, no, wait, it wasn't like that. I've remembered! The stones are magical there! Spirits write the names of the kings on them! Pretty handy, eh? I guess my name might be there too! -> "Ne, ne, počkej, nebylo to tak. Vzpomněl jsem si! Tam jsou kameny magické! Duchové na nich zapisují jména králů! Docela praktické, že? Asi tam bude i moje jméno!"

column2: {n}Thaberdine gives a loud, startled hiccup and chokes on his beer.{/n} "What? How? There's no way you could've gone there... But then, you're the Commander, you've been to worse places... Fine, fine, I'll tell you!"
column3: {n}Thaberdine gives a loud, startled hiccup and chokes on his beer.{/n} "What? How? There's no way you could've gone there... But then, you're the Commander, you've been to worse places... Fine, fine, I'll tell you!" -> {n}Thaberdine hlasitě, vyděšeně škytne a začne se dusit pivem.{/n} "Co? Jak? Není možné, že bys tam byl... Ale jsi Velitel, byl jsi i v horších místech... Dobře, dobře, řeknu ti to!"

column2: First of all, my name should be there — Thaberdine Quintissimus Hierophantel! When I was born, the name appeared on a stone tablet. It's magical, you haven't forgotten that, have you? Before me, there'd be my pops, Badgil the Ugly Mug... I mean no, that's what I called him, as his son. His full name is Badgillion Uglymugius Hierophantel! Before him, there was our grandpa, the one who fled from demons, Ge... Ga... Geschtinal Geezerius Hierophantel!
column3: First of all, my name should be there — Thaberdine Quintissimus Hierophantel! When I was born, the name appeared on a stone tablet. It's magical, you haven't forgotten that, have you? Before me, there'd be my pops, Badgil the Ugly Mug... I mean no, that's what I called him, as his son. His full name is Badgillion Uglymugius Hierophantel! Before him, there was our grandpa, the one who fled from demons, Ge... Ga... Geschtinal Geezerius Hierophantel! -> "Především tam má být mé jméno — Thaberdine Quintissimus Hierophantel! Když jsem se narodil, jméno se objevilo na kamenné desce. Je to magické, na to přece nezapomněl, že? Před mnou tam bude můj táta, Badgil the Ugly Mug... tedy ne, to mu tak říkám jako jeho syn. Jeho celé jméno je Badgillion Uglymugius Hierophantel! Před ním byl náš děda, ten, který utekl před démony, Ge... Ga... Geschtinal Geezerius Hierophantel!"

column2: I know them all by heart, I can list everyone since the founding of Sarkoris! Before my grandpa, there was King... King... {n}Thaberdine's yellow eyes shift around the tavern.{/n} "King Tableman! Before him — Queen Pinta Beera. Before her — the great ruler Sanwidge the Breadslasher, who slew an army of trolls by himself, and invented broth with dumplings!"
column3: I know them all by heart, I can list everyone since the founding of Sarkoris! Before my grandpa, there was King... King... {n}Thaberdine's yellow eyes shift around the tavern.{/n} "King Tableman! Before him — Queen Pinta Beera. Before her — the great ruler Sanwidge the Breadslasher, who slew an army of trolls by himself, and invented broth with dumplings!" -> "Znám je všechny nazpaměť, dokážu vyjmenovat každého od založení Sarkoris! Před mým dědečkem byl král... král..." {n}Thaberdineovy žluté oči se rozhlédnou po krčmě.{/n} "Král Tableman! Před ním — královna Pinta Beera. Před ní — veliký vládce Sanwidge the Breadslasher, který sám zmasakroval armádu trollů a vynalezl vývar s knedlíčky!"

column2: {n}Your power resonates with each of Thaberdine's shameless lies. The ancient letters on the stone tablet waver and shimmer like a mirage. You feel as if you can bring the tales of this drunken false king to life!{/n}
column3: {n}Your power resonates with each of Thaberdine's shameless lies. The ancient letters on the stone tablet waver and shimmer like a mirage. You feel as if you can bring the tales of this drunken false king to life!{/n} -> {n}Tvoje moc rezonuje s každou z Thaberdinových nestydatých lží. Starobylá písmena na kamenné desce se vlní a třpytí jako fatamorgána. Máš pocit, že bys mohl oživit příběhy toho opilého falešného krále!{/n}

column2: I... But... {n}Thaberdine squirms beneath your gaze, and begins to stuff his pockets with pieces of partially eaten bread and meat.{/n} "I'm king, you know... Will you exile me from my own family lands?"
column3: I... But... {n}Thaberdine squirms beneath your gaze, and begins to stuff his pockets with pieces of partially eaten bread and meat.{/n} "I'm king, you know... Will you exile me from my own family lands?" -> "Já... Ale..." {n}Thaberdine se kroutí pod tvým pohledem a začne si cpát kapsy kousky nedojedeného chleba a masa.{/n} "Jsem král, víš... Vyženeš mě z mých vlastních rodových statků?"

column2: But, but... Pfft, some commander you are! Hurt an honest man for nothing! All right, all right, I got it, I'm leaving. I'll just, you know, for the road... {n}Thaberdine gulps down a mug of beer, then another, and then grabs a third tankard as he runs out of the tavern.{/n}
column3: Ale, ale... Pff, to je teda velitel! Ublížit poctivému muži bezdůvodně! Dobře, dobře, rozumím, jdu. Prostě, víš, na cestu... {n}Thaberdine lokne půllitr piva, pak další a když utíká ven z krčmy, chytne třetí korbel.{/n}

column2: W-what? {n}As Thaberdine stares at the stone tablet in your hands, his yellow eyes widen. The ancient, moss-covered letters repeat his words exactly.{/n} "Ha! I said so! It's all true, down to the last word! There's even a crest, just like the one on my sword!"
column3: W-what? {n}As Thaberdine stares at the stone tablet in your hands, his yellow eyes widen. The ancient, moss-covered letters repeat his words exactly.{/n} "Ha! I said so! It's all true, down to the last word! There's even a crest, just like the one on my sword!" -> "Co- cože?" {n}Když Thaberdine zírá na kamennou desku v tvých rukou, jeho žluté oči se rozšíří. Starobylá, mechem pokrytá písmena opakují jeho slova přesně.{/n} "Ha! Říkal jsem to! Je to všechno pravda, do posledního slova! Je tu dokonce erb, přesně jako ten na mém meči!"

column2: Ouch, what's that in my pocket? {n}Thaberdine puts his hand in his pocket, rummages for a few long moments, then takes out an intricate, golden coronet. The words "I AM KING" are engraved on the coronet in large letters.{/n} "I'll be... I even have a crown! I already knew that, though. I've always had it, I just forgot." {n}The newly minted monarch of Sarkoris puts his hands on his hips.{/n} "Since we've proven what no one ever doubted was true, why don't we hold a coronation for me? I think it's about time!"
column3: Au, co to mám v kapse? {n}Thaberdine strčí ruku do kapsy, dlouho tam hledá, a pak vytáhne propracovanou zlatou korunku. Na korunce jsou velkými písmeny vyryta slova "I AM KING".{/n} "No teda... Mám dokonce korunu! To jsem už věděl. Vždycky jsem ji měl, jen jsem zapomněl." {n}Novopečený panovník Sarkoris si založí ruce v bok.{/n} "Jelikož jsme dokázali to, o čem nikdo nikdy nepochyboval, proč pro mě neudělat korunovaci? Myslím, že je na čase!"

column2: Where'd I get it? What do you mean? From my pops, and he got it from grandpa. I've always carried it with me. Just forgot to show you... {n}Thaberdine scratches his head, as if uncertain of his own words, but then drowns his doubts with a gulp of beer.{/n} "Right, it's always been here, because I'm the real king! What kind of king doesn't have a crown, I ask you?"
column3: Kde jsem ji vzal? Co tím myslíš? Od táty, a on ji dostal od dědy. Vždycky jsem ji nosil u sebe. Jen jsem zapomněl ukázat... {n}Thaberdine si poškrábe hlavu, jako by si nebyl jistý svými slovy, ale pak své pochyby spláchne douškem piva.{/n} "No vidíš, vždycky tu byla, protože jsem pravý král! Co to je za krále, který nemá korunu, ptám se tě?"

column2: Right! Now you're talking! I said it was about time!
column3: Right! Now you're talking! I said it was about time! -> "Přesně! Teď už mluvíš správně! Říkal jsem, že je na čase!"

column2: The song? Ah, it's an ancient Sarkorian ballad! About knights and heroes and all that. My pops used to sing when he was in his cups... Poured his heart and soul into the words, even brought me to tears!
column3: Ta píseň? Ach, to je starodávná sarkoriánská balada! O rytířích a hrdinech a tak dále. Můj táta ji zpíval, když byl náladový... Vkládal do slov své srdce i duši, až mě to rozplakalo!

column2: Go! Go forth to new feats! Here's to you, Commander! {n}Thaberdine salutes you with a mug, and takes a drink.{/n}
column3: Jdi! Vykroč k novým činům! Na tebe, Veliteli! {n}Thaberdine tě pozdraví korbelem a upije.{/n}

column2: Wasn't there any booze you could've brought back? No? Well, it's all right, a magic bottle's not too bad. We know how to work with our hands, thank the gods, and just you watch, we'll learn to make the miracle liquor!
column3: Wasn't there any booze you could've brought back? No? Well, it's all right, a magic bottle's not too bad. We know how to work with our hands, thank the gods, and just you watch, we'll learn to make the miracle liquor! -> "Nepřivezl jsi nic k pití? Ne? No nic, kouzelná lahev taky není špatná. Umíme pracovat rukama, díky bohům, a koukej, naučíme se vyrábět zázračný mok!"

column2: {n}The friendly smiles of those gathered around the table display a collection of teeth so rotten, they could be featured in a teaching manual at a school of dentistry. Bleary-eyed drunkards, merry bards, cunning cheats, young men and women of easy virtue dressed in flashy attire... All of them are trying to show how glad they are to see you.{/n}
column3: {n}Přátelské úsměvy těch, kdo sedí kolem stolu, odhalují soubor zubů tak shnilých, že by se hodily do učebnice zubního lékařství. Ospalí opilci, veselí bardové, lišáci podvodníci, mladí muži a ženy lehké ctnosti oblečení v nápadném, kýčovitém šatu... Všichni se snaží ukázat, jak moc mají radost, že tě vidí.{/n}

column2: {n}Thaberdine wipes away a sudden tear from his eye.{/n} "You're my best subject! You do everything I tell you to! I... I love you like my own {mf|son|daughter}. So if you ever need my kingly help, you just ask." {n}The drunkard hiccups loudly, overcome with emotion.{/n}
column3: {n}Thaberdine wipes away a sudden tear from his eye.{/n} "You're my best subject! You do everything I tell you to! I... I love you like my own {mf|son|daughter}. So if you ever need my kingly help, you just ask." {n}The drunkard hiccups loudly, overcome with emotion.{/n} -> {n}Thaberdine setře náhle slzu z oka.{/n} "Jsi můj nejlepší poddaný! Děláš vše, co ti přikážu! Já... miluji tě jako vlastního {mf|syn|dcera}. Takže kdybys někdy potřeboval mou královskou pomoc, stačí říct." {n}Opilec hlasitě škytne, pohlcen emocemi.{/n}

column2: Ah, if it isn't the Commander! And I was just thinking, 'Where'd my best military leader go?' Hey, everyone, a toast to the Commander! Bottoms up, no stopping!
column3: Ah, není to Velitel? A zrovna jsem si říkal: 'Kde se poděl můj nejlepší vojenský vůdce?' Hej, všichni, přípitek na Velitele! Na zdraví, bez zastavení!

column2: The letter was written in haste and left unfinished.

column1:
Glory to Lord Baphomet!
Lady Hepzamirah, you should know that the Ivory Sanctum has been raided. The crusader forces are no doubt continuing their offensive. In light of their victory, it has become dangerous to maintain an underground sect in this region. I trust that Lord Baphomet would value a living Zanedra more highly than a dead one. Therefore I hope that he will not punish us for our forced retreat. The commander of the crusaders is too dangerous for us to sit here under {mf|his|her} nose. I have summoned all loyal members of the sect. When all is ready, we will set out west via secret routes. I am relying on you to...
column2: Dopis byl napsán ve spěchu a zůstal nedokončen.

{n}It's hard to read anything on the exhausted, dirty faces of these destitute beings. There's nothing but dull anger, humiliating fear, and burning greed flickering in their eyes as they look at your coin purse.{/n}
column3: {n}It's hard to read anything on the exhausted, dirty faces of these destitute beings. There's nothing but dull anger, humiliating fear, and burning greed flickering in their eyes as they look at your coin purse.{/n}

column2: {n}The beggars mutter in frustration then return to their usual business of begging and cursing. Several gobs of spit land at your feet, but they are launched with such dexterity that you cannot detect who is responsible for the insult.{/n}
column3: {n}The beggars mutter in frustration then return to their usual business of begging and cursing. Several gobs of spit land at your feet, but they are launched with such dexterity that you cannot detect who is responsible for the insult.{/n}

column2: {n}The beggar holds your gaze for a long moment then scoffs and turns away defiantly.{/n}
column3: {n}The beggar holds your gaze for a long moment then scoffs and turns away defiantly.{/n}

column2: {n}The beggar leader picks at his ear with his knobby, dirty-nailed finger then says,{/n} "A filthy pile of garbage once named Ziforian begs at the entrance to the Battlebliss, the gladiator arena. That's where you'll find him."
column3: {n}The beggar leader picks at his ear with his knobby, dirty-nailed finger then says,{/n} "A filthy pile of garbage once named Ziforian begs at the entrance to the Battlebliss, the gladiator arena. That's where you'll find him."

column2: {n}The demon's stone countenance continues to radiate contemptuous indifference, but his widened eyes indicate that your threat made an impact. The demon speaks in a deliberately harsh tone to compensate for his loss of face.{/n} "No one should lay a hand on the beggars of Alushinyrra. Fate has already ruined us, shattering our lives in the most capricious ways. Anyone who dares to hurt us casts doubt on the ingenuity and maliciousness of Fate. You're trying to commit a blasphemous act and I cannot allow it."
column3: {n}The demon's stone countenance continues to radiate contemptuous indifference, but his widened eyes indicate that your threat made an impact. The demon speaks in a deliberately harsh tone to compensate for his loss of face.{/n} "No one should lay a hand on the beggars of Alushinyrra. Fate has already ruined us, shattering our lives in the most capricious ways. Anyone who dares to hurt us casts doubt on the ingenuity and maliciousness of Fate. You're trying to commit a blasphemous act and I cannot allow it."

column2: {n}His expression still blank, the beggar leader answers indifferently.{/n} "We are filth on the streets of Alushinyrra. No one dares touch us, for we are poison and parasites. Lay a finger on us, and within hours, days, or weeks you will become one of us."
column3: {n}His expression still blank, the beggar leader answers indifferently.{/n} "We are filth on the streets of Alushinyrra. No one dares touch us, for we are poison and parasites. Lay a finger on us, and within hours, days, or weeks you will become one of us."

column2: {n}Instantly turning pale as a ghost, the beggar falls at your feet and meekly mumbles,{/n} "That ring is a sign of my superiority, it gives me authority as the vice-regent of cruel Fate and the shepherd of these poor creatures. I beg you to return it to me before they tear me apart, and I'll tell you everything you want to know." {n}Glancing up at you, the demon somehow makes you feel paralyzed for an instant. The ring disappears from your hand. The beggar leader regains his composure and gives an imperious nod.{/n} "The deal is sealed."
column3: {n}Instantly turning pale as a ghost, the beggar falls at your feet and meekly mumbles,{/n} "That ring is a sign of my superiority, it gives me authority as the vice-regent of cruel Fate and the shepherd of these poor creatures. I beg you to return it to me before they tear me apart, and I'll tell you everything you want to know." {n}Glancing up at you, the demon somehow makes you feel paralyzed for an instant. The ring disappears from your hand. The beggar leader regains his composure and gives an imperious nod.{/n} "The deal is sealed."

column2: {n}When you unclench your fist to reveal the ring, you instead see a molar, yellowed with traces of plaque, in the palm of your hand. The light-fingered vagrant who outsmarted you allows himself a contemptuous smirk.{/n} "You shouldn't steal from beggars — else you just might steal our troubles and poverty for yourself."
column3: {n}When you unclench your fist to reveal the ring, you instead see a molar, yellowed with traces of plaque, in the palm of your hand. The light-fingered vagrant who outsmarted you allows himself a contemptuous smirk.{/n} "You shouldn't steal from beggars — else you just might steal our troubles and poverty for yourself."

column2: {n}A beggar who, despite his foul rags, behaves like the monarch of these squalid slums, speaks sternly to you:{/n} "If you want to buy information, go to the Bad Luck. Beggars do not trade in gossip, they don't sell anything at all. They merely beg for alms and give others a chance to lift them out of poverty. Go away and do not bother us again."
column3: {n}A beggar who, despite his foul rags, behaves like the monarch of these squalid slums, speaks sternly to you:{/n} "If you want to buy information, go to the Bad Luck. Beggars do not trade in gossip, they don't sell anything at all. They merely beg for alms and give others a chance to lift them out of poverty. Go away and do not bother us again."

column2: {n}A beggar with a blank, emotionless face makes a regal gesture. His every move proclaims him a leader of this dirty and desperate lot.{/n} "You are a stranger here in Alushinyrra. You have no respect for filth nor do you fear misfortune. But Our Lady in Shadow has spread her black wings over you, and she respects filth. That's why we'll tell you where to find the one you seek."
column3: {n}A beggar with a blank, emotionless face makes a regal gesture. His every move proclaims him a leader of this dirty and desperate lot.{/n} "You are a stranger here in Alushinyrra. You have no respect for filth nor do you fear misfortune. But Our Lady in Shadow has spread her black wings over you, and she respects filth. That's why we'll tell you where to find the one you seek."

column2: Be careful with them. These beggars are different from the ones on Golarion. They were rejected even by the society of the Abyss. Just imagine what type of person you must be if even demons don't want to deal with you.
column3: Be careful with them. These beggars are different from the ones on Golarion. They were rejected even by the society of the Abyss. Just imagine what type of person you must be if even demons don't want to deal with you.

column2: They are not as helpless as they may seem, and their leader is untouchable. They say even the Lady in Shadow sometimes seeks his counsel, and some say that... that it is Alushinyrra herself, who has assumed the form of an ordinary demon in order to communicate with those who inhabit her.
column3: They are not as helpless as they may seem, and their leader is untouchable. They say even the Lady in Shadow sometimes seeks his counsel, and some say that... that it is Alushinyrra herself, who has assumed the form of an ordinary demon in order to communicate with those who inhabit her.

column2: I wonder why they beg for coins? What do they want to buy? Actually, no... I don't want to know. If I find out, I'm sure I will only be upset, or angry, or disgusted!
column3: I wonder why they beg for coins? What do they want to buy? Actually, no... I don't want to know. If I find out, I'm sure I will only be upset, or angry, or disgusted!

column2: Those beggars... Better be careful around them. I've heard rumors. They are not mere street rabble. Many are afraid of offending them, even the rich and powerful.
column3: Those beggars... Better be careful around them. I've heard rumors. They are not mere street rabble. Many are afraid of offending them, even the rich and powerful.

column2: In the River City, no one seemed to be afraid of offending beggars. The rich would hold their noses and walk past us and powerful people would kick us out of their way... Why is that? Are demons kinder than crusaders?
column3: In the River City, no one seemed to be afraid of offending beggars. The rich would hold their noses and walk past us and powerful people would kick us out of their way... Why is that? Are demons kinder than crusaders?

column2: You don't understand. Some say that these beggars possess certain powers. I've heard terrible things. Maybe it's just gossip. But no one wants to take the risk of putting it to the test.
column3: You don't understand. Some say that these beggars possess certain powers. I've heard terrible things. Maybe it's just gossip. But no one wants to take the risk of putting it to the test.

column2: The crumpled sheet of paper is covered in lines penned by an unsteady hand, with many blotches and crossed-out words.

column1: Hello, my sweet. I finally had a chance to pick up your letters. Your concern about my well-being is touching, but I'm afraid I have worse things to fear than the kiss of your dragonskin lash. Let me be frank: I am in deep (the next several lines are struck out). The Kenabres operation was a disaster, and all the blame was laid at my feet. Now (a large inkblot here). I am afraid to visit you because I am likely being watched by Baphomet's servants. Anyone seen near me is in grave danger. You are a nasty piece of work, to be sure, but I am not going to set you up this way. I wish... (the rest of the lines were crossed out so fiercely the quill tore through the paper)
column2: Zmuchlaný list papíru je popsaný řádky psanými chvějící se rukou, s mnoha skvrnami a přeškrtnutými slovy.

column1: identical;jaccard_high:1.00_no_czech;contains_source

column2:
Key to the Last Threshold
Many mortal researchers have ventured to turn their scientific curiosity on the phenomenon that is the Worldwound, noting that 'it appears to have a life of its own.' Strange natural phenomena, spontaneously arising ruptures, unique vegetation, and living creatures found neither on Golarion nor in the Abyss, everything is constantly in flux, appearing and disappearing at unpredictable intervals. Through this movement and alteration, if not through its order, one can detect the logical functioning of the organs of a living being.
The truth is that, indeed, the Worldwound possesses a semblance of life, and its very structure presupposes a connection to a living soul. This line of reasoning sometimes leads me to... unscientific implications. Namely, if the creation is in essence a reflection of the creator, then can we say that the Worldwound is a reflection of my soul?
The Worldwound was created and then improved, and at the same time, a being of duality was cobbled together from the essence of the Abyss and the essence of a mortal soul. Normally, this process requires an essence taken from a creature with strength comparable to that of an empyreal or Abyssal lord, but there are ways to circumvent this requirement. In particular, through the use of the Nahyndrian crystal's rare power.
In this section, I refer to this being as the 'Key,' an instrument that allowed me to significantly expand and strengthen my original creation. Due to {mf|his|her} dual nature and connection to the Worldwound, the Key was given the opportunity to obtain amazing powers. However, everything has a price. The Worldwound is linked to the Key, but the Key is also linked to the Worldwound, and carries it in {mf|his|her} soul, like a deadly affliction.
This affliction is, indeed, fatal. The duality of the soul grants amazing powers, and primes the soul's owner for Transformation and for the bestowing of incredible abilities. But this duality is also slowly killing the soul's owner. This is a problem I have yet to solve.
column3:
Klíč k poslední hranici	too_short:0.01
63042	Your power is of the same kind as that of {g|Nulkineth}Nulkineth{/g}, {g|Jerribeth}Jerribeth{/g}, and the other demons that you have met. The power of the Nahyndrian crystal, dissolved into the blood, lies within your soul. I have already... hinted at this to you once before, when I left the essence along with the Lexicon of Paradox in my old laboratory, and ordered the Suture to make sure the gift found its way into your hands."

column2: I doubt Mutasafen even knows how to panic. You did not pose a real threat. He cannot be killed through conventional methods. He left because there was nothing else for him to do here. Also, I'm sure he was in a hurry to explain to Hepzamirah why he wasted a few demons on such a stupid escapade. She will not be happy about that. Oh no, she most certainly will not.

column2: The handwriting in this note is very similar to that on the pages of the Lexicon of Paradox.

column1:
I knew you would get through the lock, so I hid the wand of teleportation elsewhere.
I thought we agreed — no excursions to the outside world until after your transmutation lesson. Well?
column2: Písmo v této poznámce je velmi podobné tomu na stránkách Lexicon of Paradox.

...the prisoner was asked three questions: what was the source of her sinful power, who taught her the craft, and what deeds was she intending to pursue by using it?
Having not received an answer, the interrogator called first for the use of simple means of loosening a criminal's tongue, but for the more intricate tools to be kept in clear view also, for the purposes of intimidation.
When these measures failed to produce results...
column3:

64884	Denunciation	Udání	too_short:0.42

column2: As long as my poor herald remains in the hands of that monster, this will not stop. I cannot say if it is still possible to save him, or if putting him out of his misery is the only way. I cannot openly ask you to intervene — but if you decide to do so, you will be helping both yourself and the one who chose the martyr's path when he followed you into the Abyss.
column3: Nevím, co znamená být smrtelným, ale chápu, jak těžké je změnit svou vlastní podstatu. A přesto jsi to udělal — pro nás všechny a pro tento nádherný svět.

column2: What sort of business do you have with me?

The once beautifully bound book is now in a pitiful state — the spine is torn, the cover is burnt, and the pages have been either soiled or ripped out. One of the legends described on the remaining pages is covered in scribbles and crossings-out.

column1: It is said that in times past, there lived a blind mortal woman. Robbed of daylight from birth, without ever having seen the true world around her, she lost her mind at a young age and felt a strange passion for things others avoided like the plague. Above all other pleasures and joys of this world, she cherished death, for... The rest of the line is scratched out, and the handwritten words below read, "...the silly woman had never met a succubus."

Even though the fate was cruel to her, the woman, dubbed the Ashen Lady, was a kind and generous soul — especially toward those who were to her liking. To them, she would give the most precious gift she could imagine — death. The most artful and beautiful of the ends she granted was the ashen death... The page is torn, but you can still make out the writing under the bedraggled edge, "Amateur!"

Many a mortal was sent to a better place by the Ashen Lady, for she was incredibly skilled and deft at her craft. Seemingly weak and helpless, she could bring out the pity and compassion in those dear to her, and these emotions were followed by a swift death. No one could believe that a blind woman was capable of the kind of treachery and stealth that the Ashen Lady employed. Only those who were destined to die by her hand knew the secret — she would mark her victims with a curse and then follow its scent like a tireless hound. You notice a scrawling on the side of the page that reads, "Drivel."

The Ashen Lady would have brought much more misery to her friends and loved ones, had she not received retribution for her sins. Upon hearing word that some crafty murderer had surpassed their own misdeeds with her grim accomplishments, Baphomet's cultists disposed of their rival — they captured her and dragged her down into the Abyss. A scribble on the side reads, "Serves her right! Let the wretch waste away in our cells!"
column2: Kdysi krásně vázaná kniha je nyní v žalostném stavu — hřbet je roztržený, obal spálený a stránky jsou buď znečištěné, nebo vytrhané. Jedna z legend na zbylých stránkách je popsaná čmáranicemi a přeškrtávkami.
A page covered in demonic symbols.

column1:
Master, I humbly ask that you double the number of guards under my command. There are now so many captive Golarians and Nocticula's soldiers that we are being forced to put down the unsupervised surplus. I suggest we remove the guard from the secret passageway where the you-know-whose ghost hides and reduce the number of sentries at the Groaning Gate — either way, no enemy is capable of bursting through them. I would also ask to abolish the need to keep watch over Alderpash's cells — any guard assigned to his chambers gets immediately corrupted by his bribes and promises, becomes his spy, and then has to be executed at once as a warning to the rest.
Beyond that, I would like to report the preposterous behavior of the priestess Svendack — she keeps taking my warriors to perform her sacrifices and demanding that my sorcerers restore the magical barrier around some empty cage every cycle. It's about time someone put that deranged bitch in her place!
Bowing before your deathly glory, your unworthy slave,
Aponavicius

column3: T= ab2! AHAHAHAHA! T= ab2! T= ab2! HA! HA! HA! T = ab2!

column2:
I was convinced that this line of research had reached a dead end, but as it turned out, I just didn't have the right material! Of course, the plane-forming principle is well known, and is quite typical for everything that originates from the Abyss. When there are two things of the same kind, one will try to suppress the other... or devour it. That is why a source of Nahyndrian power will block all other sources of the same power.
However, I've never succeeded in creating a Nahyndrian demon capable of suppressing the Nahyndrian powers of other demons. This outcome is theoretically possible — in fact, it is theoretically probable.
Yet for some reason, all my attempts to create such a demon have ended in failure. So I decided to try a different approach... and it has yielded some excellent results. I have managed to create a Nahyndrian angel capable of suppressing a demon's Nahyndrian powers. Now, this can happen only once, because it requires the subject's termination. But who cares? Angels are expendable. If I manage to recreate the process that Areelu used when implanting Targona's wing, I'll be able to make a dozen of these 'anti-Nahyndrian bombs.' And then... no one in the Abyss will dare to challenge me.
column3:
Myslel jsem si, že tento směr výzkumu narazil na mrtvý bod, ale ukázalo se, že jsem prostě neměl ten správný materiál! Samozřejmě princip vytváření rovin je dobře známý a je typický pro vše, co pochází z Abyssu. Když jsou dvě věci stejného druhu, jedna se pokusí potlačit druhou... nebo ji pohltit. Proto zdroj Nahyndrianské síly zablokuje všechny ostatní zdroje téže síly.	too_short:0.30
74431	{n}A ray of golden light illuminates your face. You hear a solemn choir singing somewhere in the distance. A shining road appears before you, leading Heavenward. The words of the goddess appear in your mind unbidden. Know that I will be happy to welcome you into Heaven after your earthly deeds are completed — if you so desire."{/n}
column4: (Na okamžik šílené světlo v Areeluiných očích ustoupí zvědavosti.) "Ta žízeň po pravdě a vědění... to mi je tak povědomé..."

column2: {n}You hear the voice of the goddess again, but this time, it's not a memory. This time... it's real.{/n} "The legions of Heaven are in need of a new commander. Someone who will stand strong in the face of evil. Someone who will wield a flaming sword against the darkness — not just here, but everywhere light and order are threatened. Will you accept this position? Heaven awaits your decision!"
column3: (Areelu ti věnuje pochmurný, bezvýrazný úsměv a mlčí.)

column2: It's all over. The Worldwound is closed and Deskari has been destroyed. The Rasping Rifts no longer have a demon lord. But a new monster could lay claim to this realm. Is there anything else you would like to do before we leave this abode of evil and horror?
column3: (Areelu na chvíli ztuhne, jako omráčená tvými slovy.) "Spojení? Duchovní příbuzenství? To je tak... podivné..."

column2: Let this be a lesson to every demon lord! They cannot torment the mortal world with impunity! Commander, today you have achieved the greatest victory of all! Your crusade is over, but your story is not finished. Your future awaits! Your glory will live on through the ages!
column3: To říkáš ty... mumlá Suture, zlehka pohlédne na svou paní.

column2: Are you going to accept the invitation?

The crusader grunt was trembling like a leaf, sweat pouring off him, but the ball gag in his mouth stopped him from begging for mercy. He looked askance at the bucket of switches floating in salted water, and his shudders grew more violent as he imagined the Commander personally whipping him in full view of everyone. There were hooks dangling from the ceiling, but the grunt tried not to look at those at all. Irabeth was licking her fangs greedily, running her hand over her sword hilt, and as the grunt tracked her movement, he knew that all the orifices in his body that tightened under her gaze would be gaping wide open by the time this tribunal was over.
Silence reigned in the room, broken only by the creak of tight-fitting leather pants: the Commander had risen from {mf|his|her} seat. The grunt knew what was about to happen, and he closed his eyes against the blow. Suddenly, his jaw was held in an iron grip, forcing his head up. Toying with a whip, the Commander said, I've made my decision: you shall be punished, because you've been a very, very bad boy and I'm very, very displeased with you."

column1: I think you will have to create a separate item in the budget for paddles. Using them on these rankers is sure to wear them out quickly, came the voice of a devil, but the Commander only chuckled and..."
column2:
Řadový křižák se třásl jako list, pot mu stékal po těle, ale koule v ústech mu bránila prosit o milost. Otočil pohledem k vědru proutků plovoucích ve slané vodě a jeho chvění se zhoršilo, jak si představoval, že ho Velitel osobně vyplácí na očích všech. Ze stropu visely háky, ale voják se snažil vůbec na ně nepohlížet. Irabeth si lačně olizovala špičáky, přejížděla rukou po jílci meče, a jak voják sledoval její pohyb, věděl, že všechny otvory na jeho těle, jež se při jejím pohledu stáhly, budou do konce tohoto tribunálu široce otevřeny.	too_short:0.41
79013	...Indulged in a number of gloriously naughty reveries, in this particular order:

column1: — Dreams of sexual intercourse with a beautiful elven princess: one hour;
— Dreams of vigorous sexual intercourse with a squad of muscular southern mercenaries: half an hour;
— Dreams of sexual intercourse with Her Majesty the Queen before, on, and under the royal throne in the Grand Palace of Nerosyan: fifteen minutes per act;
— Dreams of enjoying a barrel full of Kyonin wine, a soft feather bed, and a fine three-course dinner: two hours, including a break to sustain myself with some upliftingly nutritious army rations;

— Dreams of Mendev's bright future where the strict doctrines of the Church of Iomedae are abolished, and dull faces and boredom are punishable by death: ten minutes, interrupted by a sudden twinge of sadness and dismay."
column2:
...Podléhal řadě nádherně nestydatých zasnění, v tomto konkrétním pořadí:	too_short:0.09
79236	Regill..."

We call ourselves the Redeemed Brotherhood. Who we are... {n}Toil scratches the brand on her cheek with gnarled fingers.{/n} "The short answer is we're all scum — convicts, deserters, looters, even a few former cultists. Those who heard our Saint Ember's preaching and decided it wasn't too late to do something better with our lives than throwing them into the Abyss."

column2: Nice and simple! Doing things the old-fashioned way.

A hunt is a clash between the hunter's cunning and the shrewdness of the prey. When the prey expects a trap, the hunter's acumen is put to the test in trying to subvert such expectations. Willodus has proven he understands this fundamental principle.

column1: The Commander bursts through the front door and freezes. For all the tales about the mansion supposedly becoming a citadel, no one is there to assault the unwanted guests. There are no flying arrows, no chilling battlecries, and the expensive furniture hasn't been turned into makeshift barricades. The Commander and {mf|his|her} companions carefully examine the luxurious antechamber. There are two doors leading deeper into the mansion: one bears a symbol of a mirror, and the other, a symbol of a knife. There is a bloody pigeon feather in front of the doors, and a note that contains two words: "Welcome, assassin."
column2: Lov je střet mezi lstí lovce a důvtipem kořisti. Když kořist očekává past, dovednost lovce je zkoušena v snaze tato očekávání překonat. Willodus prokázal, že tento základní princip chápe.

Material Plane, planet of Golarion, Kingdom of Mendev, fortress of Drezen
Contract for the provision of special powers No. 12-59-03
This contract is an agreement between
Greybor, assassin
hereinafter the 'SOUL SELLER'
and
{name}
hereinafter the 'SOUL BUYER'
Upon signing this contract, the SOUL SELLER and the SOUL BUYER shall undertake to fulfill the following provisions:
1) The SOUL BUYER shall pay the agreed-upon rate for the SOUL SELLER's professional services, refrain from demanding that the SOUL SELLER disclose the terms of any previously signed contracts or violate their terms in any other way, and equip the SOUL SELLER in accordance with the requirements of the tasks being performed by the SOUL SELLER, and bestow mythic powers upon the SOUL SELLER.
2) The SOUL SELLER undertakes before Hell and Lord Asmodeus, represented by the SOUL BUYER, to carry out the SOUL BUYER's orders related to the SOUL SELLER's professional services, clean and maintain the equipment received from the SOUL BUYER, refrain from obstructing the SOUL BUYER's activities, and inform the SOUL BUYER immediately about any and all contracts offered to the SOUL SELLER for the purposes of giving the SOUL BUYER an opportunity to purchase the contract offered. The SOUL SELLER shall surrender the SOUL SELLER's own soul to the SOUL BUYER, fully and indivisibly in perpetuity, at the moment of the SOUL SELLER's death, as payment for the use of the SOUL BUYER's mythic powers.
3) The SOUL BUYER shall collect the soul of the SOUL SELLER at the moment of the SOUL SELLER's death, and deliver it to Hell, where the soul shall be engaged in the service of Lord Asmodeus for all eternity. Hell, represented by devils and archdevils, is free to do with the SOUL SELLER's soul as it deems appropriate. All complaints regarding postmortem handling of the soul in Hell shall be deemed null and void.
4) The SOUL SELLER shall not use the abilities obtained as a result of signing this contract against the SOUL BUYER and/or the SOUL BUYER's representatives or violate the aforementioned obligations for any reason, including but not limited to intentional betrayal. Any breach of this clause shall incur a penalty in the form of the immediate collection of the SOUL SELLER's soul, by means of the mortification of the SOUL SELLER.
SOUL SELLER
Greybor
SOUL BUYER
{name}
I hereby consent to the above agreement regarding the procurement and processing of the SOUL SELLER's soul and do hereby affirm that the signature on this contract is the SOUL SELLER's true personal name: Greybor
Glory to Lord Asmodeus!
column3: Material Plane, planeta Golarion, Kingdom of Mendev, pevnost Drezen

column2: This lad's appearance perfectly matches the description of one of the cultists who were supposed to arrive with the lost escort, {n}Regill notes dispassionately, gripping the handle of his weapon.{/n}

column2: We have to deal with this cultist right now. Tell me, Commander, what will you do? {n}Regill's pale yellow eyes stare at you without blinking.{/n}
column3: We have to deal with this cultist right now. Tell me, Commander, what will you do? {n}Regill's pale yellow eyes stare at you without blinking.{/n}

column2: We meet again, Commander. {n}Regill nods calmly.{/n} "I've been waiting for you for some time now. We must begin the search for the missing knights as soon as possible."

column2: {n}Regill scans the top of the hill. Wisps of smoke rise into the air, giving away the location of the Hellknight outpost.{/n} "We must hurry... and remain very, very alert."
column3: {n}Regill scans the top of the hill. Wisps of smoke rise into the air, giving away the location of the Hellknight outpost.{/n} "We must hurry... and remain very, very alert."

column2: The outpost is situated on top of a hill. The main building has stout walls and small windows. It serves as a resting area for various Hellknight Orders. Apart from my own troops, there are currently three chapters quartered here, as well as the permanent garrison. We've stocked up on food and water. The gargoyles have taught us a valuable lesson, and now we're prepared for an aerial attack.
